novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 69: The First Trial (4)
One hour earlier.
I got to my feet and said, "First, let's head to a location we haven't checked yet."
“Won’t they all have been collected by now?"
"That's exactly why we're going. If someone's been there, there should be traces left."
"Ah!"
Seeing that everyone understood, I checked the map and began to lead the way.
Among the team members, Jeong Hyeon was also skilled at reading maps, but he wasn't the type to take the lead.
We walked through the forest path for a while.
"Someone's definitely been here."
Following the traces left behind, we began tracking.
"Th-this way, Y-Young Master."
And when it came to tracking, Jeong Hyeon provided the greatest assistance.
'Hehehe. Once we take care of this group, we're practically guaranteed a top ranking.'
As I thought about lazing around in hiding after this one fight, we continued following the traces for a while.
"......"
At some point, there was no longer any need for Jeong Hyeon to lead the way.
The trail was far too obvious.
While I couldn't help but chuckle at tracks that practically screamed, 'Come catch me,' Jeong Hyeon, who was keeping about a hundred paces distance, voiced his opinion in a voice as soft as an ant crawling.
"I-It looks like th-they're p-preparing a m-meal."
The forest path was in disarray, and bloodstains and animal fur suggested they'd been hunting. It was a perfectly reasonable deduction.
"This is our chance."
I nodded and briefly outlined our detailed strategy.
"Jeong Hyeon, track their location and find a good sniping position. I'll stealthily approach. Meanwhile, I'll approach as close as possible using stealth techniques. When I'm close, our two baits—no, Choi Woong and Ju Seo-yeon—will make noise as a distraction."
Having done this before, the team members nodded and immediately went into action.
As I approached the location Jeong Hyeon had found using stealth techniques, I could see faint smoke rising above the trees. It seemed to be from a fire for cooking meat.
Truthfully, we could've just ambushed them during their meal without this elaborate plan.
I alone could handle two or three of them on my own, especially in a situation where they didn’t expect an ambush.
Yet, the reason I was being so cautious wasn't to give my team members a chance to shine...
'What a hassle.'
…but because I didn't want to sweat and reveal my full capabilities yet.
As I got closer to the unsuspecting group, their faces came into view.
The first one I recognized was, of course, Dokgo Pae.
Just as he was about to grab a piece of cooked meat, his gaze shifted towards the direction of the approaching distraction created by the two baits.
Amid everyone's surprise, one rather clever-looking fellow suddenly shouted, "There are four of us, but only two of them are charging in! Something's not right!"
As they began to question this, 'Now!'
Without hesitation, I released my stealth technique and rushed toward Dokgo Pae.
At the same time, an arrow shot by Jeong Hyeon took down one of the disciples who was surprised by my appearance.
Clang!
“You’re both the same kind of treacherous bitch and bastard!!”
Dokgo Pae, whose sword clashed with mine, spouted some nonsense.
Of course, it was none of my business.
Swish.
Just as Dokgo Pae, his face red with anger, tried to overpower me with his signature forceful swordsmanship, I, having anticipated this, used his momentum against him and redirected the path of his blade.
Naturally, his stance crumbled.
Thud!
Seizing the opening, I struck his pressure point.
While I handled Dokgo Pae, Choi Woong and Ju Seo-yeon each engaged another opponent.
"Choi Woong! Since when did you become so petty?!"
Upon a closer look, I recognized the man who was complaining to Choi Woong with an indignant expression. He was among the trio who got beaten up by me on my second day here.
He seemed quite upset about being backstabbed by a friend.
Of course, that too was none of my business.
Thud!
I quietly approached the man fighting Choi Woong and struck him with the flat of my sword, then pressed the acupuncture point of the fallen man.
"Ugh..."
At the same time, the seemingly clever strategist collapsed after being hit by Ju Seo-yeon's spear.
It wasn't solely due to her skill. Jeong Hyeon's arrows, providing cover from afar, had kept the strategist occupied, allowing the slightly weaker Ju Seo-yeon to subdue him.
‘It seems her recent dedicated training has paid off.’
At the time when that unpleasant rumor was circulating, Ju Seo-yeon was undoubtedly the weakest disciple within the Hall.
It seemed she had managed to grow, albeit slightly, in just about twenty days.
"Young Master! I took down one of them! Aren't I useful?"
Her eyes gleamed with a manic light while she called out like a puppy seeking praise.
'So this is the power of obsession.'
I almost feel bad for Jin Hayeon.
‘Well, achieving the second rank will still be difficult for her, though.’
Dismissing the thought, I instructed Choi Woong and Ju Seo-yeon.
“Now, let's collect our spoils.”
Understanding my intention, they began thoroughly searching the bodies of the four paralyzed disciples.
Choi Woong, being another man, was one thing, but Ju Seo-yeon was also rummaging through the bodies of unfamiliar men without the slightest hesitation.
Well, from Ju Seo-yeon’s perspective, they're probably no different from logs.
Meanwhile, Jeong Hyeon, who had been providing support from a distance, returned.
“Young Master! Dokgo Pae had all three!”
Choi Woong, who was searching on Dokgo Pae's body, exclaimed with an expression of utter joy as he waved three tokens.
A smile also appeared on my face.
"That makes six now."
Six out of ten. First place was already guaranteed. Then there was only one thing left to do.
'Now I just need to find a good hiding spot and relax until the test ends.’
That's what I thought.
Somehow, this test feels more relaxing than attending classes.
Around the time Dokgo Pae's group was being ambushed…
Bang Mi-hwa and her team members were also enjoying their meal.
Just then, one of the candidates, holding a piece of meat but hesitant to eat, cautiously asked Bang Mi-hwa, "Will you really keep your promise?"
To that question, Bang Mi-hwa replied with her characteristically confident smile, "What a silly question. If we collect all ten tokens, giving you one is no issue."
After answering, Bang Mi-hwa swept her gaze over her team members. Strangely, there were five disciples together, including herself.
The reason was simple.
Just as Dokgo Pae had hunted down two separated members and seized their tokens, the remaining two members of that team had also been discovered by Bang Mi-hwa's group.
And instead of subduing both, Bang Mi-hwa made a proposal to one of them.
—If you cooperate with us until the end of this test, I'll return one token to you. If the five of us subdue all the other teams, you can still secure second place with just one token.
It was an enticing proposal to betray his team—or rather, to survive alone and make his team achieve second place.
In the end, that disciple had no choice but to accept Bang Mi-hwa's proposal.
The reason she only made the offer to one of the two was simple.
To reduce the risk of backstabbing.
She judged that if they were traveling with two potential traitors and encountered the other half of their original team, handling a betrayal would become difficult.
Not knowing that Dokgo Pae's group had subdued the remaining two and taken their tokens, she had no choice but to make such a judgment.
Just then, Ha Young, who had been listening quietly, asked.
“Since there are five of us, we should be able to handle Dokgo Pae’s group easily, but what about the Eighth Young Master’s group?”
In truth, they had recruited the member from the other group after their encounter with Dokgo Pae’s team. If they had already been five strong at that time, there would have been no reason to simply let Dokgo Pae’s group leave.
"You mentioned earlier that you had a plan?"
At Ha Young's question, the other team members also turned their heads toward Bang Mi-hwa.
A strategy to deal with the Eighth Young Master, the top student of this class and undeniably the strongest, naturally piqued their curiosity.
Pleased that all attention was focused on her again, Bang Mi-hwa smiled confidently.
"Hohoho. It's simple. Young Master Il-mok is infatuated with me, so he won't be able to attack easily. That’s why while I keep him occupied, the rest of you can take care of the others."
"As expected of Mi-hwa!"
Ha Young, her friend, exclaimed in admiration at her audacious claim.
"......"
The other three simply stared at the two dumbfounded expressions.
However, no one stepped forward to point out her delusion.
Partly because they didn't want to create discord in the team.
‘Well, with five of us, we should be able to manage somehow, right?’
And because one way or another, they thought they had the advantage.
In a secluded corner of Taecheon Peak where the test was taking place…
Il-mok and his team members were leisurely enjoying their rest.
Having collected six of the ten tokens, first place was basically guaranteed.
'Hehehe. If I’m in the same group as the Eighth Young Master next time, I can keep getting good results!'
Choi Woong, who had initially been fearful of being in the same team as Il-mok, was now gleefully realizing that being with Il-mok meant an abundance of benefits.
'I'm going all the way to second rank and making the Young Master impressed! Just wait a little longer, Miss Hayeon!'
Ju Seo-yeon, equally pleased with the results, was lost in her fantasies about Jin Hayeon, wearing a disturbingly manic grin.
Oblivious to their antics, Il-mok was relaxing some distance away, enjoying the peace and quiet.
"......"
Jeong Hyeon was also alone, savoring his solitude.
"Um, excuse me..."
Or rather, he kept trying to muster the courage to speak, hoping to become a little closer during this peaceful moment, but his voice would trail off into a mumble, and he would sink back into silence.
Just then, Jeong Hyeon, who had been too nervous to speak until now, abruptly stood up.
It wasn't that he had gained courage. It was because something serious had arisen.
"S-Someone is ap-approaching."
His voice was still barely a whisper, but his sudden movement drew everyone's attention.
While they were taking a break, they didn’t completely let their guard down.
They had made minimal preparations in case of an ambush.
Since inflicting injuries was forbidden, they had set up simple traps that would make a small noise if someone triggered them. And with his sensitive senses, Jeong Hyeon had not missed that noise, alerting them to the approach of enemies, and then carefully moved to a new position.
He had repositioned himself to a location more suitable for archery in case of a fight.
Il-mok and the other two also prepared themselves while he moved.
Il-mok tilted his head as he observed the enemies approaching through the bushes.
'Five?'
It was strange to see a group of five in a test designed for groups of four. But Il-mok could roughly understand the situation.
‘Did they form a temporary alliance?’
He didn't know the specifics, nor did he need to know the reason for their alliance.
The important thing now was to make a choice: fight or flee.
Il-mok pondered.
'We're one person short, but... the test still has about two hours left....'
Fight now and be done with it? Or run around for another hour?
The deliberation was brief, and Il-mok made his decision.
Clang.
Feeling annoyed, Il-mok decided to fight.
And soon, as their faces became clearly visible through the underbrush, Il-mok realized he had forgotten one important fact.

The moment a woman at the front of the group called out his name…
Il-mok froze like a man cursed by Medusa herself.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 70: The First Test (5)
'Damn it!! I have no choice but to look straight at her face when fighting.’
The moment Il-mok made direct eye contact with Bang Mi-hwa, his obsessive-compulsive symptoms began flaring up.
And while Il-mok hesitated...
Bang Mi-hwa and her team members, who had approached nearby, boldly charged at Il-mok's teammates.
As expected, Bang Mi-hwa charged towards Il-mok, but she wasn't alone.
‘Still, just in case, wouldn’t it be better to have at least one more person provide support?’
It was because Mi-hwa had accepted Ha Young's advice.
Ultimately, Il-mok found himself facing Bang Mi-hwa and one Lower Class disciple.
"Urgh! These annoying bastards!!"
Ha Young and another disciple from the Lower Class charged at Choi Woong.
Lastly, Ju Seo-yeon, the weakest of the group, faced a disciple from a different group.
If there was any silver lining...
Swoooosh!
…it was that Jeong Hyeon, having positioned earlier, provided long-range support for his teammates.
However, that merely prevented the worst-case scenario.
They were barely holding on, thanks to Jeong Hyeon's covering fire.
Il-mok, in particular, was on the verge of losing his mind.
—Now's the time!
—We're fighting because of the test anyway, right?
—Just carve her face as you desired!
—Balance out the left and right sides! She’ll probably be happy about it too!
The other persona burgeoning within his mind relentlessly tempted him to use his sword on Bang Mi-hwa's face. Only the last vestiges of his sanity, recognizing the flawed logic of those inner voices, held him back.
'Test or not, the moment I put my sword to her face, it's over!!'
Subduing opponents without inflicting serious injuries was a prerequisite for combat in this test. A major facial reconstruction surgery would be a blatant violation of that rule.
"Urgh."
Il-mok unconsciously swung his sword, almost slashing Bang Mi-hwa's face, but managed to stop his arm at the last moment.
"Hmph."
Misinterpreting his restraint as affection, Bang Mi-hwa smirked and swung her fan.
'For fuck sake. Let’s at least avoid eye contact for now.’
Il-mok had no choice but to awkwardly avert his gaze while fighting.
He tried to focus only on Bang Mi-hwa's body and weapon, making an effort not to look at her face.
Thanks to that, he managed to hold out, but the basics of fighting involve reading the opponent's movements.
Clang!
"Tsk."
Not being able to read her eyes was a major handicap in many ways, and above all...
"Damn it."
His forced attempts to avoid Bang Mi-hwa's face made his movements awkward and clumsy.
Meanwhile...
Unlike Choi Woong or Il-mok, Ju Seo-yeon, who ended up in a one-on-one match with a single Martial Arts Disciple, was in a somewhat less dire situation.
Obviously, just because she had trained like a madman for twenty days doesn’t mean that her skill had caught up with the rest of her classmates.
Her opponent was from the Upper Class, while she had barely passed the entrance exam for the Hall of the Demonic Way to begin with.
Furthermore, even if she had trained her hardest for twenty days, her opponent hadn't been idle either.
So...
Swoooosh!
She was only managing to hold on thanks to Jeong Hyeon's perfectly timed arrows.
Also, test rules, which prevented the use of dangerous techniques, also played a role.
Thanks to these two factors, Seo-yeon, who had some breathing room, could quickly realize...
...that the current situation was dangerous.
'If we all get subdued like this, I can't achieve the second rank!'
Frankly speaking, if she managed to defeat her opponent with Jeong Hyeon’s help, it would be meaningless if Choi Woong or Il-mok were defeated in the meantime.
Their martial prowess was much greater than hers. Especially the young master, who was considered unmatched in his abilities.
But why was this unmatched figure struggling against just two attackers?
As Ju Seo-yeon's thoughts reached this point, a memory she had completely forgotten suddenly surfaced.
—He's already in love with me, so you'll only end up hurt, Disciple Ju.
Looking at the current situation, the nonsense that Bang Mi-hwa had gone out of her way to tell her in the past doesn’t seem like nonsense after all.
‘So the Young Master’s preferences leaned that way.’
Such a thought naturally crossed her mind, but that wasn't what was important right now.
Ju Seo-yeon, believing that the young master couldn't attack Bang Mi-hwa because of the emotion called love, made a bold decision.
For her goal of becoming the second-ranked disciple within two years, for a rosy future with Jin Hayeon!
Clang!
While her opponent was momentarily distracted after blocking an incoming arrow...
Instead of swinging her spear to attack the enemy, Ju Seo-yeon...
Whoosh!
Suddenly, she launched her body and rushed toward where Il-mok was fighting.
"What!?"
Startled, the confused enemy quickly launched himself and chased after Ju Seo-yeon. He hurriedly swung his sword at her, but it was a bit too late.
Ju Seo-yeon, having launched a surprise dash, threw her entire body directly at Bang Mi-hwa.
"!?"
Caught off guard by the unexpected attack, Bang Mi-hwa, who was about to swing her fan, had to quickly change its trajectory as her opponent threw herself defenseless.
This was because she was supposed to just subdue, not kill or seriously injure.
And in that brief moment when Bang Mi-hwa hesitated, Ju Seo-yeon covered Bang Mi-hwa's face with her entire body...
'Now!'
Freed from the petrifying gaze, Il-mok's sword moved decisively.
The sword lurched like a snake, curving around Ju Seo-yeon’s body and precisely striking Bang Mi-hwa at the paralyzing acupoint.
"Urgh."
In that moment when Bang Mi-hwa's body stiffened from having her acupoint struck...
Thud.
Ju Seo-yeon, who had launched herself, tackled her, and the two of them rolled on the ground together.
Ju Seo-yeon, having also been struck in her paralyzing point by her pursuer mid-lunge, had no leeway to execute a breakfall.
But even while having her acupoint struck, Ju Seo-yeon didn't stop talking.
“I’ll hold her down, Young Master!!”
And Il-mok, now completely freed from the binding, wore a chilling expression.
"Ah, ah. It's been a while. This feeling."
Il-mok's Qi Deviation, triggered by Bang Mi-hwa, had begun.
He didn't exactly massacre the enemies into a thousand pieces.
His obsession had simply transferred to his swordsmanship.
Il-mok's sword moved, drawing a perfect path that would naturally elicit the word beautiful.
"Urgh..."
The disciple who had been double-teaming Il-mok with Bang Mi-hwa was neutralized in a single strike, struck on his paralyzing acupoint.
"...Damn it."
The disciple who had hurriedly chased and subdued Ju Seo-yeon quickly realized something was going wrong and cursed.
Prick
But just as he was about to retreat, Il-mok’s sword, as fast as lightning, had already struck his acupoint.
Having subdued two more in an instant, Il-mok moved with uncharacteristic haste. Not to help Choi Woong, who was facing a combined attack…
Swoosh!
…but simply because only by swinging his sword could he expel the reflux of this maddening compulsion.
"Urgh..."
Caught off guard by Il-mok's sudden intervention, Ha Young and the other disciple attacking Choi Woong couldn't hold out for long before having their pressure points struck as well.
Ju Seo-yeon, who was watching the fight while lying on top of Bang Mi-hwa, exclaimed in an admiring tone.
"As expected of you, young master!"
Even while lying down with her acupoint struck, she couldn't keep her mouth shut.
"Huff. Huff."
Choi Woong, who had been under attack until just now, caught his breath and thought.
'To think we tried to catch someone like this with just three people. I must have been crazy.'
It was a moment when he freshly realized how foolish his past self had been.
Then, Jeong Hyeon, who had retreated far away to provide support from the start, belatedly pushed through the bushes and returned.
"Young... master?"
Stopping ten feet away, Jeong Hyeon called out to Il-mok, who, for some reason, was still gripping his sword and trembling slightly.
Instead of answering the question, Il-mok uttered something completely unexpected.
“Do not approach me.”
With those words, Il-mok suddenly began performing a sword dance.
—Still not enough.
—To make that woman's face symmetrical, I need more precise swordsmanship.
It was a rehearsal for Bang Mi-hwa's plastic surgery, but...
"......."
Faced with that beautiful sword dance, which far surpassed their level, Choi Woong and Jeong Hyeon could only stare in awe.
"Young master! Now that it's over, could you release my acupoint!?"
"Eek! Get off me quickly!"
Only the desperate cries of the oblivious Ju Seo-yeon and the pinned Bang Mi-hwa echoed in the air.
The day after the test ended.
Although everyone was engrossed in martial arts training as usual, there was a somewhat peculiar atmosphere in the hall.
Unlike usual, the martial arts training was being conducted under the supervision of an assistant instructor instead of Instructor Chu Il-hwan, and one by one, disciples were being summoned by the assistant instructor to visit a certain pavilion.
And Instructor Chu Il-hwan was in that very pavilion.
He was conducting individual interviews to discuss the results of yesterday's test.
"Disciple Il-mok, please enter."
At the assistant instructor's summons, Il-mok's face darkened.
It wasn't because the strategy of hiding his abilities had gone down the drain due to yesterday's test.
'To think I have to be alone in a room with that lecherous instructor!'
The mere thought of it made his skin crawl, and now it was about to become reality.
Il-mok entered the pavilion feeling like he was being dragged to a slaughterhouse.
"Welcome."
"Yes, Instructor."
Like Jeong Hyeon, Il-mok maintained a distance of three meters from Chu Il-hwan as he greeted him.
"Please take a seat."
"I prefer to stand, Instructor."
"???"
Chu Il-hwan stared at him with a bewildered look for a moment.
Then, shrugging as if it didn't matter, he asked with a playful smile.
“I saw your sword dance at the end of the test.”
“Ha… Hahaha. I-I suddenly had an enlightenment during the fight.”
Il-mok tried to laugh it off.
He didn't want to be exposed for hiding his skills, and more importantly...
'I can't exactly say it was a rehearsal for plastic surgery!'
It was a complicated story in many ways.
Chu Il-hwan, mistaking Il-mok's answer as a lie, smiled slyly. This update ıs available on NoveI-Fire.ɴet
"Enlightenment... you mean your skills suddenly improved."
"Th-that's right. Hahaha."
"Haha. If that's what you say, well, I guess that's what it is."
Chu Il-hwan narrowed his eyes, a mischievous glint appearing in them as if he had thought of something amusing.
“By the way, I heard a rumor that you and Disciple Bang Mi-hwa are quite close.”
Having observed Il-mok’s group throughout the test, he hadn't missed their final battle. He had seen Il-mok’s initial hesitation to attack Bang Mi-hwa.
Normally, he would have dismissed it as just a baseless rumor, but having seen it with his own eyes, he couldn't help but be suspicious.
Of course, the Hall of the Demonic Way didn't particularly care whether the disciples were in relationships or not; he was simply feeling playful.
And Il-mok, who was about to deny the absurd nonsense from Instructor Chu Il-hwan, realized something important.
‘Why would that lecherous instructor ask such a question? Don't tell me!?’
Quickly composing his expression, Il-mok replied in a solemn tone.
"I can't speak carelessly as someone might get hurt. But let me make one thing clear. I like… women , Instructor.”
"???"
Chu Il-hwan looked at Il-mok with an expression that seemed to question what kind of bullshit he was suddenly spouting.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 71: The First Test (6)
Seeing the bizarre expression on Instructor Chu Il-hwan's usually playful face, I became certain.
'Damn it. So he really did have ulterior motives.'
I was glad I’d made it explicitly clear this time that I’m not interested in men.
Once he’d composed himself, Chu Il‑hwan cleared his throat and said, “Ahem. Anyway, congratulations on gaining enlightenment and improving your skills. I can’t wait to see you become one of the leading figures of the cult after you graduate from this place.”
Seeing his eagerness to conclude the interview, I bowed and quickly exited the pavilion.
‘He must be stung by the rejection.’
Just because someone leans that way doesn't necessarily mean they're a bad person.
No, most likely, the majority aren't.
However, that guy was a psychopath who practiced a Demonic Art. If I let my guard down for even a moment, there was no telling what kind of horrific things might happen.
After Il-mok left, Instructor Chu Il-hwan pondered.
When asked about his relationship with Bang Mi-hwa, he replied that he liked women. Putting together Il-mok’s recent behavior and the rumors circulating…
‘So he’s saying one Bang Mi-hwa isn’t enough to satisfy him.’
As expected of someone so talented, his desire matched his skills.
He'd been surprised by the sudden confession initially, but honestly, Instructor Chu Il-hwan didn't dwell on that part too much.
The Heavenly Demon Divine Cult didn't prohibit polygamy. They prioritized martial prowess and punishing evil, so as long as no one was forced into a relationship and training wasn't neglected for the sake of pleasure, it wasn't a concern.
‘Truly an interesting young master.’
Instructor Chu Il-hwan, who had been snickering, quickly returned to his usual smiling expression when he heard the door open and greeted the next disciple.
"Welcome. Disciple Dokgo."
"Greetings, Instructor."
Despite his generally self-centered behavior, Dokgo Pae showed proper respect to the instructor. Follow current novels on novęlfire.net
'Hmm.'
Chu Il‑hwan watched him sit without being prompted and thought, ‘Second in rank and the eldest grandson of the Dokgo Family. Normally, he would be considered the top talent of the year, such a shame that he falls somewhat short compared to the Eighth Young Master.’
He decided to probe a bit.
"What did you think of this test, Disciple Dokgo?"
"I was disappointed."
"Oh? In what way?"
Expecting some self-criticism, Chu Il-hwan was met instead with a baffling answer.
“Because we weren’t allowed to wound each other, I couldn’t fight properly and was easily defeated. If it had been a fight to the death, things would have been different, Instructor!"
Hearing that bold and confident answer, Chu Il-hwan couldn’t help but smile.
‘I’d like to kill him too, but for different reasons.’
The side effect of the Black Thunder Demonic Palm crawled up his right hand. But he shut the murderous impulse down and forced a smile.
“I see. Since you think that way, I won’t question your martial skill further. I’ll ask about the other aspects. What do you think about the other aspects of this test?”
"Other aspects, sir?"
Seeing Dokgo Pae's confusion, Chu Il-hwan elaborated.
"By now, you must understand that this test wasn't simply about competing in martial arts skills, right?"
"Isn't it enough for a martial artist to excel in martial arts?"
“After graduating from the Demonic Academy, you’ll be assigned to a unit. This training and test are designed to cultivate your ability to carry out the cult’s orders. Martial prowess isn't the end-all be-all in your missions.”
Only then did Dokgo Pae nod in understanding.
“I see what you mean, but it doesn't apply to me."
The moment he heard that stupid remark, Chu Il-hwan felt like the black dragon slumbering in his right hand might go berserk.
Exercising his patience to the limit, Chu Il-hwan forced himself to hear Dokgo Pae’s explanation.
"As the eldest grandson of the Dokgo Family, I’m destined to lead one day. I believe my role is to crush enemies with overwhelming force and leave such trivial matters to others. Ah, come to think of it, during this exam I did find a disciple particularly skilled in those fields. It wouldn't be bad to continue working with that disciple in the future."
Only then was Chu Il-hwan able to calm down the black dragon slumbering in his right hand.
‘Phew. So, his head isn't entirely for decoration.’
After organizing his thoughts, Chu Il-hwan spoke quickly like firing an arrow.
“Good. Recognizing and utilizing your comrade’s strengths and weaknesses is equally important, especially as you rise higher, that ability will become even more necessary."
"I'll be mindful, Instructor."
"Think more about this issue in the future, and you may go now."
Normally, he would have given more detailed criticism, but Instructor Chu Il-hwan quickly dismissed Dokgo Pae.
He feared he might actually kill him if their conversation continued.
Meanwhile, around the same time.
Just as Instructor Chu Il-hwan was conducting interviews for the Upper Class, Instructor Eun Ryeo was also conducting interviews for the Lower Class.
"Disciple Ju Seo-yeon."
In response to the typically prickly and cold-looking Instructor Eun Ryeo's call, Ju Seo-yeon answered with her usual bright face.
"Yes, Instructor."
“Hmm. I’ve heard you’ve improved greatly since enrollment. Was there a reason for this change?”
"It's all thanks to Young Master Il-mok!"
“…Have you forgotten that within the Hall, all disciples are equals? Using ‘Young Master’ may create an awkward atmosphere.”
"I'll be more careful, Instructor!"
Yet, her smile never wavered despite her response.
Instructor Eun Ryeo sighed softly and spoke in her usual curt tone.
“Still, I’m relieved to see you’re clearly on your way to improving yourself. Of course, you’re still a bit lacking in every area, but if you keep training like this, I believe you will catch up to your peers by the time you graduate from the Hall.”
"Instructor. Just catching up isn't enough! I must graduate as the second-ranked disciple!"
"Se-second...?"
For the first time, Instructor Eun Ryeo's icy composure cracked as she looked at Ju Seo-yeon with disbelief.
"Yes, Instructor! I must graduate second so I can be with him!"
"......"
Instructor Eun Ryeo began to spin. Who was this 'him' she was referring to?
'Could she be talking about the Eighth Young Master?'
Suddenly, everything clicked into place. No wonder Ju Seoyeon’s performance has shot up lately.
‘She’d been trying to win his favor all along.’
Having more or less grasped the situation, Instructor Eun Ryeo quickly resumed her usual curt expression and dismissed her.
“Very well. Keep working hard as you have been."
"Yes, Instructor!"
Ju Seo-yeon left the place with confidence in her steps.
"Whew."
Instructor Eun Ryeo let out a deep sigh and rubbed her weary face.
Hearing the arrival of the next disciple shortly after, Instructor Eun Ryeo spoke with her usual tone, "Come in."
At her command, the door slowly opened and a timid disciple cautiously entered.
"Take a seat."
"I, I, I pre-prefer to st-stand, In-Instructor."
Seeing Disciple Jeong Hyeon trying to maintain a distance of about ten feet, Instructor Eun Ryeo barely held back a sigh and maintained her cold expression.
"If that's more comfortable for you, then stand and listen."
"Ye-yes, Instructor."
However, contrary to her frosty expression, the content that came out of Instructor Eun Ryeo's mouth was full of praise.
She commended his long-range support during battles, his hunting skills in procuring food, and his excellent tracking abilities.
After recounting Jeong Hyeon's achievements during this test, Instructor Eun Ryeo concluded her praise by saying, "As far as this test goes, it means that Disciple Jeong ranked at least among the top five in terms of contributions."
In response to Instructor Eun Ryeo's consecutive praises, Jeong Hyeon, who had shrunk his entire body, answered in a small voice with a completely reddened face.
"I-it's all tha-thanks to Yo-Young Master Il-Il-mok."
Instructor Eun Ryeo felt a sense of déjà vu.
'Even though your manner and attitude are different, you're giving exactly the same answer as Disciple Ju Seo-yeon.'
Instructor Eun Ryeo thought that Il-mok somehow seemed destined to become a man with many sins.
For some reason, she gave Jeong Hyeon a different response than she had given Ju Seo-yeon.
"While Disciple Il-mok's leadership was excellent, it was your ability that perfectly carried out your mission, wasn't it?"
Instructor Eun Ryeo hoped that Jeong Hyeon wouldn't rely too excessively on Il-mok. Unlike Ju Seo-yeon, he seemed like he would crumble easily if Il-mok hurt him.
"Also, there's no guarantee that you'll be in the same team as Disciple Il-mok in every future test. Disciple Il-mok led you well because he knows you well, but others won’t. So, from now on, you need to learn to communicate your strengths to your teammates.”
Jeong Hyeon’s face, which had been flushed red, instantly turned deathly pale.
The thought of being paired with strangers and having to explain his abilities to them took his breath away.
Seeing the formerly rosy-cheeked Jeong Hyeon turned pale, Instructor Eun Ryeo sighed softly and gently said, "Would you like to take off your bandages for a moment? You seem uncomfortable.”
Despite the offer, Jeong Hyeon gently shook her head.
"I-I'm fine, Instructor. I-I'm used to it."
As she said this, Jeong Hyeon gently placed a hand on her chest, feeling the tightly wound bandages underneath her clothes, wrapped that way so they wouldn’t interfere with her archery. She also self-consciously touched her short hair, which had been cut for the same reason, and avoided Instructor Eun Ryeo's eyes.
Seeing her anxious appearance, barely managed to hold back another sigh.
“Go outside and take a moment to breathe where no one can see you.”
"Th-thank you, Instructor!"
Watching Jeong Hyeon’s retreating back after her quick salute, Instructor Eun Ryeo finally let out the sigh she had been holding back.
It wasn't a sigh of contempt. It was a sigh filled with pity.
"Haah."
Her expression completely softening, Instructor Eun Ryeo relaxed her tense facial muscles and thought, ‘How should I help that child?’
Startled by her own thoughts, she quickly shook her head.
The side effect of the Demonic Art that Instructor Eun Ryeo had learned was excessive compassion and an inability to refuse.
It was hard for her to bear seeing pitiful people or those who needed her help.
Her constant cold demeanor and blunt speech were a defense mechanism to avoid this very situation. More precisely, to avoid being targeted by those who would feign helplessness to exploit her.
When she used a cold face and a curt tone, the people often got intimidated and gave up asking for a favor. It was a kind of life hack.
Of course, while it was a side effect somewhat suitable for an instructor's position, which required taking care of young disciples, carelessly revealing such a side effect was dangerous.
The role of an instructor was to care for and teach all disciples, rather than focusing all attention on just one or two.
Moreover, if she was swayed by the side effect and succumbed to her excessive sympathy, there was a risk she wouldn't even be able to properly handle her basic duties.
“Phew. That was close.”
Thinking of Jeong Hyeon, who especially stimulated her sympathy, Eun Ryeo breathed out a sigh of relief.
She was certain that if Jeong Hyeon were to cry and tearfully plead for her help, she absolutely wouldn't be able to refuse.
"Ah!"
Instructor Eun Ryeo, who had barely gathered her composure, belatedly realized an important fact and made a regretful expression.
"I forgot about that."
It was something that needed to be shared with others as well, but it was especially important to inform Jeong Hyeon, and she had failed to convey it.
(TL Note: Well, as you can see, the cat is out of the bag, at least to us readers. From the beginning, the author didn’t use a masculine pronoun for Jeong Hyeon. He uses either ‘that person’ or just plainly and directly writes her name when it's from Il-mok's perspective. I’ll use ‘he/him’ on her until Il-mok finds out.)

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 72: Seniors (1)
That evening, after dinner, I crossed the massive central training ground as usual, heading to the secluded place where Jeong Hyeon would be waiting.
Creeeaaak.
With an unpleasant grating sound, the main gate of the Hall of the Demonic Way was opened.
Under the crimson sky painted by the setting sun, I saw a group of just over twenty people cloaked in billowing cloaks briskly entering the Hall of the Demonic Way grounds.
‘Hmm. Come to think of it, there was talk about that.’
I recalled what Instructor Chu Il-hwan had announced after all the interviews had concluded today.
It was news that the second-year disciples of the Hall of the Demonic Way were returning.
The program at the Hall lasted two years. While the first year focused on various basic training, the core of the second year was practical experience.
They would periodically leave the Hall and join martial units or other organizations to perform missions together for about two weeks to a month.
In other words, the seniors who had left for their first practical experience around the time I entered the hall were just now returning.
I briefly observed the seniors, wrapped in their cloaks, crossing the training ground,
I observed the seniors briefly as they crossed the training ground wrapped in flowing cloaks, exuding a solemn atmosphere.
'Well, it’s none of my business.'
I turned away and headed towards the spot where we practiced stealth techniques.
When I arrived, I saw Jeong Hyeon already there, bow drawn and aimed at the empty air.
“Here again today, I see.”
I deliberately kept a distance of about ten feet to accommodate him as I greeted him. Jeong Hyeon quickly turned around and deeply bowed his head.
"I-it's been a while, Young Master!"
“…Didn’t we fight together just yesterday?”
"It, it just somehow f-felt like a long time, Young Master."
"I, I see."
I stepped back another pace when I saw how nervous he was.
“Hic!”
Suddenly, Jeong Hyeon made a brave expression and boldly took a step forward.
And since the distance narrowed again, he became restless again.
‘Did his social anxiety get worse? Why did he brave himself on stepping closer?’
I wondered if he had gone even more unstable due to higher achievements in his Demonic Art.
He looked like he might succumb to Qi Deviation if left alone, so I tried to distract him.
"Ah. Come to think of it, didn't you have an interview today?"
"Yes. Yes! I, I had an interview w-with Instructor Eun Ryeo."
"I see. What did she say about the test?"
Jeong Hyeon’s cheeks flamed as he squirmed in place.
"Sh-she said I did w-well."
He was clearly embarrassed about receiving praise from Instructor Eun Ryeo.
"A-and...."
Jeong Hyeon tried to say something more, but suddenly his face turned pale white.
Then it’s flushed to red before returning to white again.
It was quite a spectacle, to be honest.
‘He’s going to lose it at this rate.’
And my prediction was accurate.
My hunch proved right. Jeong Hyeon snapped his head up, stared at me with fierce determination, and blurted out, “Please stay by my side, Young Master!”
"???"
His declaration left me speechless. Before I could process it—
"Tsk. Flirting in the sacred Hall, what a waste of time.” Orıginal content can be found at novel-fire.net
An unexpected troublemaker emerged from behind.
I turned around to see who it was and saw a man wearing a flowing cloak.
Judging by his attire, he seemed to be one of those senior disciples who had just returned to the Hall of the Demonic Way.
The man with a square jaw and a sturdy build said as I met his gaze, “I came here to reflect on the insights I gained during my expedition, only to find you juniors engaging in such frivolous activity in my training spot. Get lost.”
I couldn't help but laugh.
'What's with this madman? Pick a lane, will you?'
He seemed open‑minded enough to tolerate two guys together and mistaking them for a couple, yet he spoke like a total old fogey.
Setting aside my annoyance, I looked at the side.
"Eek!"
Jeong Hyeon, whose face had been pale white until just now, was turning red again and continued until his face turned an alarming purple.
‘He must be startled by the stranger.’
After pondering briefly what to do, I clicked my tongue lightly and addressed the senior guy.
“Tch. We were here first. If you want to practice that badly, go elsewhere.”
The senior burst into a manic laugh.
“Bwahahaha! You junior has no respect! Fine! Let’s settle this the cult’s way.”
I couldn't help but sigh.
'Why do all these crazy fuckers think exactly the same way?'
Still, I had roughly expected things to turn out this way. Stretching out my left hand, I beckon him.
“Come at me.”
A sinister smile spread across the senior's face at my provocation.
“Alright! Let’s see if you can last until I sort out my enlightenment!!”
With that, he charged straight at me, utilizing his lightness skill.
But as straightforward as it was, his speed was explosive.
The moment I was within his striking range—
Swiiiiish!
—he drew his saber from the scabbard at his waist, demonstrating a fierce drawing technique.
Since he was faster than I could retreat, I sidestepped to the left instead while utilizing my lightness skill.
His drawn blade flew towards me, but—
Clang!
By then, I had already propelled my body to the left and drawn my sword using the power of the Soul-Departing Sword.
Swoosh.
Adding the finesse of the Soul-Guiding Sword to deflect the force, I tried to flick the boar senior's saber upwards, but…
'Oh?'
He was a year my senior for a reason; his saber didn’t give way as easily as Dokgo Pae’s sword.
The boar continued to swing his saber relentlessly, trying to corner me.
‘Is he the same type as that assistant instructor?’
His saber style reminded me of Chu Il-hwan's assistant. It primarily consisted of offense-oriented fast saber techniques. Moreover, it was evident he hadn't just been playing around during his year at the Hall of the Demonic Way. The way he connected his techniques with others was quite natural.
He was definitely several levels above that Dokgo fellow.
However, being still just a disciple, he fell short compared to an instructor.
'In that case.'
After retreating and dodging several times using footwork, I gradually became accustomed to his fighting style and switched tactics.
‘Let's end this quickly with a head-on clash.’
Utilizing the Soul-Cutting Flash, which emphasizes the essence of speed, I unleashed consecutive thrusts.
The rapidly moving sword and saber each created silver trajectories in the air.
Clang! Clang!
Sparks flew as our weapons clashed repeatedly.
After several rapid collisions of sword and saber, it was my side that was gradually being pushed back.
The boar's saber technique wasn't just fast; it also carried tremendous power, making my hands numb with each collision.
"Haaah!"
Seizing an opportunity, he roared and swung his blade with all his might once more—
Swish.
I swung my sword as if to collide with him using the Soul-Cutting Flash. Then, the sword, flying in a straight line, changed its path midway like a snake, slid past the boar’s saber and shot straight towards his throat.
Swish.
"It's over."
Using a feint at the last moment, I stopped my sword just right before his Adam’s apple.
I had narrowly dodged his final strike by twisting my body.
It was a necessary, risky move that I made to end the fight quickly. My risky gamble to end the fight quickly had paid off.
I was confident I could win even with a more confrontational approach, but the reason I chose such a risky move was due to the aftermath of the previous test.
‘Whew. Good thing I finished before the compulsion kicked in.’
All thanks to the previous incident with Bang Mi-hwa.
Fortunately, I had only performed the sword dance using the first fourteen forms of my Demonic Art back then. Thanks to that, my realm didn’t skyrocket and the side effect didn’t worsen.
I was able to calm my obsession down and end the sword dance quickly.
But sparring too long with a senior of this caliber risked unleashing another unwanted enlightenment.
The boar, who was helplessly subdued by the last move, looked down at the sword pointed at his neck with a half-dazed expression.
"Ah!"
As if coming to a realization, he suddenly exclaimed in admiration and burst into laughter.
“Bwahahaha! I was completely outplayed by a junior! To think you’d use that method to create a feint!”
It seemed he had mentally replayed the duel process in that short time.
Of course, I didn't care.
“Well then, please leave now, Senior.”
“Kehahaha! Right. The losers should keep their mouths shut. If you say leave, I must leave. But before I go, I must say this.”
He was indeed a contradictory human.
Since he knows that he is the loser, he should just shut his mouth.
Oblivious to my thoughts, the boar-like senior just kept blabbering.
"I apologize for the misunderstanding. With skills like yours, Junior, you can date all you want. Hahaha! Have a good time!"
Before Jeong Hyeon or I could respond, he wheeled around and strode off, cloak billowing behind him.
'What a madman.'
Then again, in the Demonic Cult, "crazy" was just another word for "normal."
‘Don't think too much about it. It'll trigger my obsession.’
Shaking off the stray thoughts, I turned around and saw Jeong Hyeon’s ashen face.
Watching the senior’s retreating back, who arrived like the wind and left like the wind.
"Are you okay?"
At Il-mok's question, Jeong Hyeon hiccupped with a pale face.
"Hic!"
Thanks to the senior’s rambling, she realized that what she had said earlier could be easily misinterpreted.
‘I-I just meant f-for us to continue being in the same group…’
After receiving Instructor Eun Ryeo’s advice, Jeong Hyeon spent the entire day contemplating what she would do if he and Il-mok were separated for the next test.
The mere thought made her feel suffocated and terrified.
That's why she had asked Il-mok to be by her side.
She couldn’t bear the thought of being in a group with anyone else.
‘I-I need to explain…’
If he misunderstood that she had confessed to him, she needed to clear up the misunderstanding quickly.
If Il-mok had mistaken her words for a confession, she needed to clear up the misunderstanding immediately. Otherwise, he might lose the first friend she had made since learning the Ghost Spirit Divine Bow.
However, the pressure made it even harder for her to speak.
While Jeong Hyeon was fidgeting, not knowing what to do.
Il-mok, who had been watching her for a moment, scratched his head and said, “About what you said just now.”
“N-No, that’s not it. W-What I meant w-was…”
“You meant you wanted to stay in the same group, right?”
"!?"
Jeong Hyeon’s eyes widened in surprise. How did he know?
"Y-yes. That's what I meant, Young Master."
At her answer, Il-mok nodded once and said with an awkward expression, “Assigning the group was up to the instructors' whims, so I can’t give you a definite answer. But still, I’ll try talking to the instructors about it.”
"Th-thank you, Young Master!"
The glue that had been sealing to her mouth seemed to have peeled off, and now words came out comfortably for Jeong Hyeon.
The suffocating tightness in her chest and the overwhelming rush of blood that made her head dizzy vanished instantly.
But why is it?
Despite feeling relieved, Jeong Hyeon felt an inexplicable sense of regret in one corner of her heart.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 73: Seniors (2)
Around the time Il-mok and Jeong Hyeon cleared up their misunderstanding…
Swish.
Someone carefully moved away from that place.
"Phew."
Only after reaching a spot where neither Il-mok nor Jeong Hyeon could hear her did Instructor Eun Ryeo, dressed in tight black stealth clothes and moving through the shadows, finally exhale deeply.
‘I'm glad that worked out.’
In truth, what she had forgotten to tell Jeong Hyeon was precisely about the senior they had just encountered.
That secluded training ground where they practiced stealth techniques daily was actually a training spot frequently used by their Upper Class senior disciple named Mak Ho-yeol.
While it was trivial information for most, to Jeong Hyeon, it was vital.
Given her social anxiety, having a senior suddenly burst in on her would be nothing short of terrifying.
Of course, Eun Ryeo hadn't initially planned to sneak around in nightclothes like this.
“Yes… It’s time for that child to grow up a little.”
She had resolved that, since she’d already missed her chance to warn her, she would let it go.
Although she hadn't told them about Disciple Mak Ho-yeol, she had gathered all the disciples today and informed them that the senior disciples were returning.
Yet the more she tried to brush it off, the more her body grew restless with concern until she couldn't bear it any longer.
That's why she had ended up coming here secretly.
In the end, it was all for nothing, as Il-mok had handled the situation himself without her intervention.
Yet, even though the situation was resolved, Instructor Eun Ryeo's expression wasn't entirely at ease.
It wasn’t that she regretted not intervening in the unsanctioned duel.
Il-mok had stepped in to help Jeong Hyeon after all.
Despite her indifferent facade, Instructor Eun Ryeo had enough flexibility to understand that. If for nothing else, then for poor Jeong Hyeon's sake.
The problem was something else entirely.
'Sigh. Indeed, Disciple Il-mok is growing up to be a man with many sins.'
That poor girl had summoned all her courage to confess her feelings, only for Il-mok to brush her off with that vague excuse.
Watching this scene brimming with the bittersweet flavor of youthful yearning, the unmarried Instructor Eun Ryeo almost found herself in tears out of sympathy for Jeong Hyeon.
Meanwhile.
Having lost to Il-mok and shooed from the training ground, Mak Ho-yeol headed straight for the senior year dormitory, the Black Tiger Pavilion.
“Hmm? Didn’t you say you were going to sort out your enlightenment?”
A fellow second-year candidate asked with a puzzled look upon seeing Mak Ho-yeol return so quickly, which the latter laughed off heartily.
“Hahaha! There was already someone there.”
“Hmm? Someone at this hour? Must be a junior then.”
“That's right. Hahaha. We ended up fighting over the spot, but I got thoroughly beaten by the junior. Huahahaha.”
Seeing Mak Ho-yeol's seemingly unconcerned laughter, the other disciple was bewildered.
'Ho-yeol lost?'
In terms of ranking within their batch, Mak Hoyeol was roughly mid-tier in the Upper Class. However, that was based on the Hall of the Demonic Way’s comprehensive evaluation which included various factors.
However, this evaluation wasn’t entirely accurate, considering that he paid little attention to anything other than martial arts. Fresh chapters posted on NoveIꜰire.net
But if one were to rank him solely based on martial prowess alone, Mak Ho-yeol was amongst the top tier within their batch.
“Did you let your guard down?”
“Me? Caught off guard? Now that’s quite the accusation.”
As flames began to ignite in Mak Ho-yeol's eyes, who had been laughing foolishly until now, the disciple who asked the question laughed awkwardly and waved his hands.
"Just joking. Calm down."
Having been peers for a full year, they were all well aware of each other's personalities and characteristics. In the early months, they’d sparred in secret behind the instructors’ backs, but lately they’d learned to give each other space.
“That you lost even while giving it your all… that’s surprising.”
"Hahaha. I was surprised too. But thanks to that junior, I was able to sort out my enlightenment, so it’s not a bad experience. Hahaha.”
Mak Ho-yeol laughed with his usual simple-mindedness, but his fellow disciple’s expression was complex.
It was understandable.
A one-year gap might not seem like much, but in the Hall, it was substantial enough to be considered significant.
This was a gathering place for the most talented individuals in the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult, where they practiced a form of martial arts known as Demonic Arts.
What is the greatest advantage of Demonic Arts?
It’s their incredibly fast rate of development.
It might be different for those who had reached their pinnacle, but for people at their age, that twelve-month gap is a chasm that normally wouldn’t be able to bridge.
As he pondered what kind of junior could have done this, a piece of information he had heard during a recent expedition surfaced in his mind.
“Maybe that junior is the new youngest disciple the Heavenly Demon just took in.”
"The Heavenly Demon's youngest disciple?"
Seeing Mak Ho-yeol's expression of confusion, the disciple sighed as if he couldn't believe it.
"Didn't you hear what the seniors from the Red Dragon Corps said during this expedition? They said the Heavenly Demon's youngest disciple is rumored to be a genius. And that he was scheduled to enter the Hall of the Demonic Way with this batch."
“Hmm. I think I might have heard something like that… or maybe not. I don't know. Hahaha!”
The sight of his ignorant classmate who thought of nothing but martial arts, made the disciple sigh again.
Just then, one of the nearby disciples who’d overheard them stepped forward.
They had just returned from the expedition, so they were each taking time to get settled. Hearing the ongoing conversation, they couldn’t help but pause their actions.
The disciple who stepped forward, Baek Cheon, raised a question.
"I remember that story too, but something doesn't add up."
"Doesn't add up? What do you mean?"
"Think about it. All the stories about the Eighth Young Master that the Red Dragon Corps seniors shared were about his wisdom. There wasn't any specific mention of his martial prowess, was there?"
The others nodded in agreement..
Some had heard the stories about the youngest disciple; others, like Mak Ho-yeol, had no recollection or simply didn’t care.
Although rumors about Il-mok had spread widely throughout the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult, these disciples were cut off from outside news during their practical training.
They entered the Hall of the Demonic Way around the same time the newly kidnapped Il-mok was forced to join the cult by the Heavenly Demon. And within the Hall, they had almost no means to exchange information with the outside world.
Although the instructors and assistants occasionally visited the main headquarters, no one was frivolous enough to share every rumor or gossip with the disciples.
In other words, they hadn't received any information about Il-mok for a whole year, and only happened to hear about him during their recent practical training with the Red Dragon Corps.
The problem was that the Red Dragon Corps had also been away from headquarters for several months, so they hadn't heard about Il-mok entering the academy as the top scorer.
“Establishing academies in each branch, creating the Pure Mind Hall to treat the side effects of Demonic Arts, advising the First Young Master on achieving Transcendence… Each of these stories is incredibly impressive, but do any of them involve martial prowess? And more importantly…”
Baek Cheon paused briefly, enjoying the attention, then grinned.
“The youngest disciple has only been in the cult for a year. Even if he is chosen by the Heavenly Demon, do you really think it’s possible for him to defeat Ho-yeol in just a year?”
Everyone nearby nodded at the logic of his words.
Even Park Gi-tae, who had initially suggested that the junior might be the youngest disciple, was now convinced otherwise.
Yet one question lingered.
“Then who the hell is this junior?”
"Hmm. If we go by the rumors that circulated before we returned, the most outstanding among them has to be the heir of the Dokgo Family, right?”
Baik Cheon nodded in agreement at that remark and asked Mak Ho-yeol, “The junior you fought, did he wield a sword?”
Mak Ho‑yeol nodded, though doubt clouded his face.
He did, but aren't the Dokgo Family's Nine Swords known for being an overbearing sword style? The junior I fought was a master who freely wielded both swift and flowing sword techniques."
As expected of a martial fanatic, while Mak Ho-yeol might not be interested in other news, he was quite knowledgeable about martial arts and skilled individuals.
As everyone reeled at his answer, Park Gi-tae spoke up, “We’ll never figure it out on our own, so how about calling a junior and asking him?”
“You know one?”
"I know a fellow from before I joined the Hall. That guy should have been good enough to enter the Hall."
A moment later, Park Gi‑tae returned with the junior he’d mentioned.
“Junior Choi Woong greets the senior brothers.”
Choi Woong bowed and gulped nervously.
It wasn't just one or two, but more than a dozen senior disciples were all staring at him. He’d never felt so nervous.
"Hahaha. We're not here to give you a hard time. Relax.”
Baek Cheon said with a hearty laugh, trying to put Choi Woong at ease.
“Oh, by the way, my name is Baek Cheon. You might have heard of me.”
"Yes, I've heard of you, senior."
"Hahaha. I'm glad you've heard of me."
Though Baek Cheon laughed refreshingly, Choi Woong felt a chill run down his spine.
'So this senior is that rascal from the Baek family.'
Baek Cheon was a direct descendant of the Baek Family, one of the five major families known as the Demonic Cult’s Founding Families, along with Hyeokryeon, Ouyang, and Dokgo.
Unlike Dokgo Pae, he wasn't the heir but the second among his siblings.
As Choi Woong recalled information about Baek Cheon internally, Baek Cheon grinned and asked, "I just called you to ask one thing."
"Please ask, senior."
Choi Woong snapped back to attention as Baek Cheon asked, “Tell me, who’s the strongest in your batch?”
Choi Woong initially wondered why they were asking such an obvious question, but then he realized an important fact.
‘Ah, they must be out of touch because they were at the academy.’
After organizing his thoughts, Choi Woong answered, “It's Young Master Il-mok. I don't know if you've heard the news, but he is the youngest disciple newly chosen by the Heavenly Demon, Seniors.”
"!?"
All the gathered senior disciples showed a surprised expression at Choi Woong's answer.
“But… I heard the youngest disciple has only been in the cult for about a year…”
Even Baek Cheon, who had appeared full of confidence, couldn't hide his surprise.
“Ah! I see! The eldest grandson of the Dokgo Family must be more incompetent than I thought!”
Baek Cheon, who had never held good feelings towards the Dokgo Family, blurted out whatever came to mind, but the reaction came from an unexpected place.
“That sounds like you're saying I’m incompetent too.”
The one stepping forward with a crumpled face was Mak Ho-yeol. If the heir of the Dokgo Family was that incompetent to let a newbie in martial arts take the top seat of the first year, then Mak Ho-yeol who had lost to that newbie was nothing more than trash.
Realizing his blunder, Baek Cheon tried to maintain his composure.
'Tch. Fighting with that boar-like fellow would be such a hassle.
Baek Cheon was the top student in their class. But that evaluation was based on the Hall’s criteria. On martial prowess, he was confident enough that he could ‘defeat’ Mak Ho-yeol. It was just that in the process, his dignity might be tarnished.
'Tch. I was flustered by the unexpected news and spoke out of turn. What should I do about this?’
Apologizing to Mak Ho-yeol wasn’t a particularly good choice, as it would also damage his dignity,
As Baek Cheon pondered how to handle the situation, Choi Woong spoke up, saving him from the predicament.
"The Dokgo Pae is also outstanding among my peers. Honestly, even though we’re in the same class, I’m not confident I could beat him. However, Young Master Il-mok is… how should I put it…”
All eyes turned to Choi Woong, who paused to find the right word.
Choi Woong, whose vocabulary wasn't particularly rich, couldn't think of a more suitable word and simply said what came to mind.
“He’s not just a genius, he’s a monster.”
On the first day, when he saw him subdue Dokgo Pae, he thought he was indeed skilled enough to take the top spot.
On the second day, after picking a fight and getting thoroughly beaten, he realized they weren’t even in the same class.
And yesterday, after observing Il-mok during the test, he had started to question something else entirely.
"Honestly, watching him… it makes you wonder if he’s even human, let alone someone who joined just a year ago."
It was beyond a difference in class; perhaps they were entirely different species.
After Choi Woong's brief explanation about the Young Master ended…
"......."
A strange silence enveloped Black Tiger Pavilion.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 74: Seniors (3)
The silence didn’t last long.
“...Even so, isn’t this a bit over the top?”
While some couldn't believe Choi Woong's words...
"Hahaha! Well, well, I never imagined someone like that would exist!”
Most of them were pleased.
After all, Mak Ho-yeol, who was counted among the strongest in their class, had been defeated, so dismissing the story as fake is even more ridiculous than that.
And the reason they were pleased was simple.
Their initial silence had merely been shock at the news. There was absolutely no reason for them to be displeased about a skilled junior joining their ranks.
Because...
“By now, that youngest disciple must be holed up in Black Dragon Pavilion, right?”
"Let's go find him right away!"
"Hahaha! A new sparring opponent, how exciting!"
The Heavenly Demon Divine Cult revered martial strength. Except for the peculiar few who practiced Demonic Arts with strange side effects, most of these fanatics enjoyed fighting.
They were tired of fighting amongst themselves after a year of constant sparring, but a new opponent was a different story.
As the excited seniors prepared to rush out, Choi Woong’s flustered voice stopped them.
"A-Are you going to find him right now?"
"Of course!"
"Well… I don't know if the Young Master will accept."
They all looked at him with a look of incomprehension.
“What kind of bullshit is that? How could a warrior of the cult refuse a fight?”
“Yeah! From what you and Ho-yeol said, he sounds incredibly strong. Strong people never back down from a challenge!”
Shouting confidently, the seniors left the Black Tiger Pavilion and headed towards the Black Dragon Pavilion.
“Hahaha! I’ll get in one good rematch too!”
Even Mak Ho-yeol, who had already been defeated, joined them.
Looking at the empty spaces left by the seniors who had vanished in an instant, Choi Woong muttered with a sour expression.
"...The Young Master will definitely hate this."
After a month of observation, Choi Woong had learned something about Il-mok. The Eighth Young Master disliked duels. To be precise, he found them bothersome.
Suddenly, Choi Woong realized something important and his face paled.
‘Fuck. They won’t sell me out, right?’
A horde of seniors demanding a spar… Il-mok would be utterly annoyed.
And what happens if the Eighth Young Master found out this whole mess happened because of him?
‘Heavenly Demon, please have mercy on this poor lamb.’
Choi Woong closed his eyes and prayed to the Heavenly Demon, who was probably busy with work at the main headquarters.
While Choi Woong was trembling in fear for his life...
The disciples who had left Black Tiger Pavilion crossed the training grounds using light movement techniques and arrived at Black Dragon Pavilion.
The first-year disciples were startled by the sudden arrival of the seniors.
"Where is Disciple Il-mok?"
"Disciple Il-mok, come out at once!"
As all the senior disciples began looking for Il-mok, his peers all had similar thoughts.
‘Why are they looking for the Young Master?’
Just then, Mak Ho-yeol spotted Il-mok just coming out of the bathhouse after finishing his bath and shouted.
"There he is, that junior!"
All eyes naturally turned to Il-mok.
Fresh from his bath, Il-mok frowned at the sight of them.
‘Great. He dragged his friends here to gang up on me.’
Il-mok thought that Mak Ho-yeol had brought his friends for revenge.
He wasn't afraid of being ganged up on.
‘Fuck. I just finished washing up…’
He just didn’t want to sweat again.
Meanwhile, led by Baek Cheon, the seniors all approached Il-mok, and his peers parted like the Red Sea to make way for him.
Except for a few.
“What brings you seniors here?”
"Swarming like this isn't exactly a pleasant sight."
The ones who stepped forward to block the seniors beside Il-mok were none other than Dokgo Pae and Bang Mi-hwa.
Flustered by her friend's sudden action, Ha Young also belatedly stood beside Bang Mi-hwa.
"As someone who will be the young master's attendant in the future, I cannot stand by!"
Seeing an opportunity to impress Il-mok, Ju Seo-yeon also blocked their path.
And then…
"Huff. Huff."
Jeong Hyeon, breathing heavily from the commotion, also approached Il-mok, although still maintaining a distance.
The atmosphere quickly turned hostile, especially between the two at the forefront.
"As the representative of this year's class, I cannot tolerate your aggressive behavior, seniors.”
Baik Cheon sneered at Dokgo Pae, who kept insisting that he was the representative of his year despite being beaten by Il-mok at every turn.
"The blood of the Dokgo Family really doesn't change. Look at you, you are only second in rank, but insisting that you are the representative.”
Provoked, Dokgo Pae's face contorted as he retorted.
“Better than being a good-for-nothing.”
"It seems the junior wants to die today."
"You think I'm scared of you?"
The tension between the two, fueled by the long-standing rivalry between the Dokgo and Baek Families, escalated to the point where they seemed ready to draw their weapons.
But taut tension snapped quite anticlimactically.
"H-hey, where are you going!"
This was because Il-mok had already turned his back and was heading to his room.
When Park Gi-tae belatedly discovered this and hurriedly shouted, everyone's attention naturally shifted from Dokgo Pae and Baek Cheon to Il-mok.
'Damn. Busted.’
Il-mok clicked his tongue in disappointment and turned around without hiding his annoyed expression.
"Their quarrel has nothing to do with me, so I thought I'd head back in."
Mak Ho-yeol laughed heartily hearing that.
"Hahaha! Their quarrel has nothing to do with us either. We came looking for you, junior."
"For me?"
"That's right."
"For what purpose?"
"We came because we want to fight with you."
"So, why do you want to fight me?"
"Hahaha. You ask something so obvious. Isn’t it only natural you’d want to fight them?”
Il-mok’s face crumpled.
’Why is that natural, you lunatics?’
That reply rose to Il-mok's throat before he swallowed it back.
Surrounded by lunatics, he felt like the normal one was becoming the weirdo.
While contemplating how to send these madmen away, Il-mok came up with a suitable excuse.
"That's not possible."
Mak Ho-yeol, who looked surprised as if he hadn't imagined a refusal, exclaimed. Tʜe source of this ᴄontent ɪs novelfire(.)net
"Why not?!"
"Unofficial duels between disciples are subject to penalty points."
"...Didn't you just fight with me a little while ago?"
Mak Ho-yeol asked with an incredulous look. But Il-mok had already prepared an excuse.
"That was in a secluded place, and it was just you, senior. But with all of you rushing in and making a scene like this, we're bound to get caught."
"......"
His logic was sound, yet it leaves everyone speechless.
While everyone was flustered by Il-mok's roundabout logic and couldn't retort…
“So, how about this? Tomorrow, let’s find an instructor in the afternoon after our training. That’s all.”
Having said his piece, Il-mok turned around and went back to his room.
"......"
"......"
With their target gone, silence briefly fell over Black Dragon Pavilion.
"Ahem."
And the embarrassed seniors began to turn back one by one and return to Black Tiger Pavilion.
“I’ll deal with you properly another time."
"Hmph. You're welcome anytime."
In the meantime, Baek Cheon and Dokgo Pae continued their battle of nerves.
The next day.
A strange tension filled the Hall of the Demonic Way from the morning.
Because of the previous night's events, the disciples kept glancing at Il-mok, anticipating his afternoon showdown with the seniors.
A few even approached him during training.
"It'll be tough to face all those senior guys alone. I'll handle a few of them for you. Especially that Baek Family guy, despite his slippery attitude, he’s no slouch, so he might be too much for you. Leave him to me."
Dokgo Pae suddenly took Il-mok's side, as if they had been close from the beginning.
"Hoho. It seems like a good opportunity for me to cross swords with the seniors as well."
Bang Mi-hwa, pretending to be haughty while volunteering to help Il-mok. She was enchanted by her own coolness in helping a man who admired her.
"Don't worry. I have something in mind."
Of course, Il-mok, finding both their approaches burdensome, tried to brush them off with a vague reply, but…
“Hah! Don't be shy. Even rivals should join forces against a common enemy.”
"That's right, Young Master. There's no need to be embarrassed. I understand your feelings too."
"......"
Il-mok sighed at their nonsense.
He thought it was fortunate that Ju Seo-yeon was in the Lower Class. If she had been here as well, he would have been driven mad.
Seeing him sigh, Dokgo Pae and Bang Mi-hwa nodded knowingly.
“It must be a heavy burden. Don't worry. We’ll be there for you.”
“Just trust me, Young Master.”
"......"
Il-mok squeezed his eyes shut.
‘Maybe I should just quit the Hall altogether...’
Then he pictured his master’s furious face brandishing his blade, and the thought vanished as quickly as it came.
After all the training hours had passed.
Without fail, after finishing his bath, Il-mok headed to the dining hall to find about a dozen senior disciples standing at the entrance.
"We've already eaten, so go ahead and have your meal."
“Yeah. You can’t fight on an empty stomach.”
It was unnecessary consideration.
So Il-mok began his meal under the gaze of about a dozen people.
No, they weren't all.
Thanks to those damned seniors, everyone else had gathered to stare at Il-mok too.
It was enough to make anyone lose their appetite, but Il-mok simply shoved food into his mouth with an annoyed expression.
After finishing his meal, Il-mok rose and left the dining hall.
"Well then, let's find an instructor together."
He turned and headed towards the instructors' office, followed by fifteen seniors and a few of his classmates.
And upon entering the office, his expression involuntarily wrinkled.
‘Damn. Of all people, it had to be him.’
The other instructors were nowhere to be seen. Only Chu Il-hwan remained.
Seeing Il-mok suddenly arrive with a crowd of senior disciples pouring in behind him, Chu Il-hwan, for some reason, wore a mischievous grin.
"Hoh. You said you liked 'women', yet you seem surprisingly more popular with men."
Il-mok shuddered at his frivolous joke.
'Damn. Has he still not given up?'
This was why he didn't want to get tangled with that instructor.
With a deep sigh, Il-mok thought, 'Can't be helped.'
He had come this far. There was no turning back.
Of course, Il-mok had no intention of fighting those seniors whatsoever.
The plan he had come up with yesterday was, of course, not just a plan to avoid last night.
With a sigh, Il-mok composed himself and looked at Chu Il-hwan with a solemn expression.
Chu Il-hwan’s smile widened at the sight.
‘Hehehe. This is going to be fun.’
Having been around the candidates, he was aware of the rumors.
He knew Il-mok had come to spar with the seniors.
As Chu Il-hwan and the seniors watched Il-mok with anticipation…
Il-mok put the plan he had conceived into action.
The reason he had deliberately led the seniors to find an instructor was simple.
"Instructor. Since last night, the seniors have been constantly coming to disturb my training and bullying me."
It was to report them for bullying.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 75: Seniors (4) Chapters fırst released on noⅴelfire.net
Just after Ilmok laid out his accusation with a solemn expression.
"......."
An awkward silence descended upon the office.
In the martial arts-obsessed Heavenly Demon Divine Cult, and especially within the Hall of the Demonic Way, this was an unprecedented event.
Even Instructor Chu Il-hwan who usually wore a playful smile had a blank expression as if something had short-circuited in his mind.
And soon after.
"Wh-Wh-What are you talking about, junior!"
"Us, bullying you?!"
“We came to ask you to observe our duel!”
“Disciple Il-mok, explain yourself to us right now!”
A storm of protests erupted as the seniors recovered from their shock.
Against their indignant cries, Il-mok deliberately widened his eyes until they became bloodshot and shouted, “So many of you ganging up on me and forcing me to fight… is that really fair? I'm a junior! This is clearly bullying, not a fair duel!”
Because he kept his eyes wide open without blinking, a single tear even rolled down his cheek at the end.
“Even though our cult reveres martial strength, it’s for punishing evil. Is ganging up on a weaker person truly in line with the cult’s teachings?”
Faced with this passionate outcry from an alleged victim of school violence, the accused perpetrators couldn't open their mouths.
They knew something was off, but the seniors couldn't figure out how to articulate it.
Then, Mak Ho-yeol, the most simple-minded of the bunch, exclaimed, “Weaker?! You defeated me yesterday!”
Finally realizing the contradiction, Baek Cheon chimed in, "That's right. While it’s true that many of us pressured you, Disciple Il-mok is clearly not weak."
Il-mok almost clicked his tongue unconsciously but managed to maintain his expression.
'They're not falling for it so easily.'
However, he still had the moral high ground.
“Compared to you seniors, aren't juniors naturally weaker? And the fact remains that many of you ganged up on me.”
As Il-mok pointed this out, the fifteen seniors started shouting over each other.
"What nonsense!"
"This is a misunderstanding!"
"We never intended to fight you all at once!"
As everyone shouted over each other, Chu Il-hwan rose with an uncharacteristically serious expression.
“Silence! Any disciple who continues to make noise will be severely punished.”
Hearing this, the seniors reluctantly shut their mouths.
Once the office was quiet, Chu Il-hwan looked over the intruders and said, “I understand why you came to me. However, this isn’t something I can decide on my own. I will discuss this with the other instructors and make a decision. You are all dismissed.”
The moment his eyes met Il-mok's at the end, Chu Il-hwan flashed a mischievous grin.
'What is he planning?'
Il-mok felt his hair stand on end as an ominous sensation washed over him.
That night, a meeting was held in the Hall Master's chamber within the Hall of the Demonic Way.
Seated at the head of the table was Yeom Ga-hwi, the Hall Master of the Demonic Way. Next to him sat Yu Geuk, the Vice Hall Master of the Demonic Way, known by the title Ice Demon Saber. His face was cold and expressionless.
The seat opposite Yu Geuk was empty, and beside it sat Chu Il-hwan. The female instructor took her seat opposite Chu Il-hwan.
Chu Il-hwan was the Primary Instructor for the new disciples, while Cha Eun-yeong was the Primary Instructor for the senior disciples.
"Instructor Chu."
"Yes, Hall Master."
"Begin."
Following Yeom Ga-hwi’s instructions, Chu Il-hwan explained the day's events.
It was Chu Il-hwan who had requested this meeting.
As soon as Chu Il-hwan finished his explanation, Yeom Ga-hwi frowned and said:
“This is certainly an unprecedented case.”
"Yes, Hall Master."
While occasional disputes between seniors and juniors occurred, this was different.
Not only had no junior ever reported seniors for bullying, but there had never been a case where a group of seniors ganged up on a junior to demand a duel.
This was because one year of training in Demonic Arts created a significant gap in ability.
In almost every conflict between seniors and juniors, the seniors would win. Thus, seniors rarely bothered to challenge juniors.
As talented members of the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult, they were interested in fighting strong opponents, not weak ones.
Yu Geuk, who had been quietly listening to Chu Il-hwan's explanation and organizing his thoughts, looked at Chu Il-hwan with a cold expression.
“But in essence, this could be resolved by simply refusing the duel request or forbidding the seniors from entering the Black Dragon Pavilion. The fact that you called this meeting suggests you have another solution in mind, Instructor Chu.”
In response to the Vice Hall Master's piercing insight, Chu Il-hwan tried to hide his expression behind his characteristically playful smile.
"Yes. I have one plan in mind, but I felt I needed the approval of the Hall Master as well as Instructor Cha, which is why I arranged this meeting, Vice Hall Master."
Hearing Chu Il-hwan’s response, the female instructor sitting across from him, Cha Eun-yeong, hardened her expression.
"My approval? What kind of pointless scheme are you plotting now?"
Chu Il-hwan only grinned shamelessly.
"Unnecessary? It will greatly benefit all the disciples.”
As Chu Il-hwan and Cha Eunyeong were about to engage in a battle of wills, the Hall Master spoke up:
"Be mindful of your words, Instructor Chu. This is an official business.”
"...My apologies, Hall Master."
Unexpectedly, Chu Il-hwan showed a respectful attitude towards the Hall Master.
Thanks to Yeom Ga-hwi's intervention, Instructor Cha Eunyeong, whose momentum had deflated, snorted and said, "So, what is this scheme you've devised?"
"It's simple. We'll hold a sparring competition between the new disciples under my charge and the senior disciples under Instructor Cha's supervision. A martial arts exchange, so to speak, to foster camaraderie between seniors and juniors.”
This was a sparring event that had never been held before.
The reason was simple. The gap between the seniors and juniors is too wide.
Cha Eun-yeong naturally pointed this out, but Chu Il-hwan replied slyly, “Now, now, it would at the very least be beneficial for the juniors, no? And if we make this competition a regular event, this year's class can pass on their knowledge to their juniors next year. Additionally, it could provide motivation for the seniors as well."
"Motivation?"
As Cha Eun-yeong tilted her head in confusion, Yu Geuk spoke up.
"You mean that Young Master?"
"Yes. If they realize they're being chased by or even overtaken by a junior one year below them, wouldn't that push them to work harder?"
Yeom Ga-hwi, who had been listening quietly, nodded in agreement. It wasn't a bad idea.
The next morning.
It was time for Instructor Chu Il-hwan's martial arts class.
However, instead of starting the lesson right away, Instructor Chu Il-hwan announced that he had something to share.
"Five days from now, an official sparring competition will be held between you and the senior disciples. This is an opportunity to exchange notes with your seniors who have trained longer than you, which will greatly help improve your skills. This is all possible thanks to Disciple Il-mok, so let's give him a round of applause.”
As soon as he finished, the Upper Class disciples all turned to Il-mok and applauded.
‘Damn it. So that's why he was grinning.’
Il-mok sighed as he realized the source of the unease he'd felt earlier.
Just then, Dokgo Pae raised his hand and asked Instructor Chu Il-hwan a question, "Instructor! What are the rules for the competition? Do we have to avoid injuries like in the last test?”
"Hahaha. Don't worry about that. The ones who should be concerned are not you, but your seniors."
Everyone easily understood Chu Il-hwan's meaning.
