That must've been the final line since the fanatics suddenly were sprawled on the ground,
The only ones left standing were Il-mok's classmates.
Unlike when they'd barely survived that actual battle, they all wore confident expressions.
All except one person.
Il-mok himself—the real protagonist who'd been relegated to audience member—was blushing furiously.
'Please, just dig a grave for me.'
The Qi Deviation he'd barely escaped felt like it was creeping back.
After the flashy graduation ceremony ended, Il-mok left the Hall of the Demonic Way with his classmates and headed for the main headquarters.
"Where are you planning to go?"
"Wouldn't the combat unit be the best choice?”
"Hmm. I'm thinking the same thing. How about we try to get into the same unit?"
Having graduated from the Hall of the Demonic Way, they could now proudly call themselves the rising generation of the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult. They chatted about their future paths as they walked.
Ju Seo-yeon, who'd lived solely with the dream of joining the Hidden Guard Pavilion to become Il-mok's personal attendant, was excited about finally becoming someone's junior.
Jeong Hyeon, who'd also resolved to become Il-mok's personal guard like Ju Seo-yeon followed behind him with a somewhat flushed expression. Others couldn’t see it as she had her head lowered in shyness.
Though Il-mok wasn't joining the group conversation, he seemed to be in a pretty good mood.
'Finally. Finally, I'm free!'
He hadn't been this happy even when he'd passed the civil service exam and ended his test-prep life.
The day of his life in this mental asylum for prospective mental patients had finally over. He could honestly say it had been tougher than studying for government exams.
Of course, his classmates who'd successfully graduated from the mental asylum were no longer prospective mental patients. They'd magnificently become full-blown mental patients, but that didn't matter to Il-mok.
'No more getting tangled up with them!'
Neither with these peers, nor with the lunatics swarming the main headquarters. He would never have to see them again as long as things went according to his plan.
That's when Dokgo Pae stepped boldly in front of Il-mok.
"Young Master Il-mok. I'm planning to seek out the Black Tiger Corps today. Since two Black Tiger Corps seniors died protecting us six months ago, I'll fill their positions, build my strength, and someday become the head of my Dokgo Family."
Il-mok was puzzled.
He couldn't figure out why the guy was telling him what sounded like a personal resolution.
But today was a good day, so Il-mok was happy to humor the nonsense.
“I wish you the best of luck.”
He tried to leave after offering encouragement, but as expected of Dokgo Pae, he blocked his path again.
"And someday I'll compete with you for the position of Cult Leader! So, as a worthy rival and competitor, can you tell me? Young Master Il-mok, what do you plan to do for our Divine Cult from now on?"
So he'd blocked the way because he was curious about Il-mok's career path.
"Hmm. If what you plan to do would truly benefit the Divine Cult, I'll join you instead of joining the Black Tiger Corps." Googlᴇ search Nov3lFɪre.ɴet
The moment his question ended, all the other disciples' gazes focused on Il-mok.
They couldn't help but be curious.
Il-mok had already told the Black Tiger Corps Leader and White Sparrow Corps Leader that after graduating from the Hall of the Demonic Way, he'd be carrying out a solemn mission from the Heavenly Demon.
For the young rising generation, it was a story that could not fail to stir their curiosity. They just hadn't dared ask directly.
And Il-mok, now the center of everyone's attention, answered, "I'll only know the specifics after discussing it with Master."
Even though no such mission from his Master existed, his expression was remarkably confident.
"Hmm. Then, after you have spoken with the Supreme One, please let me know discreetly. I'll wait a few days without joining the Black Tiger Corps until you call for me."
At Dokgo Pae's offer of kindness, Il-mok nodded.
"I'll do that."
Naturally, he had absolutely no intention of contacting him.
After passing through the forest path and reaching the main headquarters entrance, the rising generation who'd graduated from the Hall of the Demonic Way scattered in different directions.
"How far are you planning to follow me?"
At Il-mok's question, Ju Seo-yeon and Jeong Hyeon, who'd been happily following him, hesitated.
"Well, since I'm your attendant now, shouldn't I follow you?"
At Ju Seo-yeon's innocent answer, Il-mok let out a small sigh.
“Wouldn't the proper procedure be to first apply for admission to the Hidden Guard Pavilion, and then come find me after you passed their test?"
"Ah..."
"......"
Seeing the two women with foolish expressions on their faces, Il-mok let out another faint sigh.
'Did Jeong Hyeon get infected by that airhead too...?'
Her sudden oath to become his guard and various other things felt ominous.
He even wondered if she had been brainwashed by Ju Seo-yeon.
"Even if Master gives me a command, I'll stay at Windrock Palace for a while, so both of you should go to the Hidden Guard Pavilion first.”
"You absolutely cannot abandon me, Young Master!"
"I-I understand."
After bowing, they headed toward the Hidden Guard Pavilion.
After shaking off those two tails, Il-mok headed straight for the Heavenly Demon Palace.
At the end of the graduation ceremony, there had been a telepathic message that snapped Il-mok out of his near-Qi Deviation.
—Come find this old man first when you return to the headquarters.
It was a telepathic message from the Heavenly Demon.
His other self, which had been on the verge of throwing a tantrum, had retreated deep into his subconscious at that single transmission.
Upon reaching the Heavenly Demon Palace, Il-mok immediately prostrated himself before his master.
"I greet the Lord of Ten Thousand Demons!"
“Hahaha. Rise.”
In the eyes of the gently laughing Heavenly Demon, an unconcealed emotion was contained.
It was pride.
“Hahaha. I knew your talent was outstanding, but even this old man never predicted that you would start transcending Extremity so soon after completing your training at the Hall of the Demonic Way.”
It was unprecedented growth speed in the history of the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult. Even compared to himself, the current Heavenly Demon.
At the Heavenly Demon's lavish praise, Il-mok bowed his head modestly.
"It's all thanks to your teachings, Master."
"Hahahaha. You are painting gold on this old man's face."
Seeing the Heavenly Demon so genuinely delighted, the Pavilion Master of the Hidden Guard Pavilion also felt a sense of novelty.
He had been at the Heavenly Demon’s side as the Pavilion Master for over ten years, yet this was the first time he had ever seen him look so delighted.
"I heard the story."
"...?"
As Il-mok made a bewildered face at the out-of-the-blue remark, the Heavenly Demon elaborated.
"You told the Black Tiger Corps Leader and the White Sparrow Corps Leader that this old man had given you separate instructions?"
Il-mok almost flinched involuntarily.
'Why are these guys so loose-lipped despite how they look?'
He never thought they'd go tattling to Master about that.
“I-I apologize, Master.”
He had dared to use the Heavenly Demon's name for his own ends; he had no idea what kind of horrific punishment might befall him.
Il-mok trembled with fear, but the Heavenly Demon still wore a pleased expression.
"Hehehe. Don't worry. This old man understands your intentions perfectly."
"???"
"Instead of joining the combat unit, you made that excuse because you have something you absolutely want to do, right?"
Apparently, the Heavenly Demon had some serious rose-colored glasses on.
“So now, speak. This old man is also quite curious. What task do you wish to do for the good of the Divine Cult, so much so that you would go as far as invoking this old man's name?”
"......"
Il-mok gulped nervously.
'This could be dangerous if I package it wrong.'
Il-mok's goal had always been the same.
Escape to the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult’s branch in the Central Plains.
As a regional branch, he'd be free from the Heavenly Demon and his senior brothers' interference, and there wouldn't be anyone with a higher rank than him.
If he could just get there, he could end this slave-like existence and enjoy freedom.
Of course, Il-mok was already in the process of transcending Extremity. There was no longer a reason to avoid training or turn away from enlightenment using his mental illness as an excuse.
From now on, the higher his realm, the more his mental condition would improve.
But even from that perspective, Il-mok concluded that a Central Plains branch would be better than headquarters.
'If I stay here, I might get summoned by Master or my senior brother every day to play as their Wikipedia.'
He planned to enjoy peaceful training and relaxation at some quiet Central Plains branch.
The problem was that if he honestly revealed his true intentions, who knew what terrible punishment he'd face for using the Heavenly Demon's name for personal reasons.
Realizing his life depended on his silver tongue, Il-mok's mind began spinning furiously.
Fortunately, he'd been thinking up justifications ever since deciding to go to the Central Plains.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 178: Career Path (3)
About a year ago.
Yueyang in the Central Plains.
A massive estate stood at the heart of this beautiful scenic spot overlooking Dongting Lake—a place that countless poets had praised since ancient times.
[Murim Alliance]
Written in bold, dragon-like calligraphy, the plaque hung above the estate.
In one section of this compound, a man dressed entirely in black entered the Flying Dragon Pavilion.
The black-clad figure quickly made his way to the deepest part of the Flying Dragon Pavilion. As soon as he opened the door and stepped inside, he clasped his hands and bowed respectfully.
"I greet the Pavilion Lord."
The man addressed as Pavilion Lord nodded coldly and asked, "Any special intelligence on those zealots?"
The Murim Alliance was founded by the various sects of the Central Plains joining hands.
They had gathered under the noble cause of protecting the peace of the Central Plains, and naturally, there were various forces that harbored hostility toward them.
But since the powers that held considerable influence throughout the Central Plains had united their strength, there weren't many forces that could actually threaten them.
The Flying Dragon Pavilion's main mission was to monitor such threatening forces and prevent the emergence of new enemies in advance.
And the man who had just come to see the Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord was a highly capable subordinate who oversaw surveillance of the most dangerous among those few remaining forces.
In truth, while the Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord maintained his usual cold expression, his mind was far from at ease.
'What the hell are those fanatics plotting? I can't figure it out.'
All this chaos had started because of the intelligence that very capable subordinate brought. More precisely, it was because of information that had come in about a year ago.
Word had come that the Demonic Cult's branch offices in various villages throughout Xinjiang had suddenly started teaching children the Thousand Character Classic.
That was enough news to bring the Murim Alliance into complete uproar.
—Those lunatics must be trying to teach Demonic Arts to the children of Xinjiang!
—We need to strike first right now! They've extended their evil influence even to young children; how can we turn a blind eye to such a horrific act!
—Exactly! We need to wipe out those vile bastards immediately!
A meeting was held with the heads of major Murim Alliance institutions and elders from renowned sects and noble families of the Central Plains as the attendants.
The majority of elders concluded that the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult was extending its evil influence to children to train warriors.
It was an accurate assessment.
However.
—So then, which sect will take the lead in this Demon-Exterminating Campaign?
When the Alliance Leader posed this question, all those who had been making such a racket suddenly shut their mouths at the same time.
Those zealots were all crazy bastards who didn't give a damn about their own lives.
It was obvious that fighting them would result in casualties, and among them, the being they worshipped as their god was on a completely different level.
The sheer weight of the Heavenly Demon’s name was on a level comparable to that of an entire great sect.
Of course, they were confident that if the entire Central Plains united, they could easily wipe away those bastards at any time.
The problem was just one thing.
The sects taking the vanguard would suffer damage close to complete annihilation.
Even if they were to wipe out the Demonic Cult, there would be nothing left to gain.
The Tianshan Mountain Range where the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult was located was incredibly far from the Central Plains.
You had to pass through Qinghai and then traverse the wastelands of Xinjiang to go much further west.
Unlike this prosperous Central Plains where there were plenty of poor souls to extort money under the pretext of "protection fees," taking over that place would gain them nothing.
—Ahem. Our Hwangbo Family is located in the far east. It’s better for those near Xinjiang to clear the path first. We’ll join as quickly as possible once that’s done.
—Heh. Speaking of distance, wouldn’t the Yunnan Diancan Sect. Sichuan Emei Sect, Qingcheng, and Sichuan Tang Family be more suitable to take the lead?
—Are you out of your mind?
And so began the routine of pushing and pulling each other to the front lines. The justice of the Murim Alliance couldn't be sustained by honor alone.
To them, justice wasn't an ideal but a reality.
They needed money to raise their sect's disciples. They had to expand their sect's territory and business to show off their prestige; how else could they face the founding masters who had passed on if they couldn’t even do that?
Of course, they did practice justice.
In the areas near where their own sects were located, that is.
The common folk living and working hard there were their precious meal ticket—no, since they were such pitiful people, was it not true that only by protecting them could their sects enjoy glory for a long time to come?
Ah. There were occasional cases where they would get involved in the misfortunes of other regions.
When other forces weakened, they could obtain justification to "save" the people there and expand their territory.
This was one of the biggest reasons why the Murim Alliance hadn't launched a preemptive strike against the Demonic Cult.
The Murim Alliance was a massive force formed by countless sects from the Central Plains joining together, but conversely, it wasn't a single unified power.
Since there was no absolute leader, they moved according to the interests of their respective sects and noble families.
The Murim Alliance mostly just acted as a mediator when conflicts arose between member sects and families.
They only united in one case: when a common, massive enemy emerged, like an invasion from the Demonic Cult.
They'd join forces to block invaders trying to steal what was theirs, but when those enemies were holed up far away in the useless wastelands of Xinjiang, they didn't bother attacking.
True to form as expired elders, they ended up repeating what they'd always done.
They hurled criticisms at each other wrapped in polite language, and time passed without any progress.
—That's enough. Since the Demonic Cult hasn't made any overt moves yet, how about we settle on increasing surveillance of them for now?
The Alliance Leader could only step in to mediate with a weary expression on his face and offered his standard solution such as “let’s wait and see.”
Following this decision, the Flying Dragon Pavilion had no choice but to stay busy for a while.
They had to dispatch new spies to Xinjiang and Qinghai.
Thanks to the news over the past year or so, the Murim Alliance held meetings about once a month.
They had thought the cult was planning to teach Demonic Arts to the children, but when news arrived that they were not teaching Demonic Arts and instead genuinely taught them the Thousand Character Classic, their doctrine, and some strange games, another fierce debate erupted.
—These crazy bastards must be preparing some kind of weird sorcery! We need to attack immediately!
—They're just lunatics doing crazy shit.
When the fanatics suddenly started building new estates in several villages and later news came that they were gathering children from nearby villages to educate them there, arguments broke out again.
—Those crazy bastards are definitely trying to lock up children and teach them demonic arts!
—See! I told you! Didn't I say we should attack immediately!
—If you're so eager to attack, why don't your sect go first!
Even when news came that they were sending children back to their villages at regular intervals then bringing them back again, and that those vicious Heavenly Demon Divine Cult martial artists were personally pulling the carriages like livestock, they still quarreled like dogs.
—They're definitely crazy bastards.
—They seem to have collectively fallen into Qi Deviation, so how about we just keep watching for now?
—Is that thing on your shoulders just for decoration? How can you allow yourselves to be so easily played by the schemes of those vicious bastards?
The Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord, who attended every one of those meetings, even had this thought, 'Those vicious Demonic Cult bastards must be trying to cause internal strife within our Murim Alliance!'
Of course, being someone who had risen to the position of Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord, he didn't make the mistake of actually believing thoughts that came from anger.
That's why the intelligence his subordinate brought today was important.
To understand why those lunatics in the Xinjiang wastelands were suddenly doing such bizarre things. Most importantly, to prevent internal strife within the Murim Alliance.
Hiding these desperate inner thoughts, the Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord looked at his subordinate.
"After consolidating information from our spies, the Demonic Cult fanatics are currently trying to educate children."
A scowl creased the Pavilion Lord's face.
"Do you think we're making all this fuss because we don't know that?"
The subordinate swallowed a dry gulp at his ever-composed superior's frigid voice. Though the tone itself was no different than usual, he knew from experience that this was a crisis.
“There was no sorcery being used, nor was there some kind of hidden objective. It is undoubtedly for the simple purpose of teaching the children to raise them as future zealots of the Demonic Cult.”
"Then why aren't they teaching them Demonic Arts and instead doing exactly what we orthodox sects do? Those fanatics who are obsessed with Demonic Arts."
"That... that's because of the Eighth Disciple."
"...The Eighth Disciple?"
It wasn't just because it was an unfamiliar title. He knew that a "disciple" in the Demonic Cult meant a student of the Heavenly Demon.
It's just that...
"Wasn't the Seventh Disciple the last one? And didn't that Seventh Disciple die?"
"The Heavenly Demon has taken on a new disciple. And all of the Demonic Cult's current movements are said to be proposed by this Eighth Disciple."
"Why the hell would he do that?"
“A-As I stated before, they say it is for the purpose of educating the children to raise them as zealots of the Demonic Cult.”
“And so I ask you, why isn't he teaching those damn Demonic Arts and instead starting with weird stuff?!"
The Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord finally couldn't contain his anger at the conversation that kept going in circles.
Of course, the subordinate who had come to report was also having a hellish time.
'It's not like we can make contact with the Eighth Disciple. How the hell are we supposed to figure out his intentions?!'
It was a scream he couldn't voice aloud.
This was the Murim Alliance, not the Demonic Cult. It was a peaceful place where you wouldn't get your head chopped off for yelling at your superior a bit.
You'd just get kicked out of the Murim Alliance peacefully.
On the surface, at least.
Well, there was the risk that while wandering the streets after being kicked out, or climbing mountains, or resting at home, some black-clad figure might suddenly appear and sever your limbs and meridians, destroy your dantian, or "accidentally" pierce your neck or heart, but those were just minor incidents.
"This subordinate is inadequate and has not yet been able to grasp the Eighth Disciple's intentions."
The subordinate swallowed his grievances and immediately dropped to his knees to beg forgiveness.
Such was the sorrow of middle management.
The Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord glared coldly at his kneeling subordinate, let out a deep sigh, then spoke.
"I'll give you one last chance. Investigate everything you can about this Eighth Disciple and report back."
"This disciple wishes to go to the Central Plains to see the wider world."
“See the wider world, you say…”
At the somewhat lukewarm response from the Heavenly Demon, Il-mok's tongue began to dance.
"Thanks to the various reform measures Master is implementing, Xinjiang is currently facing a period of great transformation. However, strengthening internal affairs while neglecting surveillance of the outside world could potentially invite a crisis."
"So you're saying you'll become the spearhead to observe the flow of the Central Plains?"
"That is correct."
The Heavenly Demon stroked his beard with a thoughtful expression.
When the Heavenly Demon's reaction was more lukewarm than expected, Il-mok realized he needed to implement his second plan.
Thud.
"!?"
When Il-mok suddenly prostrated himself again, the Heavenly Demon looked bewildered.
Regardless of the Heavenly Demon's reaction, Il-mok shouted at the top of his lungs. New ɴᴏᴠᴇʟ ᴄhapters are published on N()velFire.net
"Please punish this disciple's sins!"
"!?"
"This disciple dared to dream of going to the Central Plains for selfish purposes!"
As the old saying goes, it’s better to say sorry than beg for forgiveness.
Il-mok's prepared second strategy was voluntary confession followed by self-flagellation.
Bang! Bang!
Il-mok boldly struck his forehead against the floor and cried out.
"While it's true I want to monitor the Central Plains' movements, it wasn't purely for the safety of our Divine Cult!"
And just before Il-mok's forehead hit the floor for the third time...
A powerful aura grabbed hold of Il-mok's body.
"When you say selfish purposes, you mean the Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord, don't you?"
At his Master's question, Il-mok naturally felt his lips curve upward.
However, by the time he raised his head, he had already returned to a sorrowful expression.
"That is correct. As a man, and as a warrior of the Divine Cult, how could I live forgetting the enemy of someone who was like a parent to me?"
To avenge the one who was like a parent.
What more splendid justification could there possibly be?
Of course, Il-mok wasn't just planning to use this as a mere justification.
That bastard really was Uncle Tae-hyeon's enemy, so he fully intended to personally cut off his head someday.
It's just that...
'Well, just because I'm going to the Central Plains doesn't mean I have to meet that bastard right away.'
He was simply considering revenge to be a matter for the distant future.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 179: Career Path (4)
About a month before the Hall of the Demonic Way graduation ceremony, a special event unfolded in the Hyeokryeon Family—one of the Five Great Families of the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult and the prestigious house that had produced the current Heavenly Demon.
Hyeokryeon Hwan, the eldest son of Family Head Hyeokryeon Cheongang and heir to the position, finally emerged from over three years of secluded training.
"We greet the Young Lord!"
You have changed so much we almost didn’t recognize you, Young Lord!”
Despite all the praise from the household members, Hyeokryeon Hwan just nodded gravely and headed somewhere with a heavy expression.
He was on his way to the Family Head’s chamber to inform his father that he'd completed his secluded training.
As he approached the hall, Hyeokryeon Cheongang's voice called out from inside.
"Come in."
Hyeokryeon Hwan nodded with an "as expected" look on his face. Even though he'd broken through to a new level during his training, his father had still instantly sensed his presence.
Entering the hall, Hyeokryeon Hwan bowed formally to the Family Head.
"I greet the Family Head."
"Good. Sit down."
Accepting the greeting brusquely, Hyeokryeon Cheongang spoke as soon as his son sat down.
"You've broken through another wall."
"It's all thanks to you, Family Head."
"Right. If you break through just two more walls, I might be able to hand over this position to you."
"How could someone who's barely touched the Transcendence dare to push out the Family Head?"
The Demonic Cult operates by the law of the strong. The most obvious example is the tradition of the struggle for cult leadership, in which the strongest becomes the cult leader and learns the Heavenly Demon Divine Arts.
Naturally, a tradition similar to that of the Cult was also passed down in the prestigious houses known as the Five Great Families.
And thanks to over three years of secluded training, Hyeokryeon Hwan had reached a level just short of the Transcendence. As his father said, if he broke through just two more walls, he'd reach the level where he could achieve Transcendence with the Blood Shadow Eighteen Swords.
But the current Family Head had achieved Transcendence for nearly twenty years. He wasn't someone you could beat just because you'd freshly achieved Transcendence.
In other words, the conversation between the two was similar to what occurred in a royal or imperial court.
It was a situation where the emperor or king suggests abdicating the throne to their accomplished child, and the crown prince or heir reacts with feigned shock, declaring how someone as unworthy as himself could possibly dare to oust His Majesty and ascend the throne.
At least, that's how it looked on the surface.
Seeing his son continue to address him as "Family Head" and respond so curtly, Hyeokryeon Cheongang let out a light sigh.
"Are you still holding a grudge about the secluded training?"
"Not at all, Family Head. I'm simply trying to act appropriately for my position as th Young Lord, as you instructed."
At his son's blunt response, Hyeokryeon Cheongang swallowed another sigh.
Hyeokryeon Hwan's seclusion hadn't been voluntary.
Hyeokryeon Cheongang had forcibly locked him in a cave with orders not to come out until he broke through to the next level.
His attitude was now completely different from before he entered seclusion. No matter how one looked at it, it seemed less like an attempt to act befitting of the Young Lord and more like a clear display of sulking. But Hyeokryeon Cheongang decided to let it slide for now.
“In any case, it is fortunate that you have broken through a threshold. Continue to strive and devote yourself to your training so that you may enter Transcendence."
"I will do so, Family Head."
Hyeokryeon Hwan bowed formally again and left the Family Head's hall.
"We greet the Young Lord!"
"Congratulations on completing your seclusion!"
He would give a solemn nod each time he encountered household members on his path who bowed to him.
After passing the servants, the second place he arrived at was his own quarters.
And there, waiting for him, was the woman who had handled his duties as Young Lord while he was away.
"Husband!"
"My dear!"
The couple, reunited after more than three years, exchanged passionate looks.
It was a sight that would have shocked Il-mok.
A lovely smile was drawn upon the face of the notoriously spiteful Lady Cheonghwa.
"You've worked so hard while I was away, my dear."
"As someone who will become the madam of the great Hyeokryeon Family, it was simply my duty.”
Their conversation was ordinary, but the looks they exchanged carried something heated. A burning hint that something would happen tonight.
After catching up with his wife for a while, Lady Cheonghwa, who knew her husband very well, gently broached a subject.
"Are you looking for Seon-ah?"
Though it was but a subtle flicker of his eyes, she had not missed her husband’s gaze periodically scanning the interior of the hall.
"Ahem. Well, yes."
Hyeokryeon Hwan answered with an awkward tone.
"I'll lead the way. Let's go together."
"Are you sure it's alright? Isn't Seon-ah in the middle of training the Blood Fox Crimson Claw Art right now?"
“Shouldn’t a daughter naturally greet her father after meeting him for the first time in so long? Besides, it is fine for her to meet and talk with you.”
"It seems Seon-ah is overcoming the side effects of the Blood Fox Crimson Claw Art!"
As Hyeokryeon Hwan exclaimed with a bright smile, Lady Cheonghwa replied with a reluctant expression.
"Y-yes, that's right."
She wasn't entirely sure whether you could call it "overcoming" the side effects.
But with his head already full of thoughts about Seon-ah, Hyeokryeon Hwan didn't notice his wife's subtle change in expression.
"Let's go."
Eventually, Hyeokryeon Hwan followed Lady Cheonghwa's lead to meet the daughter who now lived separately.
This was because of the side effects of the Blood Fox Crimson Claw Art.
To think he had to live apart from his daughter, who was barely over ten years old!
'She should stay in her father's embrace until at least thirty!'
Hyeokryeon Hwan swallowed his anguished cry.
The reason Hyeokryeon Hwan had been forcibly put into seclusion by his father was simple.
He was seriously overprotective of his daughter.
It wasn't just that he interfered with his daughter's training. It had reached a level where it interfered with his own training.
During the hours he should have been training the Blood Shadow Eighteen Swords, he'd spend all day and night clinging to his daughter.
Unable to bear this pathetic sight any longer, Hyeokryeon Cheongang had finally exploded and thrown him into a cave.
Thanks to that, he'd broken through a wall but felt no gratitude toward his father for it.
'For my daughter's sake, I'd gladly give my life!'
He'd broken through purely because of his daughter Seon-ah. With the single-minded determination to see his daughter's adorable face again, he'd devoted himself to swordplay like a madman until he broke through.
Hyeokryeon Cheongang was mistaken. He'd hoped the secluded training would help Hyeokryeon Hwan overcome his obsession with his daughter, but the symptoms had worsened.
It was an understandable mistake. Hyeokryeon Cheongang saw his son's condition as being influenced by the side effects of his Demonic Art..
But Hyeokryeon Hwan's overprotectiveness wasn't influenced by Demonic Art. It was pure paternal love for his daughter.
It wasn't the kind of thing that would disappear just because he couldn't see her face for a while or his martial arts level improved slightly. If anything, it only got worse.
'Ah, I need to manage my expression.'
It took all his willpower to keep the goofy smile from his lips as he walked toward his daughter.
'Just act normal. That damn father of mine might lock me in the cave again if he sees this.'
The reason Hyeokryeon Hwan had been acting stern and grave since completing his seclusion was purely to avoid being locked up again.
To prevent any interference with reuniting with his daughter, he desperately managed his expression as he headed somewhere.
Following Lady Cheonghwa's guidance, they arrived at a training ground set up in one corner of the Hyeokryeon estate.
And there she was.
His daughter, whose hair had turned red due to the influence of the Blood Fox Crimson Claw Art.
"Hah!"
With a spirited cry, she swung her similarly reddened claws.
Children grow up so fast. Although only three and a half years have passed, that tiny child has grown so much.
Tears were already forming in Hyeokryeon Hwan's eyes, but he didn't rush to his daughter. He even stopped his wife from calling out to Seon-ah. He just watched his daughter's training with a proud expression.
Then, when Hyeokryeon Seon-ah finished repeating her training until her internal energy was depleted and took a deep breath—
"Whew."
Clap clap clap.
He applauded thunderously, celebrating his daughter's achievement.
Hyeokryeon Seon-ah's eyes widened as she turned at the sudden applause.
"Father?"
Even though his daughter, who used to call him "daddy" when she was little, now used the more distant "father," Hyeokryeon Hwan smiled contentedly.
“Hahaha. Our daughter has grown so much in three years!"
"Father also seems to have achieved great things. I truly congratulate you."
Even at his daughter's polite but distant response, Hyeokryeon Hwan smiled happily.
"Hahaha. Truly praiseworthy."
He saw her polite behavior as a sign she was overcoming the side effects of the Blood Fox Crimson Claw Art.
His daughter, who had somehow become a fifteen-year-old young lady, smiled gracefully at her father's praise and replied.
"I've been doing my best in training to stay by big brother's side."
"...Big brother?"
Hearing this expression from his daughter for the first time, Hyeokryeon Hwan's thoughts stopped as he turned to look at his wife.
“We have a son?”
A long, weary sigh escaped Lady Cheonghwa's lips.
Lady Cheonghwa led the stunned Hyeokryeon Hwan back to the young master's hall.
A little later, after barely pulling Hyeokryeon Hwan out of his mental breakdown, she explained what had happened.
"The big brother Seon-ah speaks of is the youngest disciple that the Lord of Ten Thousand Demons recently took in."
"Three years ago, when Seon-ah was learning the Blood Fox Crimson Claw Art, she became close to that youngest disciple."
"Thankfully, even after that youngest disciple entered the Hall of the Demonic Way, Seon-ah didn't go berserk or fall into Qi Deviation. She's just... waiting eagerly..."
Lady Cheonghwa's explanation came in brief, scattered pieces.
She had no choice. Every time she explained something, her husband would fall into another mental breakdown.
Having barely managed to hear the full explanation before spitting blood, Hyeokryeon Hwan shouted without having recovered his composure.
"How could you let such a lecher get close to Seon-ah!"
And just like that, Il-mok had instantly been branded a lecher.
Her expression soured at the accusation. After three and a half years, this was what he had to say to her?
“Are you really scolding me right now, you who have been absent for over three years?”
Hyeokryeon Hwan instinctively felt it. The hot night of rekindling their relationship after three and a half years was in danger of becoming as cold as ice from the eternal snow mountains.
"I-I wasn't trying to scold you. S-sorry. That's right! I meant father! What was father thinking, letting such a lecher approach a child suffering from side effects!"
He shamelessly threw his father under the bus to preserve their marital harmony.
Lady Cheonghwa felt irritated but accepted this excuse to restore harmony with her long-absent husband.
"Father had no choice in the matter. The Lord of Ten Thousand Demons took the youngest disciple's side."
"!!!"
Lady Cheonghwa told the anecdotes about the Eighth Young Master, the things the youngest young master had done in the past three years, and how much the Heavenly Demon cherishes that youngest disciple.
Right after hearing all those stories, Hyeokryeon Hwan said with a very serious face. “For the great one to have become a doting fool! The Hidden Guard Pavilion Master serving the Supreme One should be severely punished!"
Coming from the mouth of a doting fool himself, the declaration lacked any and all credibility.
A month had passed since Hyeokryeon Hwan emerged from seclusion.
Many things had happened during that time.
He'd tried to relive old memories by bathing with his daughter after so long, only to be treated like a pervert.
He'd gone to his daughter's quarters trying to have a conversation with his precious daughter, only to be turned away at the door. It just so happened that the time he visited was the hour Hyeokryeon Seon-ah was scheduled to play with Il-mok’s doll.
Aside from such minor incidents, he was getting along fairly well with his daughter.
Hyeokryeon Seon-ah came to the Young Lord’s quarter every morning to pay her respects and at least shared meals with her parents.
The only problem was that if anyone interfered with her training time or the time she spent receiving Il-mok's doll, her attitude would change as if she were facing a mortal enemy.
That's why Hyeokryeon Hwan left the family estate today to head for Windrock Palace. ᴛʜɪs ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀ ɪs ᴜᴘᴅᴀᴛᴇ ʙʏ N0velFire.ɴet
To meet the youngest disciple who had graduated from the Hall of the Demonic Way.
'This is all because of that damn youngest disciple.'
How dare he seduce his daughter while he was away! He absolutely couldn't let this slide.
'Until my daughter is fully grown. Yes, at least until she's thirty, no one can covet my daughter!'
Killing intent and demonic energy poured steadily from his eyes.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 180: Career Path (5)
As Hyeokryeon Hwan kept radiating murderous intent, his daughter Hyeokryeon Seon-ah, who was walking beside him, frowned.
"Father."
That single short call made Hyeokryeon Hwan flinch and quickly rein in his killing aura.
“Ahem. It seems this father of yours is a little n-nervous at the thought of meeting the famous youngest disciple."
Like the doting father he was, Hyeokryeon Hwan was completely powerless against his daughter.
The reason he was bringing his daughter along on this trip to meet the very bastard who was lusting after her was pretty much the same story.
Today was the day that damned lecher would be returning from completing his training at the Hall of the Demonic Way.
Hyeokryeon Hwan had planned to go alone, but Seon-ah had been ready to commit suicide if he tried to stop her from coming, so they ended up with this bizarre arrangement.
Still, he tried to think positively; at least he got to walk with his daughter like this, right?
After enjoying this happy time with his daughter for a while, Hyeokryeon Hwan's expression turned puzzled when they reached the vicinity of Windrock Palace.
There were already several men waiting there.
Once he recognized who they were, Hyeokryeon Hwan had to quickly bow in formal greeting.
"I pay my respects to the Family Head of the Baek Family, the First Disciple, and the Chief of the Law Enforcement Hall."
Each and every one of them ranked higher than him, a mere Young Lord of the Hyeokryeon Family.
‘I already heard from my wife that the First Disciple cares for the youngest disciple, but why the hell are the Baek Family’s head and the Chief of the Law Enforcement Hall here too?’
As the Young Lord of one of the Five Great Families, he held a position that commanded respect even within the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult.
On top of that, his Demonic Art was approaching Transcendence, so there weren't many stronger than him in the cult. The only ones at a similar level would be the heads of various combat units.
And yet, to think that three masters superior to himself were gathered here...
"Haha! I heard you finished your closed-door training. Young Lord Hyeokryeon. I've been so busy with Demon-Teaching Pavilion affairs that I haven't been able to properly greet you. It's good to see you like this. You seem to have achieved great things while I wasn't looking."
First Disciple Wi Jin-hak, who was only two years older and thus somewhat familiar with him, welcomed him warmly.
"Not nearly as much as the First Disciple has achieved. Haha."
Hyeokryeon Hwan responded to his greeting with an awkward laugh, still wondering why three such big shots were gathered here.
And he wasn't the only one with questions.
‘Why is Young Lord Hyeokryeon here too? Don't tell me the Hyeokryeon Family is also eyeing the next Cult Leader position? Is this the Young Lord acting on his own, or did Hyeokryeon Cheongang order this?’
The Chief of the Law Enforcement Hall was thinking the same thing.
‘So many people coming to see our youngest. It's gratifying that others recognize his worth, but all of them might become my enemies in the future.’
The First Disciple, who was planning for life after their Master's departure, felt conflicted emotions.
All four men wore smiles on their faces while internally trying to gauge each other's purposes through meaningless pleasantries.
Only one person had no interest in the four men's conversation.
Hyeokryeon Seon-ah.
She kept turning her head this way and that, wondering when the person she was waiting for would arrive, until her eyes widened.
"Big brother!"
Even before she called out, the four men had already sensed someone approaching and turned to see Il-mok and Jin Hayeon coming their way.
Seon-ah ran toward Il-mok as if her father didn't even exist, while Wi Jin-hak laughed heartily and greeted Il-mok.
"Youngest! Come here quickly. Hahaha!"
"I pay my respects to Eldest Brother."
Il-mok bowed formally to his senior brother, then hesitated when he was about to pat the head of Seon-ah, who had run up to him.
The little kid had grown up quite a bit in two years. It felt a bit inappropriate to treat her like a child as he used to.
"It's been a while."
"I was waiting for you, big brother."
When Il-mok's hand moved toward her head but then dropped back down, Seon-ah's eyes followed it with a hint of disappointment.
But Il-mok's gaze had already moved past Seon-ah toward Windrock Palace.
‘Who the hell are those guys?’
Except for his senior brother, the other three were complete strangers.
The vibe was weird.
One looked at him like he was prey, another seemed excited, and...
‘What's up with him? Is he having a stroke?’
The last one looked completely spaced out.
That was Hyeokryeon Hwan, who had turned into a statue after his daughter abandoned him and ran to the youngest disciple.
Il-mok returned to Windrock Palace with Jin Hayeon, who had been waiting at the Heavenly Demon Hall, and entered with the guests who were waiting at the entrance.
Jin Hayeon, who had always been a capable maid, quickly prepared to receive guests, and Il-mok sat facing the four visitors around the refreshment table she had set up.
Since it was time for the adults to have their conversation, Seon-ah was waiting outside with Jin Hayeon.
Il-mok smiled and greeted them first.
"Thank you for coming to visit. I apologize for not having much to offer since I was away for so long. But what brings you all here today?"
Il-mok obviously hid his inner thoughts of wanting them to leave quickly. ɴᴇᴡ ɴᴏᴠᴇʟ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀs ᴀʀᴇ ᴘᴜʙʟɪsʜᴇᴅ ᴏɴ noⅴelfire.net
For a moment, the four with different goals fought a strange war of nerves to measure each other's purposes.
First Disciple Wi Jin-hak was the first to break into hearty laughter and speak up.
"Hahaha! What special reason could there be? This elder brother's precious youngest completed his training at the Hall of the Demonic Way, so I came to congratulate him. Hahaha!"
"Thank you, Eldest Brother."
Il-mok bowed formally again.
He swallowed the unspoken words: Now that you've congratulated me enough, how about you leave?
The Chief of the Law Enforcement Hall, who saw Wi Jin-hak as a competitor, spoke a bit more directly than Wi Jin-hak.
"Hahaha! This Chief also came to congratulate the Eighth Disciple on completing his training. But completing the Hall of the Demonic Way is not an end but a beginning. So shouldn't the Eighth Disciple start thinking about which organization to join?"
Il-mok immediately understood his intention.
‘Phew. Good thing I got permission from Master in advance.’
Thanks to presenting the justification of wanting revenge on the Flying Dragon Pavilion Master and understanding Central Plains politics, the Heavenly Demon had responded positively to considering Il-mok's journey to the Central Plains.
"I was actually just coming back from discussing that matter with Master, but since Master has given me a specific mission, I can't really discuss it freely."
When Il-mok completely shut him down by invoking the Heavenly Demon's name, the Chief of the Law Enforcement Hall couldn't say much more.
"Hmm. So Master has already assigned you work. I had hoped to lead the Demon-Teaching Pavilion together with our excellent junior brother to nurture the cult's talents. What a shame."
Unlike the Chief of the Law Enforcement Hall, the First Disciple openly showed his disappointment but didn't push further.
‘Since I used Master as an excuse, they should all leave soon.’
Il-mok assumed the remaining two had the same purpose as the Chief of the Law Enforcement Hall and Eldest Brother, but he was mistaken.
Baek Un-hak, who had been quietly listening to the three's conversation, suddenly spoke up.
"I came here because I absolutely wanted to thank the Eighth Disciple personally."
Since Il-mok had never met Baek Un-hak before, he couldn't help but look puzzled.
Over a year ago.
The day after Baek Cheon turned Baek Un-hak's world upside down and left for the Central Plains.
Baek Un-hak had been summoned to the Heavenly Demon Palace by the Heavenly Demon.
"I pay my respects to the Lord of Ten Thousand Demons."
While bowing to the Heavenly Demon, Baek Un-hak had to do his best to control his expression due to his fury toward the Eighth Disciple who had filled his precious second son’s head with nonsense
“Hahaha. You may rise.”
And right after he stood up following the Heavenly Demon's instruction, Baek Un-hak almost lost control of his expression.
"Lord Baek. You've raised your second son magnificently."
‘What kind of bullshit is this?’
His son had abandoned an important position to head to the Central Plains branch, and now the Heavenly Demon was mocking him?
Baek Un-hak managed his expression so desperately that his lips twitched before finally managing to ask the Heavenly Demon.
"I am too foolish to dare understand the Supreme One’s meaning."
"Hahaha! There's no need for such modesty. There is no need to deny of your second son’s great ambition.”
"...Great ambitions?"
Baek Un-hak asked back with a confused expression, and only then did the Heavenly Demon stroke his beard and ask with a curious face.
“Has Lord Baek not heard? The reason your second son headed to the Central Plains."
Baek Un-hak recalled yesterday's events.
His son said the Baek Family was too small and that he would head to the Central Plains. Come to think of it, he did seem to harbor some great ambition.
It's just that, as the Family Head, he had only seen it as the immature act of a still-young son.
But judging by the Heavenly Demon's reaction, that great ambition seemed to be something even the master of the cult would acknowledge.
"Hmm. Since my son said he had great ambitions, I let him go but didn't look into the details."
“Hahaha. Now that I see it, it seems the second son has inherited his father’s heroic heart."
“I am honored by your words.”
Baek Un-hak bowed formally at the Heavenly Demon's praise and carefully asked to satisfy his rising curiosity.
“Forgive my impertinence, but may I dare to ask what Cheon’s great ambition is?"
"Hehehe. Let me tell you.”
The Heavenly Demon readily showed his agreement and spoke of past events with the expression of someone recalling a fond memory.
Of what had happened at the Hall of the Demonic Way graduation ceremony.
“It was surprising enough that a play was created based on this old man and my youngest disciple, but the real show was what came after.”
Hearing that the second son of one of the Five Great Families had gotten obsessed with something as trivial as theater made Baek Un-hak's expression management even more difficult, but the following words completely reversed his feelings.
"He said he would create plays about the stories of the previous Heavenly Demons to spread their greatness to the masses."
Only then did Baek Un-hak fully understand his son's purpose, and he felt like he'd been hit with a massive club.
It wasn't just because of that great ambition.
‘Come to think of it, if what the Supreme One says is true, then Cheon also played the Heavenly Demon in the graduation ceremony play.’
If the play was meant to preach the greatness of the Heavenly Demon, then the protagonist was obviously the Heavenly Demon.
Only then did Baek Un-hak realize.
‘Our Cheon wasn't going down the wrong path after all.’
The side effect of the Baek Family's secret art, the Hundred Flower Demonic Art, was an obsessive need for attention.
He had been worried that his son, who was starved for attention, might have gone down the wrong path by rejecting even the attention of family elders.
‘Cheon, this kid was trying to get attention from the entire world by leaving the family! And by spreading the great achievements of our Divine Cult far and wide, no less!’
His second son really had found the family too small. And it was all thanks to the youngest disciple's advice.
"Thanks to the Eighth Disciple, our Cheon has headed to the Central Plains with great ambitions. How could I not personally thank the Eighth Disciple for giving such wonderful advice?”
Still not understanding Baek Un-hak's words, Il-mok finally asked back.
“If you are referring to my advice, what advice are you speaking of?”
“Hahaha. My, my, it seems the Eighth Disciple is also a humble one. Is it not thanks to you that our Cheon took an interest in plays and decided to preach the greatness of the Divine Cult through them?”
Only then did Il-mok recall a certain memory.
The memory of giving some advice to Baek Cheon while he was being punished and of Baek Cheon becoming a genuine madman ever since.
"I'm truly grateful for that. Eighth Disciple."
Baek Un-hak bowed formally once again to express his thanks.
Whether by age, status, or martial arts level, this was a man who was clearly Il-mok's superior in every way. Yet, here he was formally expressing his thank you.
However, the expression on Il-mok’s face as he received the greeting was peculiar.
It wasn't because of the crazy father thanking him for making his son even more insane.
After three years in the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult, he was used to crazy behavior.
Right now, a more important problem was surfacing in Il-mok's mind.
‘Please don't tell me I'm going to run into that lunatic again in the Central Plains.’
After hearing that Baek Cheon had headed to the Central Plains, an inexplicable sense of dread crept up his spine.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 181: Career Path (6)
Wi Jin-hak burst into boisterous laughter as he watched the conversation between Baek Un-hak and Il-mok unfold.
"Hahaha! Looks like our youngest has pulled off something big again without me even knowing about it. Haha!"
He looked as pleased as if he'd accomplished the feat himself.
"I'll be honest with you. I've heard countless rumors about the Eighth Young Master, but I always considered them somewhat exaggerated. However, thanks to this recent matter with my Cheon, I have truly come to realize that the Eighth Young Master is a genius.”
"Haha! Our youngest really is an outstanding fellow. How could we not be tempted to have him on our side?"
Suddenly, both Baek Un-hak and Wi Jin-hak started singing Il-mok's praises. Meanwhile, the Chief of the Law Enforcement Hall kept staring at Il-mok with greedy eyes that practically dripped with desire; it’s clear that he has not given up yet.
In the middle of this warm atmosphere, the previously silent Hyeokryeon Hwan finally spoke up.
"Eighth Young Master, I'd like to ask you something."
"Please, go ahead, Young Lord Hyeokryeon."
"What do you think of our Seon-ah?"
"..."
Il-mok looked at Hyeokryeon Hwan like he was completely insane.
Hyeokryeon Hwan had been in a daze ever since he witnessed his daughter abandon him completely and run straight to Il-mok.
By the time he finally snapped back to his senses, various conversations had already taken place around him.
And so, Hyeokryeon Hwan had decided to quietly observe the conversation to determine just what kind of scumbag this lecher who dared to covet his daughter truly was.
And then it hit him.
'This lecher... he's actually this capable?'
Of course, he'd heard about Il-mok's exploits through his wife. On top of that, he vaguely remembered his daughter occasionally singing Il-mok's praises.
Yet, consumed by a bitter jealousy, the more his daughter praised him, the more negative preconceptions about this Il-mok character had piled up in his mind.
Until he came here today to meet Il-mok, the image Hyeokryeon Hwan had painted in his head was of some incompetent delinquent street thug with bleached yellow hair and sun-darkened skin.
Yet, the reality could not have been more different.
Two of the most notable figures within the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult were lavishing all sorts of praise upon the Eighth Young Master in an attempt to win him over.
The Family Head of the Baek Family was actually showing a young man far beneath him in station with proper courtesy.
At this point, there is no need to doubt the Eighth Young Master's abilities.
But that wasn't enough to satisfy this overprotective father.
'Fine. I'll acknowledge the Eighth Young Master's capabilities. But I can't just hand over my daughter to some lecher, no matter how capable he is!'
A man's abilities matter when it comes to ensuring a daughter's peaceful married life, but so does his character.
"What do you think of our Seon-ah?"
He asked Il-mok with the most serious expression in the world, like a father-in-law testing his prospective son-in-law on their first meeting.
Of course, from Il-mok's perspective, this was absolutely ridiculous.
No matter how much Seon-ah had grown over the past two years, she was still fifteen by local standards. In the modern world Il-mok was familiar with, she'd be at most a middle school sophomore or high school freshman.
‘Is he trying to get me arrested?’ Follow current novels on novᴇlfire.net
He could practically hear the sound of handcuffs clicking. How was he supposed to think about someone like that?
"I think of her as a cute little sister."
"Little sister? So you don't think of her as a woman?"
When Hyeokryeon Hwan pressed him, Il-mok decided to nail this down once and for all.
"I don't consider any woman who hasn't reached her prime years as a woman, Young Lord Hyeokryeon."
Prime years.
Just as a man's twentieth year is called his coming-of-age, this term referred to a woman's twentieth year, which was supposedly her most beautiful age.
The word alone was enough to make fire dance in Hyeokryeon Hwan’s gaze.
'This damn thief! I won’t give away my daughter until she's thirty, and he's already thinking about taking her at barely twenty!'
For the doting father, the age of twenty was way too young.
And Hyeokryeon Hwan wasn't the only one whose eyes lit up with fire.
‘How foolish of me! He likes women in their prime, so setting him up with Xiao Hong was bound to fail!'
The Chief of the Law Enforcement Hall quickly started racking his brain, trying to remember if any of his subordinates' or acquaintances' children were around that age.
“Hahaha! It seems our youngest has quite firm preferences!”
The First Disciple laughed heartily and mentally ran through a list of women in that age group.
That night, news of what happened at Windrock Palace reached the Heavenly Demon's ears.
"Hahaha. So Jin-hak, the Chief of the Law Enforcement Hall, the Family Head of the Baek Family, and Young Lord Hyeokryeon all went to see our youngest?"
"That is correct, Lord of Ten Thousand Demons."
When the Hidden Guard Pavilion Master replied with a bow, the Heavenly Demon stroked his beard thoughtfully.
“Hmm. What do you think of this, then? Shall we expand the scale of the Hall of the Demonic Way’s graduation ceremony?”
“Forgive me. This foolish servant is too dull to dare presume your meaning.”
“Haha, currently, the students at the Demonic Way are required to present a performance at the graduation ceremony, do they not? How about expanding the influence and increasing the number of spectators at the graduation ceremony? That way, the various institutes within our Divine Cult can pick up prospective talents more efficiently.”
Only then did the Hidden Guard Pavilion Master grasp the Heavenly Demon's intent and speak with a face full of admiration.
“The Supreme One intends to have the heads of various institutions and martial organizations attend the ceremony directly and recruit students right there?"
"Exactly. Going further, our educational infrastructure is set to expand significantly in the coming years. We could also have kids who are about to enter the Hall of the Demonic Way attend these ceremonies to boost their motivation."
It's hard to come up with completely new ideas, but incrementally improving upon what already exists is not so hard.
Thanks to Il-mok creating a new educational system and foundation, the Heavenly Demon was driving various additional changes every day.
Of course, this meant groans of pain echoed throughout the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult's main headquarters and various parts of Xinjiang, but that wasn't the Heavenly Demon's concern.
After all, he was a man who believed that pain was a necessary companion to progress.
While contemplating various other inspirations, the Heavenly Demon suddenly put on a pleased expression.
“On that subject, you mentioned our youngest talked about his preference for women?"
“Yes. It is said he revealed that he is only interested in women who have reached their prime years. Because of that comment, the Chief of the Law Enforcement Hall and First Disciple seem to be moving about busily."
“Hehehe, I'm truly curious what kind of woman would suit our youngest."
The Heavenly Demon had the expression of a grandfather thinking about his grandson who'd reached marriageable age.
He wasn't worried that his youngest disciple would become obsessed with women and neglect his training.
This was a world where it was natural for heroes to have multiple wives and concubines. And when you are an eighteen-year-old genius who’d started breaking free from Extremity, such concerns were pretty much pointless.
Even when he was supposedly womanizing at the Hall of Demonic Way, hadn't he still managed to reach the Extremity?
"Hmm?"
When his thoughts reached this point, the Heavenly Demon frowned and spoke.
"But if he likes women who've reached their prime years, how did the story about him womanizing at the Demonic Way even come about?"
The Heavenly Demon was starting to have doubts about Hall Master Yeom Ga-hwi's handling of affairs.
The next morning.
Unaware that gossip about his personal preferences was spreading throughout the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult, Il-mok awoke from his sleep.
At the same time, Jin Hayeon's voice came from beyond his door.
“I have prepared water for you to wash with, Young Master.”
After washing his face with the water she'd prepared and finishing the breakfast she'd brought, Il-mok was enjoying some leisure time when new visitors arrived at Windrock Palace.
The first to greet him was someone Il-mok had never seen before.
"Hidden Guard Pavilion First Squad Leader Dam Bin pays her respects to the Eighth Young Master."
She appeared to be in her late thirties and was neatly dressed in servant's clothing similar to Jin Hayeon's.
Following her, a number of rather familiar faces offered their greetings.
"We pay our respects to the Eighth Young Master."
"We pay our respects to the Eighth Young Master."
Though they saluted Il-mok, the men's and women's eyes were fixed on someone else.
It was Ouyang Mun and Ju Seo-yeon.
"E-Eighth Young Master, I-I pay my respects."
And there was Jeong Hyeon, stuttering and shrinking back.
It was quite a bizarre combination.
"Good to see you, Squad Leader Dam Bin. Young Warrior Ouyang. Miss Ju, Miss Jeong, welcome. But what brings you here so early in the morning?"
Il-mok knew that Ju Seo-yeon and Jeong Hyeon had joined the Hidden Guard Pavilion. Ju Seo-yeon went without saying, and Jeong Hyeon had mentioned several times near the end of their Demonic Way days that she'd be joining the Hidden Guard Pavilion.
Il-mok just couldn't figure out why these four had come together.
In response to Il-mok's question, Dam Bin spoke on behalf of the group.
"The three of us have come to serve you alongside Hayeon starting today."
"Then how did Young Warrior Ouyang end up coming with you?"
"We just happened to meet at the entrance."
"..."
Il-mok looked at Ouyang Mun with his mouth agape.
'This guy's really something else.'
While Il-mok was letting out a hollow laugh, Dam Bin spoke again.
"Both Jeong Hyeon and Ju Seo-yeon are new recruits to the Hidden Guard Pavilion and need training, but they have connections with you from the Demonic Way, so they've been assigned here together. Hayeon and I will do our utmost to teach them so they won't interfere with serving you."
Dam Bin's extremely respectful manner left Il-mok feeling somewhat awkward.
'Did I get too used to life at the Hall of the Demonic Way?'
All students were equal there, and instructors around Dam Bin's age had been his superiors.
And right after graduating from the Demonic Way, he'd been meeting with people like his master, the Chief of the Law Enforcement Hall, his senior disciple brother, and the head of the Baek Family in succession, so this kind of extreme courtesy felt strange in many ways.
“Ahem. I will be in your care.”
Once Il-mok gave his permission, Dam Bin turned to address Jeong Hyeon and Ju Seo-yeon, who were standing behind her.
"This senior will teach you from now on, so greet her properly."
The person Dam Bin pointed to was Jin Hayeon.
Obviously, Ju Seo-yeon cupped her fists with an absolutely delighted expression, while Jeong Hyeon stammered through her greeting.
"We pay our respects to Senior Jin Hayeon!"
"W-we pay our r-respects to S-Senior Jin Hayeon."
To the surprise of some, Jin Hayeon replied to their greetings in a tone that was a little gentler than usual.
"Last time, I was too busy nursing the Young Master to properly greet you both. I look forward to working together."
This was the reason why Jin Hayeon, a practitioner of the White Hand Demonic Art, harbored a faint sense of goodwill toward the two of them, and it was also the reason they had been assigned as Il-mok’s attendants and guards the moment they joined the Hidden Guard Pavilion.
It was because these two had contributed the most to Il-mok's survival during the fanatic attack.
“I am in your debt, so if you ever need instruction, do not hesitate to ask.”
At Jin Ha-yeon's words, Ju Seo-yeon's clear eyes practically sparkled.
Ju Seo-yeon had no intention of letting Jin Hayeon’s offer of goodwill end with mere words.
“I have a request, Senior Hayeon!”
"Speak."
"As a token of appreciation for our hard work that day, could you give me just one hug?"
"...?"
Though puzzled by this unexpected request, Jin Hayeon approached Ju Seo-yeon and spread her arms without much thought.
'Oh shit.'
Il-mok tried to stop Jin Ha-yeon, but he was a step too late.
"You worked hard."
Jin Hayeon was already hugging Ju Seo-yeon with her characteristically expressionless face.
"..."
And Ju Seo-yeon had turned into a statue of bliss, completely lost in ecstasy.
It was a face that made you wonder if she had practiced Daoist Art instead of Demonic Art and achieved immortal enlightenment.
'Sorry, Miss Jin.'
While Il-mok was silently apologizing to Jin Hayeon, a dark shadow approached him.
"Young Master Il-mok, I will definitely risk my life to protect you as well. If you ever need to go somewhere dangerous, please just say the word."
But a dark and insidious desire squirmed in the eyes of the spirited Ouyang Mun.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 182: Career Path (7)
Right after that chaotic first meeting ended, Dam Bin gave Jeong Hyeon and Ju Seo-yeon a stern warning with a serious expression.
“Though you may be serving the Eighth Young Master now, you must be aware that you could one day be serving the future Lord of Ten Thousand Demons. There must be absolutely no mistake when serving the Lord of Ten Thousand Demons. You need to start practicing for that from now on."
With those words, the Hidden Guard Pavilion's four-person team began their full-scale servant training program.
"You must put your heart and soul into everything. Laundry is no different. Imagine if the Supreme One were to wear clothes you had washed improperly. How dreadful an incident would that be?”
After Dam Bin finished speaking, she turned to look at Jin Hayeon who immediately took the lead by demonstrating proper laundry techniques.
As she washed the clothes with an expressionless face, Jin Hayeon spat out a warning of her own.
"Young Master Il-mok is particularly sensitive about hygiene due to the side effects of his Demonic Art, so you must make everything extra clean."
Following that, Jeong Hyeon and Ju Seo-yeon spent time learning about simple cleaning, organizing the house, sewing, and were given time to try the tasks themselves.
Watching this scene from a distance, an odd feeling struck him.
‘It’s like some kind of bride-training class.’
From that perspective, Ju Seo-yeon and Jeong Hyeon didn't exactly seem like ideal bride material.
First, there was Ju Seo-yeon's case.
She'd start following Jin Hayeon's demonstration, but her attention would then wander almost immediately.
She'd be washing Il-mok's clothes when suddenly she'd turn to look at Jin Hayeon with a dopey grin on her face.
Riiip.
Thanks to that, she'd lose control of her strength and tear Il-mok's clothes.
Or while sewing, she'd turn to stare at Jin Hayeon and—
Prick.
She'd stab her own finger, drawing blood.
If it weren't for her having saved Il-mok's life, he probably would've kicked Ju Seo-yeon out that very day.
"Sigh."
Eventually, Jin Hayeon let out a light sigh and pulled out some healing ointment to apply to Ju Seo-yeon's finger.
Naturally, Ju Seo-yeon's lips curved into another dopey smile.
She'd come for bridal training, but she seemed more interested in the instructor than her future husband.
It was like watching a student who only went to school because of a handsome teacher.
Then there was Jeong Hyeon's case.
"Eep!"
She would recoil in shock if Dam Bin or Jin Hayeon so much as drew a little close to explain the details of a chore.
Il-mok watched this scene for a moment before losing interest and drawing his sword with a light sigh.
"Whew."
It was a sigh meant to shake off his tension.
He might have started overcoming Extremity, but that literally just meant he'd barely begun to escape it.
Another self was still coiled up deep in his mind, constantly looking for a chance to take over his body.
Even so, the reason Il-mok willingly drew his sword was simple.
Things were different now compared to the past.
Instead of side effects getting worse as his skills improved, now he could be freed from his mental illness as he gained more insights.
The only risk was that he could still get totally taken over by that crazy son of a bitch while he was practicing to get better.
—Show me!
—That single sword strike from that day!
'Shut the fuck up.'
Il-mok cursed at the other ego in his mind and began his sword practice.
He was just a greenhorn who'd barely graduated from the Hall of the Demonic Way. At eighteen, he was too young to even be called a rising star of the new generation.
And yet, his sword dance held the seasoned skill of a veteran of a hundred battles with countless insights melted into his every move.
While Il-mok could afford to disregard the attendants' training, Dam Bin, as their supervisor, had no such luxury.
Realizing that the two new recruits they'd accepted based on their merit of saving Il-mok were in absolutely terrible condition, Dam Bin let out a light sigh and turned her head to the side.
There, a guest who'd arrived at some unknown time was sitting there.
A young lady boasting red nails, red hair, and red eyes was somehow doing needlework alongside Jeong Hyeon.
And doing it perfectly, at that.
The sight of a young lady who was not only a direct descendant of the Hyeokryeon Family but also the current Family Head's only granddaughter doing needlework was strange in many ways.
"It seems Lady Hyeokryeon has experience with needlework."
Seon-ah, who'd been absorbed in her sewing, looked up with a serene smile.
"I've been preparing in advance."
As she answered, Seon-ah's gaze had already turned toward Il-mok who was swinging his sword.
She'd come to Windrock Palace, but since Il-mok was focused on training, she was spending time with the others for now.
Hyeokryeon Seon-ah's stare made Dam Bin recall some information.
'If I’m not wrong, the Eighth Young Master was supposedly close with that young lady before entering the Hall of the Demonic Way.' ɪꜰ ʏᴏᴜ ᴡᴀɴᴛ ᴛᴏ ʀᴇᴀᴅ ᴍᴏʀᴇ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀs, ᴘʟᴇᴀsᴇ ᴠɪsɪᴛ nοvelfire.net
She wondered if the young lady might join the Hidden Guard Pavilion after she graduated from the Hall of the Demonic Way.
Her goal would be serving the Eighth Young Master rather than the Heavenly Demon, so it would be for rather disloyal reasons, but Dam Bin decided to ignore it for now.
Either way, having a talented subordinate join was a good thing.
"Needlework helps calm the mind."
"Eep!"
The sight of Hyeokryeon Seon-ah teaching the three-year-old Jeong Hyeon needlework brought a strange expression to Dam Bin’s face.
She turned her gaze elsewhere, toward where Ju Seo-yeon and Jin Hayeon had been doing needlework.
There, for some reason she could not fathom, another man had somehow mixed into their group.
Ouyang Mun was doing needlework with a perfection that made Ju Seo-yeon look incompetent by comparison.
Though he was from the Ouyang Family, his time as a combat unit member had naturally made him skilled at sewing.
Especially since he was naturally gifted with his hands, he had quite the talent for needlework and other household tasks.
After doing such excellent needlework for a while...
Ouyang Mun began looking around before suddenly pricking his own finger with the needle.
"Ugh."
Then, in a manner very unbefitting of a Demonic Cult warrior, he let out a groan that was way too dramatic for such a small wound and looked at Jin Hayeon with puppy eyes.
It was as if he were asking her to apply the wound salve for him, just as she had for Ju Seo-yeon.
"Tsk."
Jin Hayeon clicked her tongue while looking at Ouyang Mun like he was some kind of bug, then threw the entire bottle of healing ointment at him.
Captivated by Jin Hayeon’s mannerisms, Ju Seo-yeon dropped the clothes she'd been sewing onto the floor and dirtied them in the process.
After confirming all of this, a deep sigh escaped Dam Bin's lips.
'I'm really not sure if bringing those two into the Hidden Guard Pavilion was the right decision.'
The fact that they were being outshone by Hyeokryeon Seon-ah and Ouyang Mun of all people was giving her a throbbing headache.
Il-mok was too busy training and fighting his other ego to notice all the dramas at Windrock Palace.
He moved his sword in a state of trance for quite a while until his reserves of internal energy were exhausted. With a deep exhale, he sat cross-legged and started meditation.
His time in the Meditation Club had evidently served him well; he sank into a profound state of inner awareness almost immediately and operated his cultivation art to replenish his depleted dantian.
What greeted him when he opened his eyes was six figures who had somehow taken protective stances around him.
'When did Seon-ah get here?'
While Il-mok was wondering about discovering Hyeokryeon Seon-ah so late...
"Big brother!"
Hyeokryeon Seon-ah called out with a radiant smile.
"Will you spare with me?"
Her way of speaking was completely different from before he entered the Hall of the Demonic Way. She seemed to want to emphasize that she was no longer a child, but to Il-mok, she just looked like a kid trying to act grown-up, which he found nothing but cute.
Seeing his cute little sister like this, Il-mok smiled lightly and answered.
"I am curious to see how much you've improved in these two years."
Since he needed to move toward Transcendence anyway, Il-mok had no reason to avoid the spar.
As soon as Il-mok gave his permission, Seon-ah took her combat stance, and those who'd been standing guard stepped far back.
Il-mok just stood there looking relaxed, his sword down, and spoke leisurely. "Come at me."
Hyeokryeon Seon-ah felt a strange sensation.
His posture looked full of openings, but for some reason, her instincts were warning her of danger.
After hesitating for a moment, Seon-ah finally charged in boldly with a battle cry.
"Hyaa!"
She knew that nothing would change by simply remaining in a standoff.
Using her lightness skill to close the distance instantly, Hyeokryeon Seon-ah thrust her qi-coated left hand like a dagger.
'Hmm. She's grown quite a bit compared to two years ago.'
Il-mok thought casually as he dodged the attack as if he were evaluating her performance.
It wasn't just her martial arts. Having gone through puberty over the past two years, her height and limbs had grown longer and expanded her reach.
It was like watching a kid who used to toddle around now taking long strides as she ran.
After dodging Hyeokryeon Seon-ah's Blood Fox Crimson Claw Art with footwork or lightly deflecting it with his sword several times...
Clang.
He trapped her in his rhythm and his sword stopped right in front of her throat.
“You’ve changed so much I almost can’t recognize you. You're at a level where you could take the top seat if you entered the Hall of the Demonic Way right now."
It wasn't an exaggeration. Seon-ah's current level was similar to that of Dokgo Pae or Cheon Su-ryong when they first entered the Hall of the Demonic Way.
Hyeokryeon Seol-ah smiled brightly at Il-mok’s praise. She didn't seem to care at all that she had been defeated so effortlessly.
"Will you spar with me just once more? I feel like I might grasp something. Big brother."
Seon-ah, who wanted to play with Il-mok more, used the excuse of gaining insights, but Il-mok wasn't fooled.
“There is wisdom in the saying, ‘too much is no better than too little.’ Do not let impatience guide you, especially not with Demonic Arts. That impatience tends to bring disaster."
Coming from one who had intimately known the torment of such side effects, it was profoundly valuable counsel.
—More! Swing it more!
Because right at that moment, a psycho was having a meltdown in his head.
The next day, the Hidden Guard Pavilion's four-person team and Hyeokryeon Seon-ah came to Windrock Palace as usual.
To be precise, the Hidden Guard Pavilion's four-person team had started living at Windrock Palace while Hyeokryeon Seon-ah was visiting as a guest.
And in the afternoon, that pitiful fellow Ouyang Mun came with his sworn brother, who was basically a paranoid patient.
"Youngest, congratulations on graduating from the Hall of the Demonic Way."
"I greet the Eighth Young Master!"
Hiding his inner thoughts of Ouyang Mun, Il-mok bowed to Seo Wan-pyeong while Ouyang Mun did the same.
"I greet Third Brother."
"I wanted to visit from the day of my little brother's graduation ceremony, but I had a mission and could only come now."
"Just coming to visit is more than enough. Third Brother."
"Haha. Of course, I had to come now that my little brother has graduated from the Hall. Besides, I am also here because our Master has given an order.”
"What did Master say?"
Seo Wan-pyeong replied to Il-mok’s question.
“He said that five days from now, you are to head for Gulang County in Gansu Province.”
At his Third Brother's message, Il-mok struggled to manage his expression.
'Finally!!'
Il-mok tried really hard not to smile lest they get the wrong idea.
Seeing Il-mok's serious expression, Seo Wan-pyeong spoke with a proud look.
"That's my little brother, alright. To think you would take on a solo mission the moment you graduate from the Hall of the Demonic Way. And to the Central Plains, no less.”
“Hahaha! One could talk about Young Master Il-mok’s excellence until one’s mouth hurt, and it still wouldn’t be enough, brother!”
Prompted by Ouyang Mun’s cheer, Seo Wan-pyeong suddenly said something out of the blue.
"Oh, that reminded me, I heard the rumors, little brother. Hahaha. Never thought you were already thinking about getting married.”
A storm raged in the eyes of all the women in Windrock Palace.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 183: The Way (1)
However, the change in the women’s expressions was nothing compared to Il-mok’s.
"Wh-what are you talking about?"
Il-mok had never even uttered the word "marriage" in his entire life, let alone thought about it seriously.
"Hmm? Didn't you say you considered a woman around twenty as a marriage partner? I heard this from our Eldest Brother on the way back from a mission."
"...I did say something like that, but I didn't mean I was planning to get married right away, Third Brother."
Il-mok never imagined that a casual conversation would get twisted into this mess.
Hearing Il-mok's explanation, Seo Wan-pyeong just smiled with that "I knew it" expression.
"Hahaha. That's our youngest for you. So cautious even when it comes to marriage."
Seo Wan-pyeong interpreted Il-mok's words to mean he'd want to consider age first, then carefully weigh all the other conditions.
"You know, our youngest might end up being the first among us brothers to tie the knot. I'm still way too lacking, and while our Eldest Brother has already achieved Transcendence, he said he wants to focus on the Demon-Teaching Pavilion's affairs and prepare for the future first."
While Seo Wan-pyeong rambled on with his unnecessary commentary, everyone caught in the blast of his bombshell was lost in their own thoughts.
Ju Seo-yeon didn't care about Il-mok's love life, so she wasn't thinking about anything.
'Interesting. I'll need to keep this in mind when serving the Eighth Young Master in the future.'
As the First Squad Leader of the Hidden Guard Pavilion, Dam Bin treated Seo Wan-pyeong's words as 'intelligence' and filed them away in her mind.
'Tw-twenty years old... since I'm eighteen now, that means in two years... What am I thinking right now?!’
Jeong Hyeon found herself imagining weird scenarios and hung her head, blushing furiously from embarrassment.
'So the Young Master likes women around twenty. Come to think of it, I was nineteen two years ago.'
Jin Hayeon pretended not to care much, but she couldn't help recalling her own age.
'Five years.'
For some reason, Hyeokryeon Seon-ah was holding up her left hand and folding down her fingers one by one.
'If I can just keep everyone away for five more years...'
With each finger she folded, the murderous aura radiating from her grew thicker.
Five days flew by quickly once the trip to the Central Plains was confirmed.
Jin Hayeon and Dam Bin continued to train Ju Seo-yeon and Jeong Hyeon while attending to Il-mok, and Il-mok spent his time either immersed in his training or receiving guests who came to Windrock Palace.
The Hyeokryeon Family was doing much the same.
Actually, they seemed to be in an even more harmonious mood.
This was all thanks to the atmosphere that Young Lord Hyeokryeon Hwan subtly gave off.
‘Huhuhu. That lecher is finally leaving.’
