Word had quietly spread that the Eighth Young Master would soon be leaving the main headquarters for a secret mission.
Those who had been trying to recruit him were either sick with disappointment or desperately searching for some way around it, but for Hyeokryeon Hwan, this was nothing but delightful news.
And on the day Il-mok was supposed to leave, around lunchtime...
"Hmm...?"
After the morning greetings, Seon-ah always came by at this time to have lunch with her parents, but she was nowhere to be seen.
Sensing something ominous, Hyeokryeon Hwan shot up from his seat, and his wife, Lady Cheonghwa, felt the same way.
They rushed over and soon arrived at the building where Hyeokryeon Seon-ah lived, and Hyeokryeon Hwan's anxiety peaked.
For some reason, the lock that was always there had been unlocked.
Hyeokryeon Hwan and Lady Cheonghwa looked at each other, nodded, and entered the room. In the center of the room lay a letter.
Hyeokryeon Hwan strode over, picked up the letter, and began reading.
When Hyeokryeon Hwan stood there holding the letter, Lady Cheonghwa felt uneasy and cautiously approached.
Only then did she realize what had happened.
Her husband had frozen solid while standing.
Lady Cheonghwa deliberately looked away from her husband and turned her gaze toward the letter their daughter had left behind.
The letter's contents weren't very long.
It was basically a runaway declaration.
"Sigh."
Lady Cheonghwa, who had somehow sensed this might happen, sighed softly and shook her husband out of his stupor.
"Husband. Pull yourself together."
Snapping out of his daze at his wife's call, Hyeokryeon Hwan frantically shouted.
"You're right, my dear! This isn't the time to be spacing out. I need to go find that damn womanizer right now and bring our daughter back!"
"Sigh... It's already too late. The Eighth Young Master left the main headquarters at least two hours ago. Moreover, she clearly stated in the letter that she’ll return for her time in the Hall of the Demonic Way.”
Lady Cheonghwa pointed to the letter Seon-ah had left behind.
This was the main reason she was accepting Seon-ah's running away.
It wasn't about the part where she said she would return before entering the Hall of the Demonic Way. Rather, it was because of her daughter’s side effects.
'After entering the Hall of the Demonic Way, she won't be able to see the Eighth Young Master again for another two years. She already seemed to have reached her limit after being apart for the past two years, so it might be better to let them be together for just a few months.'
However, the answer that came from Hyeokryeon Hwan’s mouth was something that even Lady Cheonghwa had not anticipated.
"What are you talking about, dear? Seon-ah won't be entering the Hall of the Demonic Way!"
"What do you mean? Don't tell me you're planning to send her to the Hall of the Demonic Way when she turns eighteen in three years?"
Lady Cheonghwa was thinking of the newly reorganized education system of the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult.
The system that would delay the start of Demonic Arts training to sixteen and naturally push back the Hall of the Demonic Way entrance to eighteen was scheduled to be implemented in a few years.
But that system was only for young children who hadn't started learning Demonic Arts yet.
Her daughter, who had begun learning Demonic Art around age ten, wasn't part of that group.
And Hyeokryeon Hwan wasn't referring to that system either.
"Thanks to the Family Head, I already couldn't see my daughter for three and a half years! And now you want us to be separated for another two years? What kind of horrible thing is that to say! No way! She’s not going anywhere until she’s thirty!”
"......"
At the doting father’s declaration, Lady Cheonghwa felt doubt for the first time.
Doubt about whether she had made a mistake marrying this man.
Maybe it was because of her existential crisis.
"Urgh."
She suddenly felt a strange wave of nausea.
"My dear!!"
Seeing his wife's condition, Hyeokryeon Hwan's face went pale.
Lady Cheonghwa was also a woman who had learned Demonic Arts as a member of the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult, only stopping her training after conceiving their first child, Seon-ah.
Hyeokryeon Hwan was convinced that his daughter's running away had triggered Qi Deviation in his wife.
'That damn Eighth Young Master!!'
Thinking this was also Il-mok's fault, Hyeokryeon Hwan quickly carried his wife and rushed toward the medical quarters.
Seeing Hyeokryeon Hwan's pale complexion and Lady Cheonghwa in his arms, the physicians quickly brought Lady Cheonghwa inside.
After waiting tensely in one corner of the medical quarters for a while...
The door opened and one of the physicians came out to approach Hyeokryeon Hwan.
"Is my wife alright?!"
The physician smiled and answered.
"Congratulations, Young Lord Hyeokryeon. Your wife is expecting your second child."
It had been about a month since Hyeokryeon Hwan finished his closed-door training.
And since they hadn't seen each other in three and a half years, they'd been... busy.
News of Lady Cheonghwa's pregnancy spread quickly, and the Hyeokryeon Family was in an uproar. The child is the direct line of the current Family Head, and more importantly, this was a blessing that came fifteen years after their first child, Seon-ah.
Everyone in the Hyeokryeon family was on high alert regarding Lady Cheonghwa's wellbeing.
Since it was her first pregnancy in fifteen years, her safety was more important than anything else so much so that the matter of Seon-ah's running away was completely overshadowed.
Meanwhile...
Il-mok, who had no idea what was happening at the main headquarters, looked at Seon-ah traveling beside him.
She was smiling with a look of pure happiness on her face.
'That Young Lord gave permission for her to come along...'
That is what Hyeokryeon Seon-ah said when she came to find Il-mok early in the morning as he was preparing to leave the main headquarters.
Of course, Il-mok hadn’t believed her. It was just that…
‘She did say it was only until she had to enter the Hall of the Demonic Way…’
The kid's eyes had looked so desperate. Now their roles were reversed; soon she would be the one confined within the academy, unable to communicate with the outside world for two long years. Dıscover more novels at novel(ꜰ)ire.net
But this was only Il-mok's perspective.
Il-mok turned his head to look at Dam Bin.
While he technically held the highest position, in many ways, she could be considered the person in charge of this journey.
As a Squad Leader of the Hidden Guard Pavilion, she was responsible for assisting and protecting him.
Il-mok couldn't understand why she had accepted Hyeokryeon Seon-ah's lie.
And why had she also accepted that fellow as well.
"Hahaha! Just trust me, Hayeon! Thanks to my time in the combat unit, I now know Xinjiang like the back of my hand!"
Ouyang Mun was shouting confidently, but somehow, his words didn't inspire any confidence at all.
What’s more absurd is that Ouyang Mun joined this group as a member of the Hidden Guard Pavilion.
This crazy bastard had defected from the White Tortoise Corps and transferred to the Hidden Guard Pavilion.
He could guess why Dam Bin had accepted Ouyang Mun and Hyeokryeon Seon-ah into the group.
Like other organizations in the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult, the Hidden Guard Pavilion was desperate for talent, and both Hyeokryeon Seon-ah and Ouyang Mun definitely had the skills.
Especially since both of them were better than her actual trainees.
So even though they both had some personality issues, Dam Bin didn't care.
After all, finding someone with a normal personality among those living in the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult's main headquarters was like trying to find a needle dropped in the Xinjiang wasteland.
Ouyang Mun pestered Jin Hayeon enthusiastically.
"If we go just half an hour more from here, there's a small oasis where we can rest!"
And sneakily glanced over at Il-mok.
The biggest reason he had gone so far as to move from the White Tortoise Corps to the Hidden Guard Pavilion was because of Il-mok.
He was deeply impressed by Il-mok's talent and wanted to serve him.
This was, of course, complete bullshit.
Ouyang Mun may have acknowledged Il-mok’s talent, but he had no intention of living his life serving someone else.
The first reason he transferred to the Hidden Guard Pavilion was Ju Seo-yeon's case.
He had witnessed with his own eyes that getting seriously injured while trying to save Il-mok could lead to being embraced by Jin Hayeon, so he strived to take the chance.
The second reason was due to a sense of crisis.
'At this rate, Master might steal Hayeon away from me!'
The "Master" Ouyang Mun referred to was Il-mok.
When his sworn brother mentioned the topic of marriage, Ouyang Mun’s obsessive gaze was fixed upon Jin Hayeon. He had not failed to notice the subtle change in her expression when Il-mok mentioned his age preference.
Master claimed to have no romantic interest in her, but the human heart is a fickle thing! Who knows what might happen between those two while I'm not around!'
He was completely oblivious to the fact that he still had zero chance with her even if he stayed by her side constantly.
Or maybe he just doesn’t want to acknowledge that.
Il-mok briefly observed the pitiful girl and the pathetic young man who had suddenly joined their group, then sighed softly.
And so, a modest group of seven was formed.
Il-mok and Dam Bin. Jin Hayeon and Ju Seo-yeon, Ouyang Mun. Jeong Hyeon and Hyeokryeon Seon-ah.
Originally, a different configuration could have been created, but Il-mok’s influence had played a large part.
'One supervisor like Dam Bin is enough.'
What was his reason for heading to the Central Plains again? For Il-mok who was dreaming of a carefree life, having another eye from the Hidden Guard Pavilion accompany him would be inconvenient in many ways.
'I'll need to train to reach Transcendence, but I hate people breathing down my neck.’
So, he rode off with his new crew.
But as he dreamed of his comfy future, an ominous premonition settled in his heart.
'It can't be, right?'
They left the main base, went through the awful Xinjiang desert, passed the border gate, and then traveled the roads in Gansu for a few days. After more than ten days of riding horses and using their lightness skill, they finally reached Gulang County in Gansu Province.
Just one more step and he’ll welcome his long-awaited carefree life.
That’s when the Branch Leader of Gulang County welcomed him.
"Please, you have to stop Young Master Baek Cheon!"
Hearing that, Il-mok squeezed his eyes shut.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 184: The Way (2)
Seeing Il-mok’s negative reaction, the listening Jin Hayeon beside him voiced her question.
"Is there some problem with Young Master Baek Cheon?"
"There's a serious problem."
Il-mok added with a deep sigh.
"The guy's completely insane."
"......"
The scathing words coming out of Il-mok made Dam Bin and Jin Hayeon look at him with strange expressions.
'Even the Lord of Ten Thousand Demons admired Young Master Baek Cheon's ambition, so what's this about...'
'I heard that the head of the Baek Family was delighted because of the advice our young master gave to Young Master Baek Cheon.'
The rumors they'd heard and Il-mok's reaction didn't match up at all.
But somehow, Dam Bin and Jin Hayeon felt like Il-mok's words rang true.
And with good reason. The Branch Leader of Gulang County was enthusiastically nodding his head at Il-mok’s scathing criticism.
As if that wasn’t enough, Jeong Hyeon also smiled awkwardly and gave a look of affirmation.
Il-mok turned to the Branch Leader and asked, "So what kind of trouble has that lunatic caused now?"
"He's been nothing but trouble from start to finish. It's been about a month since Young Master Baek Cheon arrived here, but I haven't seen him act normal even once, Eighth Young Master."
The Branch Leader's answer gave Il-mok a strange sense of unease, and he frowned, "A month? What do you mean by that? It's been about a year since Senior Baek Cheon left for the Central Plains."
“It’s because he was kicked out of the other branches.”
"......"
Even as Il-mok was momentarily at a loss for words, the Branch Leader’s complaints continued. "He kept pulling the same attention-grabbing stunts at every county he visited, so he got kicked out of all of them before lasting even three months. Especially in Chengdu, I heard the entire branch nearly got wiped out because of Young Master Baek Cheon."
"What the hell did he do to cause such a disaster?"
"Apparently, he was running around saying he had to put on a play. And in Chengdu, he was making a fuss about learning face-changing opera, which caught the Sichuan Tang Family's attention. As if that wasn’t enough, he then supposedly picked a fight with them, calling the Tang Family’s hidden weapon techniques fake…”
Il-mok squeezed his eyes shut again.
'I did tell him to study theater in the Central Plains, but this madman actually went and…’
The Central Plains is basically an enemy territory for everyone from the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult.
The cult members in Central Plains branches were essentially spies, and naturally had to keep their identities hidden.
But Baek Cheon, being the attention-whore he was, hadn't done that.
True to his Demonic Art’s nature, he'd completely abandoned his duties as a spy.
Now, even Dam Bin seemed to understand what kind of person Baek Cheon was and wore an expression of disbelief.
Jin Hayeon, on the other hand, still maintained her flat face thanks to her White Hand Demonic Art. She just frowned for a bit and asked, "Why didn't you try to stop him?"
“He doesn’t listen to a single word I say. It was the same at the other branches. That's how he ended up getting kicked out all the way here."
While Gansu Province wasn't as remote as Xinjiang, it was still pretty much the backwater of the Central Plains.
Thanks to his family background, Baek Cheon was initially assigned to a more central location in the Central Plains.
But after causing trouble each time, he'd eventually been pushed out to this backwater among backwaters. While Il-mok was thinking this, Jin Hayeon asked another question:
"Then why don't you kick him out somewhere else like the other branches did?"
“As it happens, I have already sent a message to the main headquarters just like the other Branch Leaders did."
At that answer, Il-mok felt an ominous premonition.
"When exactly did you send that message?"
"It was about the third day after Young Master Baek Cheon arrived."
"Then that message would have reached headquarters roughly two weeks ago."
"That's correct."
Only then did Il-mok realize.
Why had he been specifically sent to this backwater place called Gulang County.
And why his master had suddenly arranged his schedule to send him out quickly.
'It was because of this crazy attention-seeker!!'
His master must have sent him here to deal with Baek Cheon.
And Baek Cheon's ridiculous attempts at making plays were one way or another because of him.
Realizing that all of this was his karma, Il-mok let out a deep sigh.
"So where is that lunatic right now?"
Il-mok and his group followed the Branch Leader out onto the streets of Gulang County.
After walking along the main road for a while, they soon reached Gulang County's marketplace.
Even without the Branch Leader saying anything, Il-mok and his companions had no trouble finding Baek Cheon.
Gansu Province was close to the backwater of the Central Plains, and Gulang County wasn't the capital or a major county within Gansu.
Since it wasn't a big county, there weren't that many people coming and going in the marketplace, so finding Baek Cheon wasn't difficult.
Actually, even if the place had been crawling with people, it would have been easy to find him.
It was to the point that even Dam Bin and Jin Hayeon, who'd never met Baek Cheon before, and Hyeokryeon Seon-ah and Ouyang Mun, spotted him easily.
"Today I shall show you all a play about a truly great person!"
There was the lunatic, yelling at the top of his lungs while channeling his internal energy.
n just one month since being assigned to the Gulang County branch, he'd apparently become something of a local attraction, with quite a crowd gathered around him.
Watching Baek Cheon wave his fan around dramatically while speaking exaggeratedly, Il-mok let out a deep sigh, "Miss Jeong."
"Y-yes, Young Master."
The moment Jeong Hyeon’s stutter reached his ears, Il-mok pointed at Baek Cheon and said, "Please shoot that bastard with your bow."
“D-do you mean I should hit his acupoints to subdue him?”
Il-mok shook his head at Jeong Hyeon’s reply.
"Just stick it right in his forehead."
“B-but he’ll die if I do that, Y-Young Master.”
“And wouldn’t that be more helpful for the Branch Leader here, our Heavenly Demon Divine Cult, and my own peace and well-being?”
"......"
Jeong Hyeon couldn't bring herself to say anything in reply, all the more so because his argument is valid.
Sensing the gazes of everyone except Jeong Hyeon and the Branch Leader were getting strange, Il-mok cleared his throat once.
"Ahem. That was a joke."
While Il-mok was regretting missing the chance to assassinate Baek Cheon:
"Young Master Il-mok!!"
Baek Cheon finally spotted Il-mok through the crowd and shouted.
"That crazy bastard really..."
Finding himself now also attracting the eyes of the crowd, Il-mok muttered a curse to himself and stepped forward.
"Hahaha. Long time no see!"
As Il-mok approached the lunatic with a smile, the crowd that had been watching Gulang County's local attraction spread out wide to make way.
While an attention-seeker makes for a fine spectacle, it seemed they had no desire to associate with one, nor with his acquaintances.
Thanks to that, Il-mok easily approached Baek Cheon's side and sent a telepathic message along with his greeting:
“So this is where you were.”
—I have an important matter we must discuss in private. Please come with me for a moment to a place where there are no people.
But Baek Cheon was as clueless as ever.
"Hahaha! I was just about to start my play. Since this is also thanks to Young Master Il-mok's advice, how about we have our conversation after you see the results of this past year!"
Il-mok kept his fake smile plastered on his face while gritting his teeth and sending another telepathic message.
—It’s an important story related to that play. How about you do the play after hearing what I have to say?
The mention of it being about the play seemed to work as Baek Cheon nodded with a smile.
"Then let's go together! Hahaha!"
Baek Cheon strode off with a hearty laugh, and the people who didn't want to catch his attention-seeking disease made way widely.
Thanks to that, they easily reached a deserted alley.
Baek Cheon looked at Il-mok with a face full of anticipation. "What's this about the play, Young Master Il-mok! If it's advice from you, I'll listen with all my attention anytime!"
The response to that thrust was Il-mok’s sweet smile.
"First, let's start with you getting your ass kicked."
"???"
Il-mok instantly lunged toward Baek Cheon.
Following the principles of the Soul-Stealing Heartless Sword that had now become completely ingrained in his body, Il-mok's sword flashed toward Baek Cheon.
Of course, Baek Cheon was also a talent who had completed the Hall of the Demonic Way and was a direct lineage from one of the Five Great Families, so even while flustered, he reacted to the surprise attack by stepping back with footwork while swinging his sleeve to shoot hidden weapons.
However.
Clang!
Il-mok casually deflected the hidden weapons Baek Cheon had shot like he was swatting away flies.
His speed in charging toward Baek Cheon didn't decrease at all, and his sword had closed the distance in an instant, piercing Baek Cheon's pressure points.
"Ugh."
Il-mok's demonic energy flowed through the Sword Qi that had reached the pressure points and suppressed Baek Cheon's blood flow.
With his body completely stiffened, Baek Cheon could only watch as Il-mok smiled refreshingly and swung his left fist.
Thwack!!
On a bright day, in a quiet alley in Gulang County, the sound of something getting pounded echoed repeatedly.
After refreshingly venting his anger, Il-mok returned to the branch carrying Baek Cheon over his shoulder.
Looking at Baek Cheon, whose face had turned all sorts of colors, Il-mok asked.
"Have you forgotten what you're supposed to do at a Central Plains branch?"
"I know what it is. Collect information from the Central Plains, right?"
Baek Cheon's confident answer was met with an incredulous look from Il-mok.
"Then why the hell did you act so conspicuously?"
“Gathering intelligence on the Central Plains is important, but recruiting new cult members in the Central Plains is also important! To do that, we spread the greatness of our cult far and wide!"
Baek Cheon felt wronged and argued.
"And wasn't this what Young Master Il-mok taught me! You told me to create plays about the greatness of past Heavenly Demons and spread our cult's grand intentions!"
The content of Baek Cheon's argument shifted everyone's attention to Il-mok.
The Branch Leader's eyes were full of resentment. His expression seemed to say, "So you were the root cause of all this?"
But not everyone reacted that way.
“So there was such a profound meaning behind it!! As expected of Young Master Il-mok!”
For some reason, Ouyang Mun had a moved expression on his face.
"While Young Master Baek Cheon's actions were excessive, his intentions seem truly admirable."
Dam Bin and Jin Hayeon also showed a somewhat peculiar reaction.
At those bizarre responses, Il-mok sighed and said:
"I agree that spreading the faith is important. But since this is the Central Plains, shouldn't we at least hide the cult's name while proselytizing?"
"How would we do that?"
When Baek Cheon asked that, most people looked at Il-mok with eyes full of trust and interest.
It was because of the things they had either heard through rumors or experienced for themselves.
Their gazes seemed to expect that if anyone could find a solution to any difficult problem, it would be the Eighth Young Master. ᴛʜɪs ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀ ɪs ᴜᴘᴅᴀᴛᴇ ʙʏ NoveI★Fire.net
Of course, Il-mok had just said whatever came to mind.
‘Did these nutjobs really just entrust the solution to me?’
Il-mok was about to let out a hollow laugh at the absurdity when something suddenly occurred to him.
'Wait a minute. The Heavenly Demon Divine Cult is a cult anyway, right?'
That evening.
Under a sky being painted with the light of the setting sun, a few outsiders approached the residents of Gulang County, who were busily moving about to wrap up their day.
A man who was relatively normal except for when he was in front of Jin Hayeon smiled cheerfully and struck up a conversation.
"Miss, you have such a benevolent aura flowing from your face. You seem to have been born with good fortune."
"M-me?"
As the woman hesitated and asked back at the sudden praise from a stranger, Ju Seo-yeon who was beside Ouyang Mun made her clear eyes sparkle as she said, "That's right. By any chance, have you heard about the Way (道)?"

content:
Chapter 185: Maitreya Luminous Cult (1)
Ouyang Mun and Ju Seo-yeon weren't the only ones out there doing missionary work. Jin Hayeon was paired up with Hyeokryeon Seon-ah.
It was Il-mok's way of being considerate by keeping Ju Seo-yeon and Ouyang Mun away from Jin Hayeon.
Jin Hayeon wandered around the marketplace and struck up a conversation with a young man.
"Excuse me, but I'm new to this area. Could you give me directions?"
The moment she spoke, the passing young man stopped dead in his tracks and stared at her with a dazed expression.
Despite her cold personality, Jin Hayeon was a beauty who could effortlessly catch the attention of anyone walking by.
"O-of course! I'd be happy to help!"
The guy was practically bursting with enthusiasm as Jin Hayeon asked him.
"Could you tell me how to get to the Windstream Inn?"
The Windstream Inn was the biggest inn in Gulang County, the kind of place anyone who'd lived here for even a few days would know about.
But even though she was asking about such a famous landmark, the guy didn't find it suspicious at all.
After all, this gorgeous young lady had said she was new to Gulang County, and more importantly...
‘A face like that could never tell a lie!’
His eyes were already glued to Jin Hayeon's face.
The guy happily led Jin Hayeon and Hyeokryeon Seon-ah to the Windstream Inn.
"Thank you so much, young hero."
"Hahaha. Y-young hero? That is far too grand a title for me.”
As the man laughed awkwardly and blushed, that's when Hyeokryeon Seon-ah stepped in.
"Since fate brought us together like this, how about we share some tea inside?"
"My sister speaks the truth. You've been so kind to us, shouldn't we return the favor? The tea will be on us, so please, join us.”
When they invited him for tea, the guy's mind was already painting rosy pictures of the future.
They went inside the inn and started with simple introductions before moving on to casual small talk.
"Hahaha!"
Even though they were just making pointless conversation, the guy's smile stretched from ear to ear.
It was almost dinner time, yet he seemed to have completely forgotten that his parents were waiting for him to eat with them at home.
‘Mom! Dad! Just wait a little longer! Looks like I might be getting a wife soon! Maybe even two!’
He probably thought he was being a good son right now.
While the guy was lost in his delusions, Jin Hayeon's smooth voice slipped into his ears.
“By the way, Young Hero Park, do you happen to follow any particular religion?" Follow current novels on novᴇlfire.net
While the two pairs were doing their missionary work, Dam Bin was also operating independently.
Just then, Jeong Hyeon sent a sound transmission to Il-mok/
—Y-Young Master, are you s-sure it's okay to do missionary work like this?
Because Jeong Hyeon was prone to panic attacks if anyone came within ten paces of her, she'd been excluded from the missionary activities and was acting as Il-mok's bodyguard instead.
As Jeong Hyeon’s question implies, this entire method of recruitment was conceived by Il-mok.
It was a playbook he knew by heart, having been on the receiving end of it countless times in his past life.
Everything from the classic old-school "Do you know the Way?" approach to asking for directions to famous landmarks as an excuse to start conversations.
‘Too bad there aren't any universities here. I can't pull the whole "I'm doing a college project and need to interview people" bullshit.’
There were countless ways to approach random strangers.
Thanks to being burned by all those countless methods during his life as Seo Ji-hun, it had become second nature to simply ignore any stranger who tried to speak to him on the street.
It was to the point where he wondered if the reason the sense of communal warmth between people had vanished from the cities of South Korea might've been because of all those damn cults.
And to put it another way…
‘If these tactics worked in suspicious modern cities, there's no way they won't work in this medieval era.’
Jeong Hyeon's worries were completely pointless. If anything, he should be worried about things going too well.
After the sun had completely set, Il-mok greeted the returning missionary team with a bright smile.
"Good work, everyone. Did you make sure to clearly state the time and place at the end?”
The five who'd been doing missionary work all gave positive responses to Il-mok's question.
"Then just bear with it for a few more days."
Il-mok had no intention of keeping up this missionary approach.
Because of guilt?
Not even close.
‘If I keep pulling these stunts in such a small place, we'll stand out. I'm not Baek Cheon. I can't afford to do that.’
Gulang County wasn't a city; it was a small community with a finite number of faces and would quickly attract notice.
What they'd done today was just laying groundwork.
Building at least a minimal foundation for the real missionary work to come.
"Here's a simple form I prepared. Use this format to organize information about the potential converts you talked to today."
The form was nothing special; it was just their names, ages, hobbies, relationships, and personality traits they'd picked up during conversation.
However, the information from this simple form would become a massive asset for future missionary activities.
Jin Hayeon looked down at the paper Il-mok handed her, then raised her head.
"I followed your instructions for now, Young Master, but I'm not sure if this approach is right."
"Even though this form looks simple, it'll be a huge asset later."
"I wasn't referring to the form. I was questioning whether it's right to pull people in through simple friendship rather than actually teaching them our doctrine."
A few other thoughtful members seemed to share similar doubts as they too looked at Il-mok with skeptical eyes.
They seemed to feel that people who became believers just because of friendship rather than truly believing in the doctrine couldn't be trusted.
Well, everyone besides Seon-ah and Baek Cheon.
Meanwhile, Ouyang Mun and Ju Seo-yeon were staring at Jin Hayeon, who'd asked the question.
"Hmm."
After scanning the crazy bunch, Il-mok looked at the ones he could actually have a logical conversation with. Which are Dam Bin, Jin Hayeon, and Jeong Hyeon.
"You need to think about this backwards. We’ve been exposed to our Divine Cult's great doctrine since childhood, but to the people of the Central Plains, our doctrine is unfamiliar. Hmm. Think of it like food, for example."
"Food?"
"Right. Imagine someone served you a new dish from a foreign land instead of something you're used to eating. Something weird-looking that you've never seen before."
"Young Master, your analogy is problematic."
“Are you suggesting that the doctrines of the Divine Cult are weird?"
When Dam Bin and Jin Hayeon pointed this out, Il-mok shook his head.
"At least to the people here, it might seem weird."
To be honest, it wasn’t just the locals; even Il-mok thought it was pretty weird.
"Anyway, how would you feel if a complete stranger from a foreign land tried to force you to eat that weird-looking food?"
“Like I was being poisoned.”
"Exactly right. On the flip side, what if people you knew or were close to were all eating that food together and enjoying it?"
“...You might be wary, but you’d also be curious, wouldn’t you?” Jin Hayeon answered, and the others started to understand Il-mok's intention.
For their benefit, Il-mok added.
"Also, this approach has another strength. One of the things humans find hardest to sever is precisely our human emotions. Unlike approaching people by revealing our religion from the start, if they've already become close to us and their friends and family belong to us... the potential converts won't be able to leave easily."
Il-mok knew this from knowledge he'd picked up in the modern world.
One reason people who got tricked into joining cults couldn't leave even after realizing the truth was exactly this.
"Finally, we'll need to soften our doctrine when we first teach it. Like I said, to them, our doctrine is weird foreign food. Rather than forcing them to eat foreign food as-is, shouldn't we make it a bit more familiar to the local people?"
“In what way should we soften it?"
For some reason, Il-mok’s gaze fell upon Jin Hayeon.
"I think we should borrow the method Miss Jin used to teach me in the past. We'll omit the title 'Heavenly Demon' and use the name Maitreya, teaching that Maitreya will come in the future to punish the wicked."
“…Are you saying we should only reveal our true identity to those who later come to truly believe in our Divine Cult?”
Il-mok nodded at Jin Hayeon’s question and spoke.
"Exactly. Until we reveal our identity, we won't be called the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult. We'll operate under the name Maitreya Luminous Cult, in the sense that Maitreya will one day judge evil and reveal the light.”
The missionary work continued for two more days after that.
The five carried out missionary activities in different parts of Gulang County on different days, making contact and conversing with various people.
Following Il-mok's orders not to be too conspicuous, they stopped the missionary activities after that, and two more days passed.
One evening, several people gathered toward the middle slope of a low mountain near Gulang County.
"Welcome."
"Thank you so much for keeping your promise."
The five who'd done missionary work for three days total came forward to greet each person they'd invited as they showed up.
Against all odds, Jin Hayeon had brought in the largest number of potential converts despite being the most skeptical of this approach and the one who lacked social skills.
But Il-mok wasn't surprised by this.
‘The laws of logic don't apply when you're that beautiful. A pretty face is its own plot armor.’
Every single guy who'd had even a brief conversation with her boasted perfect attendance.
‘This is why men need to be most careful of honey traps.’
He conveniently ignored the fact that he had been the one to weaponize her beauty in the first place.
"Huh? What brings you here?"
"Brother Jang, I should be asking you the same thing.”
Maybe because Gulang County was small, there were many among the invited guests who knew one another.
And mixed in among them was another arrangement Il-mok had prepared.
The martial artists from the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult's Gulang County branch.
They'd been living here for at least several years, some for over a decade, so they were practically locals.
They could naturally melt into the crowd, pretending to know nothing, and help shape the atmosphere.
The people gathered in the small clearing had casual conversations under the moonlight.
At first, they exchanged brief greetings and small talk, but throughout the conversation, several people with assigned roles naturally brought up religious topics.
"We believe that in the future, Maitreya will come to punish all the wicked and open the way to a peaceful world.”
"Heaven's net may seem loose, but no evildoer will escape it."
But not everyone was fooled by this artificial atmosphere.
"What naive thinking. This is a world where trying to live righteously only gets you hurt.”
As the young man spoke in a sullen tone, a woman chimed in.
"That's right. If the wicked really get punished, why are those bastards still living just fine?"
Just as an unsettled mood began to spread because of their words...
Il-mok, who had been watching from beyond the bushes while using his concealment arts, stepped forward.
Il-mok had somewhat expected this.
He knew that sooner or later, their message of hope would crash against the rocks of reality.
In a world where evildoers ran rampant, saying that the wicked would be punished in the future was nothing but empty words.
And here in Gulang County, there was a gang of criminals who'd made themselves at home.
The kind of bastards who extorted money by threatening people, engaged in loan-sharking as a daily business, and even coerced those who couldn’t repay their debts into selling their women as prostitutes.
“Are the bastards you speak of the Red Serpent Gang?"
When Il-mok suddenly appeared from the bushes wearing a mask, everyone in the clearing turned their attention to him.
The reason Il-mok felt no guilt about using those damn missionary tactics he'd experienced in the modern world...
...Was because of the Red Serpent Gang he'd learned about while getting explanations about Gulang County from the Branch Leader.
Il-mok still thought of the Demonic Cult as a den of lunatics, but...
‘The Demonic Cult might be full of crazy bastards, but they're not scumbags.’
They didn't pull the kind of evil shit you'd expect from cults, like sexual offerings.
Their only problem was the fact that they relied purely on force to achieve what they believed was right.
That’s why...
“I am the Incarnation of Maitreya, sent forth into the mortal world before he cleanses it. Maitreya has decreed that there is a gathering of evil in Gulang County and commanded me to root them out to save the people."
Tonight, Il-mok planned to deliver justice for the people of Gulang County as payment for his missionary activities.
The Heavenly Demon Divine Cult's brand of salvation.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 186: Maitreya Luminous Cult (2)
On the outskirts of Gulang County, where only the faint moonlight settled.
In this pitch-black night, only one estate stood illuminated by torches—a compound bearing the nameplate "Red Serpent Gang."
"Haaaaah."
One of the Red Serpent Gang’s men on watch yawned, prompting his companion to offer him the gourd hanging at his side.
"Here, drink some of this."
The guard brought the gourd to his nose, and the sharp smell of cheap rice wine hit his nostrils. But he didn't seem bothered by it; he gulped it down without hesitation.
"Ugh, damn it. Who the hell's gonna attack us in this backwater village? We're gonna freeze our asses off standing watch."
Hearing the complaint from the one who'd been drinking, his companion extended his hand as if asking for the gourd back.
"That's exactly why I brought this along. Without it, how could we stand living in such a miserable situation?"
The guard who'd been drinking handed back the gourd, then glanced toward the inner courtyard of the estate. It wasn't because he was afraid of getting caught drinking and gossiping while on duty.
"That girl's got quite the pretty face, doesn't she?"
His eyes gleamed with lustful desire.
"Heheh. That’s why the boss set up her moron of a father. She’ll fetch a fine price on the market.”
"Before we sell her for a good price, we should have some fun with her ourselves."
“Get in line. We’ll get our turn once the boss has had his fill. He’ll toss her to us when he's done.”
The two continued their crude conversation while passing the cheap rice wine back and forth.
Just then, the guard who'd brought the wine tilted his head with a puzzled expression, then narrowed his eyes and pressed his face to the window.
Peering through the tiny opening cut into one side of the gate, he muttered, "Someone's coming."
Through the darkness, a figure dressed in black robes was approaching.
"Isn't that the girl's father?"
His companion asked, recalling similar incidents from before, but the guard staring intently through the window shook his head.
As the distance closed, the face of the approaching figure became visible in the moonlight.
'A mask?'
The person was wearing a mask that looked vaguely familiar from his childhood visits to temples. It had an angry expression etched into it.
Thud. Thud.
With steady footsteps, the masked intruder approached the gate. The guard watching through the window called out, “Who the hell are you!”
"I am the incarnation that Maitreya has sent ahead to this world to cleanse you bastards."
At the masked man's response, both guards burst into mocking laughter.
"This guy's completely insane."
“Looks like he came here looking to die.”
The two guards exchanged glances and jokes, but soon felt something was wrong.
'Hey, why are you falling sideways?'
'What about you?'
The colleague in front of him was tilting over.
No, the entire world was tilting.
Slice!
A delayed cutting sound echoed through the air, and their upper bodies began falling as it separated from their lower halves.
Creeeeak.
CRASH!
And so did the gate as it crashed in two.
Inside one of the Red Serpent Gang's halls.
"Fuck."
A young man spat out curses as he glared toward where the boss's quarters were located.
“I’m the one who did all the goddamn work.”
He was the one who had brought a woman to the Red Serpent Gang today.
She was someone he'd known before. A woman he'd approached with romantic interest, only to be coldly rejected.
"I prefer men who live honestly, like my father."
It had been a humiliating answer. It felt like she looked down on him for being involved with the Unorthodox Path.
How dare a mere commoner disrespect him, a martial artist? He wanted revenge.
So he'd tricked her father into borrowing money and kept quiet for six months, waiting for the debt to multiply tenfold.
In just a few months, the debt had indeed grown ten times larger to an impossible amount for that "honest" man to repay. Eventually, she was forcibly sold off.
He thought his revenge had succeeded. He'd get to have his fun with that bitch who'd looked down on him before she was sold off as a prostitute.
But as soon as it was revealed that she was inexperienced with men, that damn boss's eyes lit up with greed.
Whether it was because of his half-baked revenge or his anger toward the boss, the young man couldn't fall asleep at all.
Creeeeak.
CRASH!
Just then, a dull and heavy boom echoed in the man's ears.
"Who goes there!!"
The Red Serpent Gang's thugs, awakened by the commotion, began rushing out one by one with weapons in hand.
"Fuck."
The young man also stepped out, his face brimming with killing intent as he drew his saber.
He wanted to vent his frustration on the boss.
Once outside, his eyes fell upon the sight of a man surrounded by his Red Serpent Gang comrades.
The stranger wore a bizarre get-up of black robes and a wrathful deity mask.
But his curiosity about the strange outfit was brief. More than anything, he felt disappointed.
"Heheh. I've been bored these past few days without tasting blood."
"I'll turn you into a damn pincushion."
Before he could even get involved, his colleagues surrounding that man would tear him to shreds.
'Am I too late again?'
Just as the young man clicked his tongue in disappointment at missing another chance to vent his anger—
"Tsk."
Suddenly, light flashed across the cloudless night sky like lightning.
The young man wondered if he was seeing things.
But he wasn't mistaken.
Like lightning followed by thunder, a delayed sound came after the flash of light.
Slice!
Immediately after, the bodies of his colleagues surrounding the intruder collapsed like puppets with cut strings.
"..."
Still wondering if he was hallucinating, the young man unconsciously rubbed his eyes.
When he opened them again, the courtyard floor was soaked with blood, and the heads of those who'd fallen like puppets were all separated from their bodies.
"Holy shit..."
Finally grasping reality, the young man's entire body broke out in goosebumps.
'I need to run...'
His face paled with terror.
The young man quickly tried to turn and flee, but his feet wouldn't move.
It wasn't because his body had frozen with fear. It was simply because...
Slice!
His head was already falling toward the ground.
The Red Serpent Gang boss's quarters.
"Heheheh."
A middle-aged man gazed with a sinister smile at a woman dressed in clothes that revealed glimpses of her skin.
Despite the heavy makeup and outfit making her appear older, she looked too young to be called a woman.
"To come forward to pay your father's debt, what a filial daughter you are."
The Red Serpent Gang boss spoke to the trembling girl.
"No need to fear. I'm not going to do anything that would damage your market value. Heheh. Think of tonight as a lesson from a seasoned veteran. Pay attention, and you’ll learn what you need to know to pay off your father's debt."
Upon hearing that the woman had no experience with men, the Red Serpent Gang’s boss was more than willing to personally "educate" her.
It was the boss's way of showing consideration for a woman about to be sold as a prostitute.
He'd done this often enough before to know exactly what to prepare, even having outfits like the one she wore right now.
“First, come here and try pouring me a drink.”
When the young woman only trembled harder, his expression turned menacing.
"Do you want to see your father die?"
Startled by the boss's threat, the woman approached him with tears welling in her eyes.
Just as she was about to pick up the wine bottle—
CRASH!
A dull noise echoed from beyond the quarters.
"Who goes there!!"
The Red Serpent Gang's thugs began shouting one after another.
The boss frowned as the woman flinched at the commotion and began to tremble.
"Now, now. Hurry up and pour the wine."
Confident that his subordinates would handle whatever was happening outside, the boss reached out his hand toward the woman.
When the boss's hand touched the woman's hand holding the wine bottle, she shuddered as if a snake were crawling up her arm.
Even as the sounds of commotion, screams, and clashing metal continued from beyond the quarters, she endured.
'Please...'
She fought back the tears, forcing herself to be strong for her father’s sake.
The boss's blatant stare at her exposed skin made her feel as if snakes were slithering all over her body.
Just as she poured wine into the boss's cup, overwhelmed by shame—
Slice!
With a clean cutting sound, as if the neck of a snake were being lopped off, the door to the chamber was sheared away.
“Well, you’re certainly having the time of your life.”
Il-mok scoffs at the sight of the boss enjoying himself with the woman in his quarters and completely oblivious to his subordinates dying outside.
“Who the hell are you!!”
The boss finally bellowed, fumbling for the massive blade at his side.
"Is that the Red Serpent Gang’s official greeting? Why does every bastard who pops up say the exact same thing? I can't figure it out."
Despite Il-mok's provocative words, the Red Serpent Gang boss didn't dare attack recklessly.
‘He defeated all of them in that short span of time?’
Several seconds had passed since the strange, masked intruder arrived at his hall, yet there was still no sign of any subordinates chasing him from behind.
Only the bodies of a few subordinates could be seen lying on the ground in the darkness.
While the masked intruder and the Red Serpent Gang boss faced each other—
"Please help me!!"
The girl hurriedly threw herself toward Il-mok as she cried out.
"You bitch, how dare you!!"
The enraged Red Serpent Gang boss quickly swung his saber at the girl, but—
Clang!
The Sword Qi that Il-mok had fired instantly sent the Red Serpent Master’s saber flying.
With the girl safe, Il-mok looked at her as she rushed toward him.
Facing Il-mok in his wrathful deity mask, the girl cried out with a tear-streaked face:
“P-Please, s-save my father and me. P-please.”
It was an explanation that omitted all context, but Il-mok could grasp the general situation.
"Step back, close your eyes, and cover your ears."
After telling the girl this, Il-mok approached the Red Serpent Gang boss.
Watching the angry-masked intruder approach him, the Red Serpent Gang boss swallowed hard.
He already knew the truth.
The man approaching him was a master on a completely different level.
It wasn't just because he'd killed all his subordinates in such a short time.
When his sword had been blocked by this man's Sword Qi earlier, the Red Serpent Gang boss hadn't even been able to properly see the motion of the intruder drawing his sword.
So the Red Serpent Gang boss shouted, "S-stop! Don't you know that the Heavenly Orchid Society backs our Red Serpent Gang?"
"Heavenly Orchid Society?"
When Il-mok halted his steps and repeated the name, the Red Serpent Master hurriedly shouted.
"Y-yes! Our Red Serpent Gang pays tribute to the Heavenly Orchid Society!"
Seeing the angry-masked intruder stop, the Red Serpent Gang boss's tongue worked frantically.
"You must not know, great hero, but nothing will change even if you kill this boss! We don't do this because we enjoy it! To meet the tribute demands from the Heavenly Orchid Society, we have no choice but to..."
The Red Serpent Gang boss's excuse trailed off. Tʜe source of this ᴄontent ɪs novｅlfire.net
He'd finally seen the cynical smile plastered on the lips visible through the intruder’s wrathful deity mask.
To Il-mok's ears, the Red Serpent Gang boss's excuse was absolutely ridiculous.
It wasn't just because of the absurd pretext spat out by a man who had been luring a young woman into his room to make her serve him in strange ways.
"The Heavenly Orchid Society is your backing, huh? Then who do you think backs me?"
The sight of this fool invoking the Heavenly Orchid Society as his backing in the presence of the mighty Heavenly Demon Divine Cult was simply too amusing.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 187: Maitreya Luminous Cult (3)
The Red Serpent Gang's boss's eyes widened like saucers at the intruder's cocky response.
"B-backing? What kind of backing are you—"
He couldn't even finish his sentence.
Clang!
The wrathful-masked man had already lunged forward with his sword, and the Red Serpent Gang boss was scrambling just to block the first strike.
He barely managed to swing his saber and deflect the initial attack, but his stance crumbled completely.
Through his wavering vision, he saw the intruder's sword coming at him slowly.
But somehow, even though the enemy's sword looked sluggish, he couldn't block it.
It wasn't that Il-mok's sword had slowed down. Time itself seemed to crawl when death was staring you in the face.
"Gkk..."
His heart pierced clean through, the Red Serpent Gang’s boss collapsed to the ground with a choked gasp.
Shortly after Il-mok stormed into the Red Serpent Gang estate, people began gathering around the estate.
Some of them had been at that meeting on the mountainside near Gulang County earlier.
"Are you out of your damn mind? Do you have any idea what place that is?”
"Well, since he made such a big claim, we should at least see it with our own eyes."
"You seriously believe what that guy said?"
They weren't exactly rushing in with complete confidence.
A few driven by curiosity or faint hope had taken the lead in following Il-mok, while others—trying to stop them or seeking comfort in numbers—tagged along with nervous uncertainty.
They crept closer to the Red Serpent Gang estate under the moonlight, while carefully keeping their distance out of fear. That's when they noticed something bizarre.
“Th-that over there. Isn’t that the gate to the manor?”
"The gate's been split in half?"
Only then did they realize the Red Serpent Gang's gate had been cleaved apart and lay scattered on the ground with two corpses sprawled in front of the broken gate.
Right at that moment—
"AAAAHHHHH!"
"P-please, spare me..."
Screams and desperate pleas for mercy echoed from inside the compound.
"Eek!"
Watching nervously from a distance, the people of Gulang County turned pale and staggered backward.
But the commotion died down as quickly as it had started.
"......"
The ashen-faced residents looked at each other.
“D-don’t tell me… he killed all of them?”
"Should we go inside and check?"
"Hey, you idiot! What if that masked guy got taken down instead?"
The funny thing was that not a single one of them was worried about the Red Serpent Gang thugs.
That's how deep the townspeople's hatred for the Red Serpent Gang ran.
As they stood there, unsure what to do and glancing nervously at each other—
Step. Step.
Faint footsteps reached their ears.
The residents stared at the Red Serpent Gang's entrance with tense faces.
Soon, two figures emerged through the wide-open gate.
One was a man wearing a wrathful mask, and the other was a girl too young to be really called a young woman.
The girl Il-mok had rescued felt uneasy seeing people gathered at the Red Serpent Gang entrance.
Most were faces she recognized. After all, she was also a resident of Gulang County.
Maybe it was seeing familiar faces that finally loosened her tongue. The girl who had been frozen stiff finally spoke up.
“G-Great Hero. M-may I a-ask you just one thing?”
"Go ahead."
Hearing the masked man's response, the girl asked hesitantly.
"W-who are you?"
What she saw next was absolutely bizarre.
Behind that angry mask, the man's lips were curved upward in a pleasant smile.
"I am the incarnation of Maitreya."
"The incarnation of... Maitreya?"
As the girl blinked in confusion at this unimaginable answer, the masked man had already vanished without a trace.
Instead, others rushed forward to fill the empty space.
"Cheong-ah! Are you okay?"
"What happened in there?"
The residents who'd come to the Red Serpent Gang bombarded the girl with questions.
The girl who'd been dragged to the Red Serpent Gang for unfortunate reasons had just become an unwitting witness to a religious event.
Using stealth techniques to hide himself, Il-mok made his way to the Gulang County branch of the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult.
"Whew."
Sighing lightly, Il-mok stripped off his sweat and blood-stained clothes and submerged himself in a pre-prepared bath.
As he washed himself in the still-warm water, he muttered to himself with relief.
"That was close." ʀᴇᴀᴅ ʟᴀᴛᴇsᴛ ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀs ᴀᴛ n͟o͟v͟e͟l͟f͟i͟r͟e͟.net
He wasn't talking about the fight at the Red Serpent Gang.
Trying to move in stealth while covered in blood and sweat had nearly triggered his hygiene obsession. Just because he was starting to break free from the Extremity didn't mean the side effects had disappeared completely.
After thoroughly cleaning himself and putting on fresh clothes, Il-mok sensed people entering the branch.
"Did you bring everything?" Il-mok asked the group of people dressed in black.
They were his lunatic group.
They had used stealth techniques to sneak into the Red Serpent Gang compound while Il-mok raised hell inside.
In response to Il-mok's question, they each held out what they'd gathered.
Gold and silver coins, jewelry, ledgers, and other valuables filled their hands.
Their mission had been to steal the account books the Red Serpent Gang bastards had kept and whatever money they'd greedily hoarded.
Ju Seo-yeon and Baek Cheon were left to monitor the crowd's mood.
The Red Serpent Gang wasn't that big, so five people were plenty. Plus, those two weren't exactly suited for this kind of work.
‘At least I hope they don't cause any trouble.’
An airhead and an attention-whore weren't exactly great for covert operations.
The odd one out was Hyeokryeon Seon-ah.
Il-mok's original plan was to leave her at the gathering since he had assumed he wasn’t familiar with stealth techniques due to her limited training and education.
But who would have known that Hyeokryeon Seon-ah could use stealth skills and insisted on coming along.
‘Must've learned it from her family.’
Il-mok figured it was nothing special, considering that Jeong Hyeon had also been well-versed in concealment arts before his admission to the Hall of the Demonic Way.
Il-mok addressed those holding out books and treasure.
“Hand these over to the Gulang County Branch Leader. Instruct him to send one-tenth to the main headquarters, leave one-tenth here as operational funds, and for the rest, check the ledgers and return appropriate portions to people who were robbed."
“As you command!”
"Oh, and tell the Branch Leader to look into something called the Heavenly Orchid Society."
"The Heavenly Orchid Society?"
"That's right. The Red Serpent Gang boss mentioned them before he died. Said the Heavenly Orchid Society was their backing."
"We'll have the Branch Leader investigate, and we'll gather information separately as well."
Responding to Il-mok's orders, Dam Bin directed the group to organize the money and documents in one place.
After the Red Serpent Gang fell overnight...
"Did you hear that story?"
"About the Maitreya Luminous Cult?"
Word of the Maitreya Luminous Cult began spreading through Gulang County.
"Come on, you don't actually believe that nonsense, do you?"
"Hey, you stubborn fool. I saw it with my own eyes that night. That Incarnation of Maitreya swept away those Red Serpent Gang scumbags."
People talk about the Divine Cult’s doctrines even without being goaded by the cult’s warrior. And of course, the cult’s warrior didn’t waste this opportunity.
"Maitreya is definitely protecting our Gulang County!"
“Believe! Blessings will come to those who believe!”
The most enthusiastic among them was Baek Cheon. That being said, he wasn't causing a commotion by gathering people like he usually did.
Instead, whenever one of the martial artists from the Gulang County branch subtly spread a rumor about the Maitreya Luminous Cult to the villagers—
"Is that really true?!"
"Wow. If that story's real, then calling him the Incarnation of Maitreya isn't strange at all!"
—Baek Cheon would act like he was hearing it for the first time, using exaggerated acting to sway people.
He'd fallen for Il-mok's smooth talk.
"Performing on stage isn't the only kind of acting. Only when you can weave acting into daily life can you truly be called a master of the craft."
Deeply moved by Il-mok's advice, Baek Cheon threw himself into missionary work with this new approach.
And the mastermind behind this cult fever sweeping Gulang County was leisurely focusing on his training at the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult branch.
After Il-mok finished his internal energy cultivation and lowered his sword, Jin Hayeon who had been waiting alone to guard him threw a question.
"Young Master, I have something I'd like to ask."
"Go ahead."
"Was there a particular reason you personally took action against the Red Serpent Gang?"
While it might have seemed like concern for her charge taking on dangerous work on the surface, Jin Hayeon's question carried a deeper meaning.
'I do not doubt that the Young Master is a genius, but he's not usually one to take initiative.’
As someone who had been with Il-mok since his early days in the cult, she knew very well that Il-mok was quite lazy, contrary to his reputation.
"There are several reasons, but first... aren't they pitiful?"
"???"
Jin Hayeon looked confused by Il-mok's words.
"The people of Gulang County. Based on what I heard from the Branch Leader, they've been suffering a lot under the Red Serpent Gang."
Even with Il-mok's explanation, Jin Hayeon still looked puzzled.
It wasn't because she'd lost empathy from practicing the White Hand Demonic Art. Separate from empathy, she'd been indoctrinated through doctrine to save people.
It was just that...
“I was not aware that you were someone who'd go out of his way to handle troublesome matters just because others were suffering, Young Master."
It seemed strange for Il-mok to talk about compassion.
Of course, Il-mok also found it just as absurd that she questioned him about this.
'Just because she's a psychopath, does she see me as one too?'
Sensing some misunderstanding about himself, Il-mok shrugged and answered nonchalantly.
“And why would I not have sympathy?”
“It is just that you have always seemed rather indifferent to others.”
"I act indifferent precisely because I have compassion."
"???"
“If you go around getting involved and helping everyone here and there, it'd be too bothersome and exhausting. When I hear sad stories, I want to help, so I just choose not to listen in the first place."
"......"
Jin Hayeon could only make a bewildered expression at Il-mok's twisted logic.
But regardless of her feelings, Il-mok was speaking sincerely.
As he had once told the Heavenly Demon at Peach Blossom Ridge, Il-mok believed that even hypocrisy was a form of goodness. His choice to become a social welfare civil servant had similar reasoning.
Il-mok wanted to perform good deeds and help people in need in moderation. He wanted to arrive at work on time and leave work on time. He only wanted to help those who needed social services during his designated work hours.
He had no intention of doing good deeds to the point of exhaustion or burning himself out. He just wanted to perform small-scale, ordinary citizen-level good deeds, not saint-like acts.
Il-mok's reasons for getting involved this time followed the same logic.
In addition to pitying the people of Gulang County...
"Another reason was to hide my identity."
To avoid getting constantly dragged into work.
“Is that why you used the mask?”
"Exactly. In religious faith, mystique is important."
Though he packaged it nicely...
“For the sake of that mystique, I plan to wear the mask and step forward only when there are major issues in the future.”
He intended to use "mystique" as an excuse to dump all the trivial matters on others.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 188: Maitreya Luminous Cult (4) ᴛʜɪs ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀ ɪs ᴜᴘᴅᴀᴛᴇ ʙʏ nοvelfire.net
A few days later, late evening.
People started gathering on the mountainside near Gulang County.
They were coming together for the second assembly of the Maitreya Luminous Cult.
Thanks to the incident where the Red Serpent Gang fell, the number of attendees had easily tripled compared to the first gathering.
"Maitreya is the light and hope who will burn away all the world's evil and save us poor souls."
"Believe in him."
As the martial artists from Gulang County's branch led the sermon, the gathered common folk responded like they were chanting some kind of mantra.
“The Advent of Maitreya!"
“Salvation for All People!"
Among them, the most desperate in her prayers was that girl who'd been dragged to the Red Serpent Gang on that fateful night.
The girl named Cheong-ah had been with all her might even before joining the assembly.
She'd actually converted more new believers than the cult members from Gulang County's branch did.
"Repent! All of you, repent and believe in Maitreya! If you do, peace will come to you."
“The Advent of Maitreya!"
“Salvation for All People!"
Once again, someone's sermon continued, and those listening began reciting the prayer without anyone taking the lead.
Il-mok, who had been leisurely watching the gathering while hiding in a tree near the assembly area, felt a shiver run down his spine.
'Good thing I kept my identity hidden. Ugh.'
The whole thing just looked like it came straight out of a horror genre cult-themed movie.
The assembly went on for quite a while. Then, a middle-aged guy who'd been anxiously looking around with a restless expression suddenly spoke up.
"But isn't Maitreya's incarnation supposed to show up today?"
The Gulang County Branch Leader answered as if anticipating that question.
"Maitreya's incarnation is the one who cleanses evil in Maitreya's place. He only descends to the mortal world when there's evil like the Red Serpent Gang."
"But there is evil!"
At the man's cry, everyone's attention focused on the middle-aged guy.
With eyes that seemed touched by madness, he yelled out.
"That Old Man Park who runs the pharmacy in the marketplace! You all know what a horrible bastard he is, right? He makes sick people who can't even work pay for their medicine every single time! He's a vicious bastard who makes money off poor people's lives!"
Il-mok clicked his tongue internally as he watched from the tree.
'I knew this would happen.'
It was pretty much what he'd expected.
Humanity was not inherently virtuous. This was not a thought that came from being completely indoctrinated by the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult. He knew it all too well from dealing with these kinds of people so many times during his days as a civil servant.
Especially the malice and rage toward the world that festered deep in poor people's hearts. That shit was beyond imagination.
It went without saying that most of the troublemakers who gave civil servants hell were exactly those types of people.
“There’s someone even worse than Old Man Park!”
"What about Mrs. Chae from the upper district! She hounds her maids and servants so relentlessly that anyone who works there once comes out a sobbing mess!”
A different kind of madness swept through the Maitreya Luminous Cult's assembly.
The madness named ‘hatred,’ where people accused one another, praying that those they disliked would receive divine punishment.
After watching this for a moment, Il-mok used his lightness skill to jump down from the tree.
Thud.
By the time Il-mok's feet hit the ground, an angry mask had already appeared on his face.
"It's the incarnation!"
"Maitreya's incarnation has come!"
The believers who'd seen Il-mok at the first assembly shouted out, and people immediately started screaming all at once.
Screams filled with madness, begging him to kill everyone they had grudges against.
But their screaming didn't last long.
"SILENCE!"
The internal energy imbued within that shout swept away their madness.
“Hk…”
The waves of internal energy and killing intent radiating from Il-mok's body were way too heavy and terrifying for ordinary people to handle.
As silence fell over the area, Il-mok spoke in a low voice.
"Today, I have manifested here again because I sensed a flow of deep malice and resentment.”
Having said that, Il-mok suddenly pointed his sword at the middle-aged man who'd shouted first.
"Do you wish for this man called Old Man Park to die?"
"Y-yes."
The man answered while trembling, but with madness still in his eyes. A gray-colored energy began swirling around Il-mok's sword.
“What if you pay for your life in exchange for that?”
"?!"
While the man's face went white at the unexpected question, Il-mok spoke again.
"Have you truly committed no sins? Never told a lie in your life, never fought with anyone?"
"That's... that is..."
"Are you really confident that no one is praying to Maitreya for your death?"
The man whose face had gone pale couldn't bring himself to speak and hung his head to avoid Il-mok's gaze.
Only then did Il-mok slowly turn his head and look at the faces of several people who'd joined the assembly.
“You all are laboring under a great misunderstanding.”
His gaze fell upon those who had been so earnestly spitting out hatred just a moment ago.
"Maitreya will descend to punish the world's evil. So let me ask you this. Can you guarantee that you'll be able to escape Maitreya's divine punishment?"
Was it because of Il-mok's words? Or was it because of the murderous aura continuously emanating from his body?
Not a single person dared to confidently answer "yes" to Il-mok's question.
While everyone trembled with their heads bowed low, Il-mok's words continued.
"On the day Maitreya descends to this world, all the world's evildoers will receive divine punishment. So what should you be doing? Shouldn't you first think about avoiding evil and living to help others in order to escape Maitreya's wrath?"
Live a good life.
After spouting this clichéd message, Il-mok suddenly swung his sword toward empty air.
The Sword Qi that swept past the people frozen in terror traveled far and split a thick tree in the distance with a thunderous roar.
"Evil scums like those from the Red Serpent Gang will all be cast into hell's pit by Maitreya. When that day comes, a great light shall find those who have lived virtuous lives.”
After speaking so intimidatingly, Il-mok ended with those quiet words. The girl called Cheong-ah shouted out.
"I will repent! Every night I'll repent my sins, believing that Maitreya will punish the wicked, and I'll wait for that day!"
Right after she shouted that, the Gulang County Branch Leader also yelled.
“The Advent of Maitreya!!"
Following his lead, everyone gathered there and shouted in unison.
“Salvation for All People!!"
Why was it?
Despite realizing that Maitreya was not a kind god who would grant every wish they prayed for…
“The Advent of Maitreya!!"
“Salvation for All People!!"
The faith in the eyes of those gathered at the assembly had grown even deeper.
It was because of the reverence that came from fear.
Humans naturally don't feel admiration for beings they can control at will.
"Let us repent!"
“The Advent of Maitreya!”
“Salvation for All People!!”
Dam Bin also realized something thanks to the reverence in the eyes of the people fervently offering prayers.
She now understood why Il-mok had suddenly stepped forward to admonish the masses.
'Don't tell me the Young Master had anticipated everything up to this point?'
Amazed by Il-mok's scheme, she thought.
'Now I think I understand why the Supreme One cherishes the Eighth Young Master so dearly.'
The Gulang County Branch Leader was thinking the same thing.
Of course, Il-mok was just thinking. 'Phew. Now no one should come looking for me for a while.'
He had only threatened them because he couldn't be bothered to handle their unreasonable complaints.
The next afternoon.
Il-mok was swinging his sword alone at the deserted branch headquarters.
'Tsk. Guess that Red Serpent Gang’s boss is too weak.'
Unfortunately, he wasn't getting any particular insights.
The enlightenment that used to come rushing whenever he experienced real combat hadn't shown its face recently.
It’s clear that the higher one’s level, the more remote the prospect of gaining enlightenment becomes.
Creak.
When he heard the unpleasant friction sound and people returning to the branch, Il-mok lowered his sword.
“Good work.”
At Il-mok's praise, Dam Bin answered on behalf of everyone.
“We didn’t do anything. It's all thanks to you setting up the situation, Young Master."
The others nodded in agreement.
For Il-mok, it was a situation he couldn't quite relate to.
'They're happy even though I gave them more work to do.'
Three years since being dragged into the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult, and Il-mok still could not understand the thought process of these cultists.
“Furthermore, the investigation into the matter you instructed us on is roughly finished.”
As she said this, Dam Bin looked at the Gulang County Branch Leader, who stepped forward and spoke.
"The Heavenly Orchid Society that the Red Serpent Gang’s boss mentioned is a group of lawless heretical martial artists who claim to be the masters of Lanzhou, Young Master."
Lanzhou was the capital of Gansu Province.
Hearing the news that a bunch of heretic bastards had taken control of the capital, Il-mok frowned.
"Now, that surprises me. I can't believe the Murim Alliance is just leaving those guys alone."
Dam Bin just smiled coldly.
"Why would those hypocrites who call themselves the Orthodox Faction be interested in Gansu Province, which doesn't make any money?"
Her answer made Il-mok recall what he had learned about Gansu when he was learning in the main headquarters.
'I'm pretty sure I heard that Gansu Province used to be quite wealthy in the past.'
Hundreds of years ago, to be precise.
The Silk Road that was used when the Central Plains traded with the Western world was directly connected to Gansu province.
Countless merchants passed through Gansu Province to use the Silk Road on their way to Xinjiang, and naturally, there was a time when gold and treasures flowed into Gansu Province.
However, after going through periods of war, the number of people using the Silk Road rapidly decreased, and then an incident occurred that made it impossible to use Gansu Province as a trade route.
That incident was the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult establishing itself in Xinjiang about two hundred years ago.
With Gansu no longer viable as part of the Silk Road, the number of merchants visiting dwindled and Gansu Province gradually lost its vitality.
He even recalled hearing that because it was right next to Xinjiang, large sects and merchant caravans wouldn’t even come near the place, fearing that the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult could invade at any moment.
'It was because of these crazy cultist bastards.'
As Il-mok looked over his companions with disgust, Dam Bin misunderstood the meaning behind that look and added.
"The only factions that might be interested are the three from Sichuan Province and two sects from Shaanxi Province, but they're too busy watching each other to move easily."
The three from Sichuan were Qingcheng, Emei, and the Sichuan Tang Family, while the two sects from Shaanxi were Mount Hua and Zhongnan.
Though they were grouped together as orthodox sects, they weren't completely on the same side.
They could be described as having the kind of relationship where if one left home to occupy Gansu, the others would gladly ransack their rival’s empty house while wearing a smile.
Thinking about the Nine Sects & One Gang and the Seven Great Families, Il-mok remembered something from a martial arts novel he'd read in his previous life.
"Huh? But wasn't there a famous orthodox sect in Gansu Province? What happened to the Kongtong Sect?"
Though the name varied from novel to novel, and in most cases it only appeared at the level of being mentioned by name, Kongtong Sect was definitely a name often mentioned among the Nine Sects & One Gang.
And Kongtong Mountain, the base of the Kongtong Sect, was located at the edge of Gansu Province.
But for some reason, Dam-bin looked at Il-mok with a somewhat ambiguous expression.
"The Kongtong Sect is now just a sect that exists in name only, Young Master."
"That Kongtong Sect?"
When Il-mok asked back with a face that said he didn't understand anything, Dam Bin briefly organized her thoughts and then answered succinctly.
“Do you know of the greatest battle recorded in the history of the Third Heavenly Demon, the Hegemonic Heavenly Demon?"
As someone who had graduated first from the Hall of the Demonic Way, Il-mok understood the situation just from that seemingly random question.
The Hegemonic Heavenly Demon died over six hundred years ago. He was a figure from when the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult was still active in the Central Plains, and he led the cult's revival.
He was so renowned for his unconventional path of sweeping away anyone who displeased him that he was posthumously given the name Hegemonic Heavenly Demon.
As was customary for the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult, the majority of the Hegemonic Heavenly Demon’s accomplishments vanished like a mirage due to the war of succession that followed his ascension.
Anyway, according to the history he'd learned from the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult, the Hegemonic Heavenly Demon had once gone alone to sweep away some Daoist bastards who were spreading false teachings.
That battle where he slaughtered hundreds of Daoist priests by himself was recorded as the greatest battle among the Hegemonic Heavenly Demon's achievements.
So that meant.
'So hypocritical Daoist bastards that the Hegemonic Heavenly Demon swept away were the Kongtong Sect!!'
Il-mok realized just how biased and distorted the history he had been taught truly was.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 189: Heavenly Orchid Society (1)
While Il-mok was reeling from the shocking truth he'd just learned, Dam Bin continued.
"During the era when the Hegemonic Heavenly Demon was active, there was no such thing as the Nine Great Sects and One Gang. It was only after the Kongtong Sect was wiped out that some of its survivors scattered across the land and started their own Daoist sects. Over the long years, a few of these grew into massive organizations, eventually becoming what we now know as the Nine Great Sects and One Gang."
So the Kongtong Sect was basically the ancestor of several major Daoist sects.
It was only then that it finally clicked for Il-mok.
'It's honestly a miracle they made it to Xinjiang alive.'
If some of the sects within the Nine Great Sects and One Gang were founded by Kongtong Sect survivors, their hatred for the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult would be beyond imagination.
The fact that the Cult wasn’t completely wiped off the map and actually escaped to Xinjiang was nothing short of miraculous.
“So, which of the Nine Sects were the ones founded by the Kongtong descendants?”
"Mount Hua, Qingcheng, Diancang, and Kunlun. Though Kunlun no longer exists—Hainan took its place."
"...What the hell happened to Kunlun?"
Something about this felt ominous, so Il-mok had to ask.
"Do you happen to remember the history of the Ninth Heavenly Demon, the Blood Tear Heavenly Demon?"
At Dam Bin's response, Il-mok squeezed his eyes shut.
The Blood Tear Heavenly Demon was one of the names he'd memorized by heart during his entrance exam prep for the Hall of the Demonic Way, especially since his title was similar to the Blood Rain Heavenly Demon.
The Blood Tear Heavenly Demon lived about 160 years ago and was the Heavenly Demon who ruled after the cult was driven to Xinjiang—actually, he was the great-great-predecessor to the current one.
More importantly, he was the first Heavenly Demon to attempt to return to the Central Plains after being exiled to Xinjiang.
He got the name ‘Blood Tear Heavenly Demon’ from the story that he literally cried tears of blood when his invasion finally failed.
The next Heavenly Demon—the great-predecessor—also tried invading the Central Plains, and after that attempt also fell through, the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult entered a long, dark period lasting decades.
For ages, no one managed to truly master the Heavenly Demon Divine Arts since the cult leadership changed hands multiple times every few years or even decades. It wasn't until the current Heavenly Demon, Hyeokryeon Il-hwi, took the position that this dark age finally came to an end.
Learning from his predecessors' failures, the current Heavenly Demon focused on strengthening the cult's foundation rather than rashly attempting to reclaim the Central Plains.
While Il-mok was mentally replaying everything he’d ever learned about this, Dam Bin continued speaking.
"After the Blood Tear Heavenly Demon destroyed Kunlun Sect and pressed his advance, those cowards from Sichuan Province all ran away. And those despicable bastards gathered others under the name Murim Alliance and trapped the Blood Tear Heavenly Demon in an ambush."
And so, Il-mok had stumbled upon the founding of the Murim Alliance.
Seeing Il-mok with his eyes tightly shut, Dam Bin offered some consolation.
"But don't worry, Young Master. The Blood Tear Heavenly Demon remembered what happened with the Hegemonic Heavenly Demon and the Kongtong Sect. So, unlike with Kongtong, he made sure to wipe out every last trace of the Kunlun Sect."
What a truly comforting story that was.
As the fresh realization of what a batshit crazy group he’d joined washed over him, Il-mok pressed a thumb to his aching temple.
“Okay, I get why a bunch of scums can run wild in a major province. Tell me more specifically about this Heavenly Orchid Society or whatever it's called."
The Branch Leader answered Il-mok's question.
"To put it simply, they're trash that sucks the lifeblood out of the common people."
The Branch Leader opened some documents and pointed to several passages with his finger.
"As you can see, we found evidence that the Red Serpent Gang was using loan sharking to snatch up women, then shipping them off to the Heavenly Orchid Society instead of paying their usual tribute. When we investigated other nearby counties, we found similar patterns."
"So you're saying that, just like the Red Serpent Gang, other underworld organizations in nearby counties have been sending money and women as tribute in the same way?"
“Yes. Some of the women end up in brothels run by the Heavenly Orchid Society, while others seem to have been sold off somewhere else."
Il-mok's face twisted at the Branch Leader's explanation, and a wave of pure murderous aura washed over everyone else in the room.
'These crazy bastards are something else. '
A force that orchestrated human trafficking.
The Red Serpent Gang leader’s excuses might have been nothing more than that, just excuses, but this much was certain.
As long as the Heavenly Orchid Society existed, human trafficking would never disappear from Gansu Province.
Just then, urgent footsteps could be heard outside the door.
"Come in."
The second Il-mok gave the permission, one of the Gulang County branch's martial artists burst in and shouted.
"The Heavenly Orchid Society bastards are here!”
"The Heavenly Orchid Society?"
"Yes, Young Master. They're the ones who regularly visit Gulang County to deal with the Red Serpent Gang. Our people say they’re heading toward the estate right now.”
By the time the martial artist finished his explanation, Il-mok already had a mask on his face.
A mask of a wrathful Buddha.
