It had only been a few days, but the Red Serpent Gang's estate already felt like an abandoned husk.
"The Red Serpent Gang collapsed?"
Three men dressed in blue martial robes were pressing blades to a local resident's throat as they questioned him.
“Who did it?”
The man was so terrified his face had gone white, and he was too frozen to speak.
“Looks like we’ll have to make an example of him.”
Just as the Heavenly Orchid Society martial artist muttered this and swung his sword to cut off the man's arm, the woman beside him frantically shouted:
"It, it was the Incarnation of Maitreya!"
"Incarnation of Maitreya?"
The name was so unfamiliar to them that their face contorted when they heard that.
"Who the hell is that?"
The man kept his sword on her husband as he asked, and the woman froze, not knowing what to say.
She too had only heard about it through rumors spreading around Gulang County. She had no idea who this Incarnation of Maitreya actually was.
In a terrifying situation where her husband was a second away from having his head lopped off, the wife’s eyes darted around, desperately searching for something.
She was desperately hoping for help and looking for anyone who might know who this ‘Incarnation of Maitreya’ was.
And at some point, her gaze became fixed on something.
"Th-that person!"
There stood a man in black robes wearing the wrathful deity mask she'd only heard about in rumors.
The trio withdrew their swords from the villager and turned their attention to the man.
"So you're the bastard who destroyed the Red Serpent Gang?"
Looking at Il-mok's bizarre appearance, the three from the Heavenly Orchid Society smiled coldly.
"Seems like the Red Serpent Gang leader didn't tell you about us."
"He did."
"Oho. So you knew and still did it."
"What the Heavenly Orchid Society wants is the tribute amount. Not who's sending it."
“Hahahaha. You get it, don’t you?”
“So, what? You’re saying you’re taking over the Red Serpent Gang’s turf here in Gulang County?”
Il-mok answered their question with a nod and a jerk of his chin toward the Red Serpent Gang’s estate.
“How about we talk details inside?”
Il-mok walked confidently toward the estate while simultaneously sending a telepathic message to the couple.
—Get out of here while they’re following me.
The three from the Heavenly Orchid Society approached Il-mok without much suspicion, and meanwhile, the couple carefully retreated while watching for their chance.
And the moment those bastards came within Il-mok's range, silver trajectories embroidered the air.
A trajectory that sliced across the throat of the man walking in front.
Swick.
A delayed cutting sound echoed as the man's head separated from his neck and fell toward the ground.
Swick!
Il-mok's sword pierced the heart of another man who was belatedly drawing his blade.
"D-don't you fear the name of the Heavenly Orchid Society!"
The man who had barely managed to draw his sword while his two companions died trembled as he shouted.
His earlier swagger was completely gone, leaving him pathetically screaming the name of his gang.
“I don’t know why you think that bullshit works on me.”
Il-mok approached the man and answered with an indifferent expression.
“If I were scared of you, would I have done this?”
Realizing that threats weren't working, the man suddenly swung his sword at Il-mok.
However, the sword of the man in the angry mask pierced his heart faster than his own swing. Official source ıs novel(ꜰ)ire.net
"Kuk..."
Just after the man with the pierced heart collapsed with a choked groan—
"Forgive us, O Incarnation of Maitreya!!”
Someone's voice of repentance came from behind.
When Il-mok turned around, he saw a woman kneeling on the ground, bowing toward him.
It was the wife who had been threatened by the Heavenly Orchid Society thugs earlier.
"I dared to doubt and defile that sacred name! Please punish me, but please, please spare my husband!”
She confessed her sin for selling the name Incarnation of Maitreya to the Heavenly Orchid Society thugs.
She had blurted it out to save her husband, but she also knew what had happened at that gathering.
Understanding his wife's intention, the husband also quickly knelt down.
“It-It was my fault, Incarnation of Matreiya! Kill me, but please, s-spare my wife!”
Il-mok thought about how absurd this world was.
They were forced to do it with a knife on them and they still had to tremble and confess their sins like this.
“Keep doing exactly that. From now on, if anyone asks, you tell them the Incarnation of Matreiya did it."
The couple just stared up at him, completely confused by his answer.
"Sell my name to the villains who seek me. Maitreya protects me, so no evil can kill me. And tell my name to anyone who wishes for salvation. Tell them the Incarnation of Maitreya will destroy all evil."
They were stunned silent for a second by his answer.
The couple bowed again toward the Incarnation of Maitreya.
"Th-thank you!!"
“We’ll make sure everyone hears how great Maitreya is!”
When they finished bowing and looked up, the only things left in front of them were the three dead bodies.
Having quickly finished his business, Il-mok returned to the branch office with Dam Bin.
Only Il-mok had fought while wearing a mask to avoid exposing their identities. Dam Bin had been hiding nearby, ready to jump in just in case something went wrong.
"What do you plan to do now, Young Master?"
Il-mok took off his mask as he answered Dam Bin’s question.
“What else? We’re going to wipe out the Heavenly Orchid Society.”
Having said that, Il-mok turned to address the Branch Leader.
“How’s the money we recovered from the Red Serpent Gang?”
“Mostly sorted, Young Master.”
“Good. Give the people their share, send ten percent to headquarters like we discussed, and include a letter with the money.”
"A letter? What kind of letter?"
"Just tell them to send people to Lanzhou."
Jin Hayeon, who had been listening to their conversation, asked.
"Are you planning to attack the Heavenly Orchid Society after reinforcements arrive?"
Il-mok shook his head.
"It takes more than a day or two to make a round trip from here to headquarters. How could I wait for that?"
That answer left everyone who was listening with confused looks on their faces.
"Then why are you calling for reinforcements?"
"They're not reinforcements. It’s manpower. We’ll need people to manage Lanzhou and Gansu Province after I’m done cleaning up those scums.”
Il-mok looked toward the southeast where Lanzhou was located.
"We're attacking the Heavenly Orchid Society tonight."
After all, a surprise attack works best when the other side has no idea it’s coming.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 190: Heavenly Orchid Society (2)
The Gulang County Branch Leader opened his mouth with a complicated expression.
"I'm not doubting your abilities, Young Master, but isn't this a bit dangerous? Even though Gansu Province is practically abandoned by the Central Plains, the Heavenly Orchid Society controls an entire provincial capital."
The moment the Branch Leader questioned his order, fanatics like Baek Cheon and Hyeokryeon Seon-ah were about to have a fit, but Il-mok spoke first.
"We already killed the messenger they sent. So our options are either to launch a surprise attack before this information reaches them or to hunker down here for a siege. And if we end up in a siege, we won't be the ones taking the real damage."
Everyone gathered quickly realized who Il-mok meant by the real victims.
The innocent people living in Gulang County could suffer greatly, just like the couple Il-mok had saved earlier.
"And I'm not planning to fight recklessly. So tell me, what do you know about the Heavenly Orchid Society's combat strength? You must have something, either from your own digging or from the rumor mill, right?”
"The Heavenly Orchid Society’s leader, Maeng Gwak, is known as the Black Ghost Twin Sabers. They say no one’s actually seen him fight for more than ten years, not since the Heavenly Orchid Society took over Lanzhou. But there are rumors he used Force Qi in his last battle a decade ago."
"Force Qi... In Central Plains terms, that means the Supreme Peak Realm, right? Or the Realm of Truth (인해경(認解境))?"
Il-mok asked, recalling conversations with the Heavenly Demon.
It was back when he was getting ready to enter the Hall of the Demonic Way. Back when his Master would beat the crap out of him under the guise of "real combat training," claiming Il-mok got stronger whenever he was in danger.
Il-mok, who seriously thought he might actually die, often asked questions to buy time whenever their sparring sessions ended.
One of those questions was about the classification of martial realms.
—The realms of martial arts...
The Heavenly Demon stroked his beard and briefly explained the martial realms.
Those who had just succeeded in gathering internal energy in their dantian and were just learning martial arts were Third Rate. Those who could use internal energy to perform techniques were Second Rate. Those who had surpassed simply following predetermined movements and could freely manipulate internal energy according to various actions were First Rate.
Those who had gone beyond strengthening their bodies with internal energy and could project qi outward were called the Peak Realm. These are the people who can use things like Sword or Fist Qi.
Among Central Plains martial artists, reaching the Peak Realm is what makes you a ‘real expert.’
Occasionally, there are those who could forcibly squeeze out Sword Qi through superior martial arts regardless of their actual skill and were separately called Upper First Rate.
—Truly foolish and ignorant. Anyone who learns our Divine Cult's high-level Demonic Arts can succeed in projecting qi within a dozen years at the latest. Hahaha.
Even while explaining, the Heavenly Demon couldn’t resist showing off his pride in the Divine Cult and dissing the people from the Central Plains.
But Il-mok couldn’t argue with the facts.
Not a single graduate from the Hall of the Demonic Way failed to reach what was equivalent to the Peak Realm in Central Plains standards, and all the cultists from the main headquarters who worked in the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult's combat units or organizations were Peak Realm or higher.
But that wasn’t why he kept his mouth shut.
'With the price of dealing with mental illness and falling into Qi Deviation on a daily basis, that is.’
But he couldn't voice such thoughts for the Heavenly Demon would've chopped his head off if he did.
The Heavenly Demon's explanation continued.
—The Central Plains folks talk about a level called theSupreme Peak Realm after the Peak Realm, but the Supreme Peak Realm is like a mirage. It's just something they added because the gap between Peak Realm and the next realm, Realm of Truth, is too vast. Just like the false realm called the Upper First Rate Realm.
Once you reached the Peak Realm and could project your qi, the possibilities for growth were endless.
Taking the sword as an example, one could go beyond Sword Qi to form Sword Barriers or create Sword Threads. Instead of just coating your sword with energy, you could shoot your Sword Qi at enemies far away, or control the qi to move with either hard or soft principles.
After mastering all these different ways to use ki and having a ton of breakthroughs, the ultimate stage a swordsman in the Peak Realm could dream of reaching was when their Sword Qi formed into Sword Force.
Thus, the Central Plains people called warriors who could handle Force Qi masters of the Supreme Peak Realm.
—But to freely manipulate Force Qi, one must ultimately enter the Realm of Truth. The Force Qi created at the so-called Supreme Peak level is just a cheap imitation they’re barely managing to force out.
Having already reached an insane level of power himself, the Heavenly Demon obviously looked down on the whole Supreme Peak idea.
—Does that mean the criterion for entering the Realm of Truth is being able to freely manipulateForce Qi?"
—You've got the order backwards. It’s because you have entered the Realm of Truth that you can freely wield Force Qi.
—???
Seeing Il-mok's confused face, the Heavenly Demon added an explanation.
—The criterion for the Realm of Truth is none other than the Overhaul Body Transformation (환골탈태 (換骨奪胎)). Your body changes into the form most suitable for the martial arts and your meridians become connected directly to the world. As a result, you are able to commune with the world. Once that happens, wielding Force Qi freely comes as a matter of course.
He then added, looking extremely proud of himself.
—And this connects back to our Divine Cult. This is because we classify our ‘high-level Demonic Arts’ based on whether or not one can achieve the Overhaul Body Transformation and reach the Realm of Truth upon successfully achieving Transcendence.
—In that case, does that mean I will achieve the Overhaul Body Transformation the moment I achieve Transcendence with the Soul-Stealing Heartless Sword?
Oblivious of Il-mok’s newfound realization and despair of what a long and crazy path he had unwillingly just stepped on, the Heavenly Demon just kept on smiling proudly.
—That’s right. Hahaha. So, time to get back to training.
What loving words and terrible killing intent that was.
Cold sweat ran down Il-mok's back when he recalled how that conversation had ended.
Misunderstanding Il-mok's expression, the Gulang County Branch Leader cautiously spoke.
“It seems unlikely that the leader of the Heavenly Orchid Society has entered the Realm of Truth. The number of absolute masters in the Realm of Truth across the Central Plains could be counted on one hand. If he were that skilled, there'd be no reason for him to stay in this frontier."
"Then how many masters are there besides the leader?"
“Their second-in-command, a woman they call the Rakshasi of Gansu, is rumored to be at the absolute top of the Peak Realm. And there are about five or six other Peak Realm masters."
After hearing all the Branch Leader's reports, Il-mok looked over his companions and nodded.
Most of them were crazy, but their skills were reliable.
After getting their gear ready, Il-mok and his crew started moving toward Lanzhou.
Gulang County and Lanzhou were relatively close, but this was only close by the standards of the massive landmass called the Central Plains. ᴜᴘᴅᴀᴛᴇ ꜰʀᴏᴍ novèlfire.net
After running over three hundred miles without rest using lightness skills, they finally reached Lanzhou after the sun had completely set.
Given how fast they had traveled, they had earned themselves a head start of at least one day.
"Those guys who came to Gulang County are probably planning to stay the night and get treated by the Red Serpent Gang before going home. They won't notice anything wrong at the Heavenly Orchid Society until tomorrow at the very least. So we'll rest now and launch our surprise attack at the beginning of the Hour of Tiger (3-5 AM)."
After giving his orders, Il-mok washed off all the sweat from the long run and got about four hours of sleep.
He woke up near the end of the Hour of the Ox (1–3 AM), and the group ate some rice balls they’d gotten from the inn before heading out.
There was a huge estate located just a short distance from Lanzhou's red-light district.
A sign hanging out front read [Heavenly Orchid Society]. The place was so big it made the Red Serpent Gang’s headquarters look like a shack.
Perhaps due to its enormous size, the walls were much higher, and men stood guard with torches lit at regular intervals.
Yet, because they’ve been the undisputed ruler of Lanzhou for over ten years now, their guards are lax and complacent.
"Yaaaaawn."
‘No day off tomorrow… guess I’ll have to go see Aeng-ran tonight.’
The guard was getting lost in some dirty thoughts as he stared at the red-light district next door when his daydream suddenly came to a stop.
"!?"
He suddenly found himself unable to breathe and before he knew it, a thin black thread wrapped around his neck.
Slice.
Before the man could resist, his neck was severed in two by the razor-thin black thread.
Beside the man who'd instantly become a headless corpse, stood a woman who'd approached without anyone noticing hid in the shadows.
A woman in tight black night clothes with a wrathful deity mask covering her face.
Even with a torch right next to her, she remained undetected.
This was Dam Bin, the First Squad Leader of the Hidden Guard Pavilion.
Once she took care of the last target, she put out a torch as a signal.
With no one left alive to see it, a team of masked figures used the new patch of darkness to climb over the wall and into the Heavenly Orchid Society estate.
Once they were safely inside, they split up and spread out in all directions, either moving alone or in teams of three.
‘Easier than I thought.’
Il-mok split off from the others and moved to the center of the estate alone.
Befitting the grand size of the estate, the interior was also filled with numerous pavilions and inner courtyards.
Just as he was about to walk past one of the buildings, he suddenly stopped.
Two guards were posted together in the alley between two pavilions.
Il-mok used stealth techniques to creep up on them.
He stopped a good distance away and unleashed Soul-Cutting Flash with his finger. He'd improvised the Soul-Stealing Heartless Sword to create a finger projectile on the spot.
A blast of energy, infused with the essence of his fast-sword style, flew from Il-mok’s finger and hit the guards’ paralysis and mute points.
They went down without a sound. Il-mok walked up, finished them off with a quick swing of his blackened sword, and kept moving.
Right after he passed another building, a particularly splendid building appeared.
Four guard warriors stood around the building, each monitoring the surroundings.
'Jackpot.'
The whole mission had been thrown together at the last minute. While they could locate the estate since the Heavenly Orchid Society was famous enough, there hadn't been time to find out exactly where the leader slept.
That's why they'd spread out widely to search for the leader.
‘I can’t believe they put it right in the middle and basically hung up a giant sign saying ‘THE LEADER SLEEPS HERE’.’
Despite his exasperated feelings, Il-mok pondered as he looked at the leader's chamber.
He felt that secretly taking out the guards one by one would be a bad move.
'If that leader really is a Supreme Peak Realm expert, my stealth skills won’t be enough to fool his senses completely.’
The chances were high that if he jumped one of the guards, the leader would feel the disturbance in the energy flow and wake up.
‘Hit them hard and fast.’
With his mind made up, Il-mok took a deep breath and operated his dantian at full power.
BOOM!!
With a thunderous explosion, Il-mok had already reached right in front of the guard protecting the building's west side.
The guard's eyes widened at the unexpected attack.
He didn't even have time to open his mouth to sound the alarm or put up a guard when Il-mok’s sword cut his body in half.
Slash!
However, Il-mok’s objective had never been a mere guard in the first place.
The Sword Qi erupted from Il-mok's sword went beyond the guard's body and sliced through the building's wall.
CRASH!!
Amid the tremendous explosion and rising dust, Il-mok swung his sword again to push away the dust as he entered the hall.
'Damn hygiene obsession.'
After clearing the dust, the hall's interior came into Il-mok's view.
There is a massive bed inside.
Three women who'd barely covered their naked bodies with silk blankets looked at Il-mok with startled faces.
"You fucking bastard!!"
The man who'd been lying with those women roared and quickly threw himself toward the twin blades beside the bed.
The whole disastrous scene almost made Il-mok squeeze his eyes shut. The voices in his head started going nuts.
'My eyes are going to rot!!'
—Cut off that hideous thing right now!!
The Heavenly Orchid Society leader who'd woken up was completely naked.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 191: Heavenly Orchid Society (3)
The moment Il-mok’s eyes got contaminated by the sight, his alter-ego screamed at the top of his lungs.
—Cut off that hideous thing right now!!
“Motherfucker!”
He dived straight at the bastard using his lightness skill.
Swoooosh!
A strike that combined the essence of Soul-Cutting Flash and Soul-Guiding Sword techniques flew toward the Heavenly Orchid Society leader with devastating speed.
Thud!
Unfortunately, Il-mok's sword just bit into the floorboards.
As expected from a top figurehead of the Unorthodox Faction, the Society Leader had no qualm using the Lazy Donkey Roll to dodge the attack.
Moreover, even while rolling around like a pile of shit, the crafty bastard managed to grab his twin sabers.
But Il-mok wasn't fazed. After all, the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult didn't consider rolling around shameful either, and more importantly, the Soul-Stealing Heartless Sword wasn't designed for one-hit kills.
Il-mok relentlessly swung his sword at Society Leader Maeng Gwak who was desperately trying to get back on his feet.
Living up to its name, his Soul-Stealing sword art came in a dizzying, non-stop barrage.
What seemed like swift strikes would suddenly twist mid-path and utilize the principle of illusory sword art, and sometimes his sword would fly in a straight line while the Sword Qi curved bizarrely to target vital points.
Caught in that chaotic storm of steel, Maeng Gwak barely managed to block Il-mok's sword by alternating his twin sabers.
Clang! Clang!
And when things got dicey, he'd throw himself to the ground again, rolling around to barely avoid getting his vital spots slashed.
Having lost the initiative to the surprise attack and begun the battle off-balance from rolling on the floor, Maeng Gwak couldn't even think about counterattacking.
He was barely dodging fatal strikes, but in just a few seconds, countless cuts had already appeared all over his body.
But looking at it from another angle, this meant Il-mok had failed to kill the Heavenly Orchid Society Leader with his surprise attack.
“Guard the boss!”
"Kill him!"
The three remaining bodyguards that Il-mok had ignored rushed at him from the sides and behind.
"Tsk."
With a soft click of his tongue, Il-mok pulled his sword back from the leader and instantly bolted to the left.
"Haaah!"
As the bodyguard on the left thrust his spear with a battle cry, Il-mok thrust his sword out to greet it.
Clang!
The moment he heard the strange metallic sound, the spear-wielding guard’s face crumpled.
Clang!
In a bewildering turn of events, the deflected spear collided with the sword being swung by his comrade, creating another metallic clash.
After effortlessly shutting down the guard's attack, Il-mok was already in his face.
Shunk!
The same sword that had deflected the spear pierced straight through the bodyguard's heart.
The remaining two bodyguards also had their throats and hearts pierced by Il-mok's sword, each taken down in a single exchange.
“We’ve got intruders!”
"Everyone, get up!"
Suddenly, the air was filled with yells, screams, and the sound of ringing steel.
"I don't know where the hell you came from, you bastard, but today's gonna be your death day."
Most importantly, Maeng Gwak had also steadied his stance and regulated his breathing.
Looking at those murderous eyes and the Saber Qi continuously emanating from his twin sabers, Il-mok let out a sigh.
“You had plenty of time to kill while your lackeys were biting the dust. Motherfucker, can’t you at least put on some clothes?”
The Heavenly Orchid Society Leader was still completely naked.
"Is it because you're bald? Got no sense of shame."
When Il-mok frowned as if his eyes were rotting from the sight, Maeng Gwak's forehead twitched.
"That's rich coming from a coward who attacks in the middle of the night!"
With furious eyes, Maeng Gwak roared as the Saber Qi swirled around his twin sabers began to condense.
"Die!"
While members of the Heavenly Orchid Society who had noticed the attack began to emerge from all sides, a different scene unfolded here.
"Hehe. You’ve got guts, coming here.”
"Looks like you came here wanting to be embraced by this old man."
The ones approaching Hyeokryeon Seon-ah were spouting lewd remarks with gleaming eyes.
Like Il-mok and Dam Bin, Hyeokryeon Seon-ah also wore a mask, but her figure visible through the night clothes clearly showed she was a woman.
The problem was that the mask made it impossible to guess her age.
Not that it mattered. These guys were from the Unorthodox Faction that dealt in human trafficking. Even if they’d known she was only fifteen, it wouldn't have stopped them.
But despite their crude remarks, Hyeokryeon Seon-ah showed no signs of fear or shame.
Originally, Il-mok had planned to exclude Hyeokryeon Seon-ah from this operation.
It was a pest-control job, which meant killing was going to be part of the job.
Il-mok, with his 21st-century mindset, argued that this is too heavy a burden for a fifteen-year-old girl but sadly got his opinion shot down.
This was the medieval era, and their group was the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult, whose purpose was to punish evil through martial arts.
Dam Bin, Jin Hayeon, and the others couldn't relate to Il-mok's perspective, and most importantly, Hyeokryeon Seon-ah also stubbornly insisted on participating.
This was the child who had followed him around with innocent smiles since childhood.
Even though she had matured a bit, she was still just a kid trying to get a pat on the head from him.
That was Il-mok's image of Hyeokryeon Seon-ah, but the girl standing here wasn't so innocent.
Crack!
Before anyone could react, Hyeokryeon Seon-ah's red fingernails had pierced through the heart of the black-clothed man who'd been running his mouth.
Even as the violently beating heart spurted blood and her face was stained red with gore, Hyeokryeon Seon-ah looked at the remaining bastard with an indifferent expression.
“Anyone who gets in my big brother’s way dies.”
"What the hell—?"
He murmured with a dazed expression, but never got to finish.
Before he knew it, the girl's fingernails were embedded in his throat.
Jin Hayeon, who had been watching the blood-stained girl begin her massacre of the unorthodox faction members, soon turned her head away.
‘…To think my role is that of a babysitter.’
Unlike Dam Bin and Il-mok moved independently, she was in charge of supervising two people.
“Hahahaha! That’s it, keep coming! I’ll give you all a spectacular show of my skills as a send-off to the afterlife!"
Worse, one of them was a complete attention whore. The second their cover was blown, he started yelling his head off while chucking hidden weapons everywhere.
"Could you keep your mouth shut while fighting, Young Master Baek Cheon?"
True to her babysitting role, she nagged at Baek Cheon and let out a light sigh.
Still, she knew it couldn’t be helped. This was a surprise attack launched without knowing the exact location of the Heavenly Orchid Society Leader.
The personnel distribution was meant to prevent anyone from getting seriously injured or killed if they happened to run into the Society Leader while moving separately.
True to her White Hand Demonic Art, she quickly cleared her mind of distracting thoughts to press her palms together and draw up the cold energy stored in her dantian.
Because she looked so defenseless, the bunch who'd been intimidated by Baek Cheon and Hyeokryeon Seon-ah came rushing at her in a group.
The moment the black-clothed mob got within close range...
Jin Hayeon separated her pressed palms and spun in a circle like a dancer waving a fan.
The frost energy she had been compressing between her hands was finally set free, erupting outwards and following the path of her dance.
Crackle.
Every single one of those who had been approaching her froze solid where they stood, their eyes bulging wide from the intense pain they felt throughout their bodies.
Jin Hayeon looked at those who had frozen solid with severe frostbite all over their bodies with indifferent eyes, then swung her palms in succession.
Thud!
With every dull thud, another frozen body exploded into pieces.
It didn't even feel like people were exploding; it was more like something non-living shattering into bits, like hitting a frozen slab of beef with a mallet.
After wiping out a dozen thugs in the blink of an eye, she continued swinging her hands with cold energy swirling around them.
Those who got hit by her palms had their organs freeze and died on the spot.
As Jin Hayeon continued eliminating the scums who had been leading the human trafficking in Gansu Province alongside Hyeokryeon Seon-ah and Baek Cheon...
Clang!
For the first time, opponents who could actually block them appeared.
“Who the hell do you crazy bastards think you are, coming here?!”
"Hehe. The damage you've caused today will have to be repaid with your bodies."
Armed men with dangerous auras emanating from their weapons appeared.
As the Heavenly Orchid Society's scoundrels were running around the vast estate in panic from the sudden attack...
Slash!
"?!"
The pupils of a man following behind dilated at the bizarre sight of his comrade's body suddenly being cut down.
Thanks to the blood spurting from his comrade's body, the man belatedly realized why his colleague had died.
"Wire...?"
The moonlight, reflecting off the blood, revealed a black thread tied to the roof tiles of a pavilion.
But figuring out what killed his comrade wasn’t going to change his own destiny.
“You catch on faster than I’d expect from someone of your caliber.”
The moment a woman's sweet voice was heard, he felt a strange stinging sensation in his neck, like being bitten by an insect.
Lowering his gaze at the bizarre sensation, the man saw the black thread that had pierced through his neck.
After that, she hunted down the Unorthodox scums with wires like a spider hunting with its web.
Whenever the woman stepped, the scums limbs and necks were chopped by the spider web that Dam Bin had laid out.
Slash!
"Gasp!"
But then. Dıscover more novels at n0velfire.net
Clang!
The only woman among the scums managed to successfully block Dam Bin's wire with her sword.
Not only that, she followed the thread back to its source, pinpointed Dam Bin's hiding spot, and immediately launched an attack.
Swoooosh!
Dam Bin dodged the Sword Qi flying toward her with light footwork and spoke with an enigmatic smile.
"Judging by your skill, you must be the Vice Leader."
"And who the hell are you?"
Dam Bin answered leisurely.
"Just a servant who serves a great person."
“A common whore has no business being here.”
But Dam-bin just took the insult in stride. Her faint smile never wavered, showing her age and experience.
"Then may I ask why you, Vice Leader, are in the business of selling fellow women as prostitutes?"
“That’s hilarious. You really don’t get it, do you? This is a dog-eat-dog world. The strong take what they want from the weak. Gender has nothing to do with it."
When she heard the Vice Leader's confident answer, Dam Bin's smile deepened.
"I see. I guess you’ll have no complaints.”
"Complaints?"
The moment the Vice Leader asked...
“When I take your life from you.”
Countless black threads exploded into the air around them.
The entire time they were talking, Dam Bin had been secretly spreading her black threads all over the place.
"Coward!"
The shocked Vice Leader quickly raised her sword to gather her Sword Qi.
Judging by how easy she handles the Sword Qi, it’s obvious that she has reached the end of the Peak Realm.
The black wires that touched the Vice Leader's Sword Qi were cut as easily as straw.
But for every thread she sliced through, ten more seemed to take its place.
Slash!
Slash!
The Vice Leader repeatedly cut down or blocked those wires with her Sword QI, swinging her blade covered in sword silk non-stop like she was clearing away actual spider webs.
And yet, for some reason…
Even though she easily cut down the wire, the Vice Leader felt increasingly like a butterfly trapped in a spider web. Struggling desperately, only to end up tangling itself deeper.
And the moment the Vice Leader swung her sword again to cut through a bundle of wire...
Shunk.
A single, fine black thread shot out from Dam Bin’s extended right hand and went straight through the Vice Leader’s heart.
The pain hit her a second later. She looked down and saw a wire penetrating her heart.
"Cough..."
She choked up a mouthful of blood and spoke with a desperate voice.
"P-please spare me..."
However, what came back to her was a cold sneer.
Heh.
It was the very same sneer she used to give the women she sold.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 192: Heavenly Orchid Society (4)
Thud.
Dam Bin glanced down for a second at the Vice Leader’s body, which had crumpled to the floor after a pathetic final plea.
Then she quickly turned away with a look of complete disinterest.
'Hayeon's group should be doing fine with that kid leading them.'
She turned her gaze away from the direction Jin Hayeon, Hyeokryeon Seon-ah, and Baek Cheon had headed, and looked toward where Il-mok had gone.
"Looks like the Eighth Disciple has run into the Society Leader."
She could feel it from that surge of energy from earlier.
Even though there was quite a distance between them, the energy wave had been so intense that it reached all the way to her.
'So the rumors were true. Their Society Leader is a bona fide Supreme Peak Realm master.’
She made up her mind in an instant and started heading in Il-mok's direction.
'Even though the Eighth Young Master is starting to get past the Extremity, a master of that caliber might be too much for him to take on alone.'
It is said that achieving Transcendence with high-level Demonic Art enables the practitioner to undergo an Overhaul Body Transformation and step into the Realm of Truth. But for a practitioner of high-level Demonic Art that only mastered the art to Extremity, they are no different from what the people of the Central Plain called Peak Realm masters. This update ıs available on novel-fire.ɴet
Moreover, most of the cultists struggled with this Extremity stage, with many going mad in the end.
It had nothing to do with talent. You needed an iron will to power through the horrific side effects at that level, and most people just couldn't bear the madness.
A prime example was the Third Young Master, Seo Wan-pyeong. He had reached the Extremity stage in his early twenties thanks to his exceptional talent, but remained stuck there for nearly a decade.
The biggest reason the Third Young Master had been able to break through was thanks to Il-mok's existence.
And Il-mok, the very person who had guided Seo Wan-pyeong’s development, had also begun to move past Extremity at the tender age of eighteen after grasping the basic principle of Force Qi.
But if you look at another angle, the Heavenly Orchid Society Leader was a fully matured warrior who had grasped Force Qi way longer than Il-mok and an opponent difficult for him to handle.
She started heading over to back Il-mok up, just in case.
'...Those kids are a bit scatterbrained, but they shouldn't run into the Society Leader or another Vice Leader, so they should be safe.'
Dam Bin looked somewhere in the distance with a slightly worried expression.
At one corner of the Heavenly Orchid Society's massive estate.
"Get out of the way!"
"Haaah!"
"......"
A team of three—a saber guy, a spear girl, and an archer—was making a whole lot of noise as they tore through a mob of thugs.
Or rather, two boisterous individuals and one quiet archer were wiping them out.
All sorts of Qis and arrows flew everywhere, slaughtering about twenty thugs in an instant.
“So where to now, Senior Ouyang?”
The spear wielder asked the saber guy in a cold tone dripping with hostility.
This was a far cry from the usual Ju Seo-yeon, the girl who was normally all bright eyes and "Jin Hayeon this, Jin Hayeon that!"
You'd think they'd have a bond, since they both worship the ground Jin Hayeon walks on, but nope. Ju Seo-yeon absolutely loathed Ouyang Mun.
And, as Jin Hayeon’s number one fan, she’d seen right through him from the start.
Ouyang Mun might look similar to her on the surface, but they weren't the same kind of person.
'That disgusting bastard, how dare he!'
Unlike her own pure admiration for Jin Hayeon, Ouyang Mun harbored filthy lustful desires.
Of course, calling it disgusting or lustful was purely from Ju Seo-yeon's perspective.
Even though Ju Seo-yeon was shooting daggers at him with her eyes, Ouyang Mun was so lost in his own little world that he just answered her cheerfully.
"Obviously we should head toward where Hayeon went."
“I don’t trust your reasons, but I'll accept your suggestion."
Since she was just as desperate to see Jin Hayeon again, Ju Seo-yeon had no problem agreeing with the creep.
Just as the two were about to take off...
"I-I think we should go help the Y-Young Master instead..."
The archer, who hadn't spoken a single word until now, stammered out.
"Miss Jeong, what are you talking about?"
Ouyang Mun and Ju Seo-yeon both stopped in their tracks and stared at Jeong Hyeon in complete confusion.
But Jeong Hyeon had used up her entire day's supply of courage on that one sentence and couldn't say another word.
Ouyang Mun stared at the trembling girl for a second, and then it was like a lightbulb went off over his head.
"Ah! Now I get it! Hayeon will obviously move to help the Young Master. In that case, it'd be much better if we help the Young Master directly!"
Through the energy wave he had felt from the estate’s central area, Ouyang Mun had also discerned that Il-mok had clashed with the Society Leader.
And if he had noticed, then Jin Hayeon surely had as well.
Which meant…
'This is my chance! I'll dive in and get hurt saving the Young Master! Then Hayeon will hold me in her arms!!'
As expected, Ouyang Mun’s head was filled with nothing but thoughts of Jin Hayeon.
'I have to be first! There's no way I'm letting that creep get a hug from Senior Hayeon!'
Unfortunately, there happened to be another crazy person here with the exact same mindset.
"Let's hurry!"
"We absolutely must save the Young Master!"
Jeong Hyeon watched the two of them suddenly get all excited and take off running and finally managed to let out the breath she'd been holding.
"Haah."
She had a thought.
‘N-Next time… I have to a-ask… ask the Young Master to place me in a d-different people.’
Of course, whether she'd ever work up the nerve to actually say that to Il-mok was a whole other story.
Meanwhile, the woman that Ouyang Mun and Ju Seo-yeon were desperately searching for was in the middle of fierce combat with her companions.
The scoundrels blocking their path were all executives of the Heavenly Orchid Society who had reached the Peak Realm.
Among them, Hyeokryeon Seon-ah was facing off against a spear wielder.
Clang!
She swung her crimson energy-wreathed right hand, barely managing to deflect the spear crackling with Spear Qi, then launched herself forward.
She was trying to get inside the spear wielder's range.
But despite Hyeokryeon Seon-ah's nimble movements, she couldn't quite manage to break through into the spear wielder's inner range.
Being able to use Fist Qi at her age was a talent worthy of being called a genius, but she was only fifteen years old.
Facing a middle-aged master who had experienced countless real battles as a member of the Unorthodox Faction wasn't easy.
Il-mok's starting to overcome the Extremity stage at eighteen was the only abnormality here. He was just a freak of nature in the context of martial arts.
In fact, the middle-aged spear wielder couldn't even imagine that his opponent was only fifteen.
This wasn’t just because Hyeokryeon Seon-ah was wearing a mask; she had also reached a level that should have been impossible at fifteen.
Clang!
He once again shoved her back right as she tried to dart in and take advantage of an opening.
The middle-aged spear wielder, Jang Sul, silently sighed inside.
It wasn't because of the creepy red lady trying her best to kill him.
'Shit. Where the hell did these experts pop out from?'
And the crazy part was—and he couldn't decide if this was good luck or bad—the red-clad woman he was fighting was the weakest of the three.
“Hahahaha! You really think you can catch me with footwork like that?”
The maniac who'd been chattering nonstop was throwing hidden weapons while darting around just as fast as he talked.
And the saber wielder facing that maniac was already covered in wounds.
He was a tough old bastard from the underworld, so nothing fatal had landed yet, but…
"You bastard!!"
His eyes had already rolled back from his opponent's insults and dirty tactics.
But the guy getting harassed by hidden weapons was actually the lucky one.
"Huff... huff..."
The swordsman facing the ice lady was breathing out little white clouds with every gasp.
This meant the ice technique's cold energy had already penetrated his body.
The swordsman's movements had also become sluggish.
Jang Sul knew from experience that the swordsman would lose his life soon.
'Shit.'
Jang Sul's face contorted.
He was only able to see how bad things were because he was fighting the weakest of the bunch.
At this rate, they were all going to die.
Sensing mortal danger, Jang Sul's mind began digging through past memories to survive and soon a particular memory surfaced.
Ice-wielding woman.
Red-haired lady wielding blood-colored Fist Qi...
"You're Demonic Cult bastards!"
He suddenly remembered some stories he’d heard about the Demonic Cult’s signature Demonic Ars.
The White Hand Demonic Art was a famous Demonic Art, and the Blood Fox Crimson Claw Art was also well-known as a martial art of the Hyeokryeon Family.
And this was Gansu Province, practically a neighbour to Xinjiang where the Demonic Cult was based. Of course, you'd hear stories about them around here.
Hearing Jang Sul’s words, the saber wielder also came to a rough understanding of the martial art used by the lunatic who had been chattering loudly while throwing hidden weapons here and there.
"So a direct descendant of the Five Great Demonic Houses fights this dirty!"
The most famous hidden weapon family in the Demonic Cult was the Baek Family.
But knowing their identities didn't change much.
Actually, Jang Sul had made a huge mistake.
Had he kept the realization of their identities to himself, things might have been different, but he had to go and shout it for the world to hear.
"Uhahaha! What are you talking about! We are Incarnations of Maitreya!"
While Baek Cheon spouted ridiculous excuses and put on an exaggerated act...
"Haah."
Jin Hayeon let out a light sigh and thrust both hands forward, unleashing a massive wave of pure frost from her hands.
"Kraaaah!"
The swordsman, already on his last legs, let out a final scream and swung his sword.
Crack!!
But his sword, which had already taken a beating from her Demonic Art, couldn't handle the chill any longer and just exploded into bits.
After Jin Hayeon's hands broke through the swordsman's sword and touched his chest.
Thud.
With a sickening wet crunch of shattering bone, the swordsman coughed up a lungful of blood and fell.
Witnessing his comrade's fall, Jang Sul gritted his teeth.
'I'll die too at this rate.'
Desperate, Jang Sul gripped his spear tightly and unleashed the life-saving ultimate technique he'd been hiding, trying to push back the crimson woman who kept buzzing around him like a mosquito.
Jang Sul planned to push back that damn bitch and then run. An unorthodox warrior had no obligation to risk his life for his comrades.
But why was it...
Despite the fierce energy erupting from Jang Sul's spear, the crimson woman didn't retreat.
No, she actually threw herself toward the massive Spear Qi Jang Sul had created.
Even facing the sharp, deadly spear energy that could pierce flesh and cut through bone and muscle with just a graze, her eyes held no fear whatsoever.
The only emotion in those eyes was simple.
'My big brother's enemies are my enemies.'
It was nothing less than a blind, fanatical faith.
With movements so bold they seemed to disregard her life, Hyeokryeon Seon-ah finally broke into Jang Sul's inner range.
‘Exterminate.'
In a flash, her red nails plunged into his chest and found his heart.
Crunch.
Even as the sickening sound of a bursting heart filled the air, even after she’d just taken down a master who was way stronger than her, Hyeokryeon Seon-ah turned her head with a completely emotionless expression, already looking for her next target.
"Tsk."
Then a disappointed clicking sound came from her mouth.
The remaining saber wielder was already freezing to death from Jin Hayeon's ice techniques.
"Young Master Baek, clean up those guys trying to escape."
Having already handled the saber wielder herself, she put Baek Cheon on clean-up duty, and he started chucking a storm of hidden weapons.
They couldn't leave anyone alive who knew who they were.
Just as she was getting bummed out that there were no more bugs left to squash for her brother...
BOOM!!
A thunderous crash echoed from the center of the Heavenly Orchid Society's estate.
Right from where Il-mok had gone.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 193: Heavenly Orchid Society (5)
A short while before.
"No, you don’t?!"
Seeing Maeng Gwak trying to form his Force Qi, Il-mok wasted no time and lashed out with his sword.
Whoooosh!
Il-mok's Sword Qi sliced through space, flying toward Maeng Gwak. But the Heavenly Orchid Society Leader simply held his twin sabers and effortlessly neutralized the attack.
The energy gathering around his blades had already surpassed the level of Saber Silks and was approaching true Saber Force.
But Il-mok knew that already.
Swish!
The moment he released his Sword Qi, Il-mok used his movement technique to close in on Maeng Gwak, swinging his sword in an incredibly intricate pattern that somehow avoided the extended reaches entirely.
But Maeng Gwak was the boss of a shady faction for a reason; he'd been in too many fights to get rattled.
"Hmph."
With a snort, Maeng Gwak swung the saber in his right hand to meet Il-mok's sword.
Clang clang clang!
Meanwhile, a series of metallic ringing sounds echoed from the left saber as he swung it at another angle. This was the result of him blocking the sneaky Sword Qi that Il-mok had dispatched using the sublime principles of the Traceless Soul-Slicing Sword.
Il-mok had mixed in the principles of the Sixth Secret Technique, the Northern Wind Soul-Severing Strike, with his Traceless Soul-Cutting Sword by spinning the Sword Qi to increase its cutting power. But Maeng Gwak saw through his strike and blocked it easily.
When Maeng Gwak's right saber clashed with Il-mok's sword, a thunderous boom echoed through the air.
BOOM!
Il-mok's sword now had Sword Silks coiled around it, and those threads carried a strange repelling force.
He'd used the Second Secret Technique - the Soul-Rebounding Sword to the Sword Silks like a repelling barrier.
It was an absurd display of skill, but it ultimately failed.
"That's enough of your little tricks!"
Maeng Gwak roared and swung his left saber, the one that had blocked the Traceless Soul-Cutting assault.
As Maeng Gwak's saber came flying with enough force to cut him in half, Il-mok calmly circulated his internal energy.
The Sword Silks that had been forming the repelling force now clung to Maeng Gwak's right saber as if they were one body and Il-mok spun with his sword like he was dancing.
Clang!
Using the principle of Floral Substitution, Il-mok made Maeng Gwak's twin sabers crash into each other. Then he immediately withdrew his sword and launched a series of thrusts.
His thrusts focused on speed, one after another.
While Il-mok's sword movements were simple and fast, the Sword Qi flowing from his blade was flexible. Some of it would curve in mid-air, while other hides behind other Sword Qi like a hidden weapon.
It was a bizarre and unpredictable display of sword mastery, controlling both sword and Qi with complete freedom.
Clang!
Clang clang!
But Maeng Gwak managed to block the chain of attacks by using minimal movements.
And when that overlapping Saber Qi reached its peak—
"This is the end!"
With a roar, Maeng Gwak's twin sabers cut through Il-mok's Sword Qi and flew toward him.
Tch.
Il-mok realized that the Heavenly Orchid Society Leader had finally managed to form a true Saber Force on his twin weapons. He barely managed to pull back and narrowly dodged the strike.
But with his rhythm broken, now it was Maeng Gwak's turn to go on the offensive.
"Hahaha! Let's see you dodge this too!"
Meng Guo wasn't just carrying two sabers to look cool; his martial arts were just as bizarre and unpredictable as Il-mok's.
His left and right blades carved different paths through the air, attacking relentlessly without pause.
What made it especially troublesome was that his twin blades were now wrapped in true Force Qi. If Il-mok tried to clash directly, both his sword and his body risked being cut clean in half.
—What are you waiting for!
—Use the move from that day and chop that disgusting body to bits!!
That useless bastard also started nagging in his mind.
Maeng Gwak's right blade came flying toward Il-mok, who had just dodged the left blade.
Realizing that dodging was not a viable option, Il-mok gritted his teeth.
‘Shut the fuck up, you useless yapping motherfucker!’
Using his anger toward his alter ego as fuel, Il-mok drew massive amounts of internal energy from his dantian and mixed all the principles of his techniques together into one strike.
Il-mok's sword clashed with Maeng Gwak's right saber, creating a thunderous sound.
BOOM!
Il-mok's sword now had its own constellation of overlapping Sword Qi.
"So you really have reached the Supreme Peak Realm."
He was acting like he’d already figured it out from all of Il-mok’s fancy moves. Maeng Gwak sneered even as sweat poured down his face.
"Tch."
Il-mok got pushed back by the pure power of the impact and clicked his tongue in annoyance.
'Should've spent more time training back at the Hall of the Demonic Way.’
It wasn't his sword skills he regretted slacking on. When it came to pure technique, he felt like he was holding his own.
The problem was internal energy.
He’d only gotten away without a serious injury because he’d used a fancy trick to redirect most of the force. If he’d taken that hit straight on, he’d be spitting up blood right now.
"Huu. Die!"
Taking a deep breath, Maeng Gwak swung his twin sabers at Il-mok again in rapid succession.
Il-mok used his footwork and lightness skills to dodge the attacks, occasionally interrupting the man's rhythm with precise thrusts.
And when he absolutely couldn't avoid an attack—
BOOM!
He’d have to grit his teeth and form Sword Force again to block, then use the rebound to pull back.
It was his only choice.
Although he had grasped the basic principle of Force in the process of fighting the leader of the fanatic force, handling true Force Qi was still beyond Il-mok's current abilities.
Not only did forming the Force Qi take time, but most importantly, he lacked internal energy.
If he used it too many times, his dantian would be completely drained in an instant.
But even as he kept getting pushed back, Il-mok's eyes remained calm.
‘Apart from lacking internal energy, this fight is totally winnable.’
His opponent's level was similar to that fanatic leader he'd fought before.
"Huff, huff."
And for a supposed master with all that power and experience, the man was as slow as a brick.
Whoosh.
Il-mok stepped back lightly and smirked.
“Seriously, how lazy do you have to be for your body to end up like that?"
The guy called himself a martial artist, but he had a potbelly you could rest a drink on.
This was a real problem for Il-mok. He found ripped, muscle-bound dudes gross when they were half-naked, so the sight of a flabby guy fighting naked was enough to make his inner germaphobe start screaming.
‘They said no one's seen him fight since he took over the city.'
He'd probably gotten soft after becoming the big boss of Lanzhou.
“Hahhh. Shut your mouth!”
Maybe it was because of the potbelly comment, but a vein started throbbing on Maeng Gwak’s forehead as he charged in again.
“Easy there, you’ll die of high blood pressure at this rate.”
Being overweight means you gotta watch out for high blood pressure anyway.
Il-mok clicked his tongue and used his lightness skill to dodge the heavy man's twin sabers.
"I'll help you lose that belly fat. Hahaha."
With his ragebaiting success, Il-mok calmly waited for his chance.
"Grrr! You damn pest!"
The second the furious Maeng Gwak swung his sabers again—
Now!
Il-mok, who'd been studying Maeng Gwak's techniques, moved boldly.
Swish.
Il-mok's sword, now wrapped in Force Qi, shot toward Maeng Gwak's right saber.
Thud.
But somehow, when Il-mok's sword met Maeng Gwak's right saber, it didn't produce the same explosive sound as before.
That was because Il-mok had read his opponent's technique and struck it with a deflecting blow rather than clashing directly.
Thanks to this, Maeng Gwak's right saber was knocked off course and flew toward his own left blade.
BOOM!
As the Force Qi from both sabers crashed into each other—
Slice.
A sharp cutting sound rang out as Il-mok’s sword slashed open the man’s lower abdomen.
"Kuk..."
Maeng Gwak let out a choked groan, quickly hunching over and pressing both hands to his torn belly as blood and organs tried to spill out.
Il-mok looked down at the pathetic sight.
"Congratulations. You managed to lose some weight right before dying."
Just as Il-mok swung his sword toward the collapsed Heavenly Orchid Society Leader's neck—
Slice!
Sharp cutting sounds echoed around Il-mok.
But Il-mok wasn't surprised. He'd already sensed what was happening around him.
“My thanks, First Squad Leader Dam Bin."
He looked past a pile of thugs whose arms and legs had just been lopped off by black threads as Dam Bin stepped out of the darkness.
"I only did what needed to be done, Young Master. But that was truly magnificent swordsmanship."
She'd arrived near the end of Il-mok and the Society Leader's battle, but instead of rashly joining the fight, she decided to observe.
Though it looked like Il-mok was being pushed back, his eyes remained remarkably calm.
‘The Eighth Young Master might gain some enlightenment from this battle.’
Since the Demonic Cult revered martial prowess, they believed there was nothing more valuable than a real do-or-die battle between masters.
That was not to say she had been idle. She'd been preparing for contingencies. That's how she was able to instantly slaughter the thugs who tried to ambush Il-mok right after the battle.
"At this rate, achieving Transcendence before thirty isn't impossible."
Hearing her praise, Il-mok clicked his tongue with a disappointed expression.
"I wish that were true."
Unfortunately, Il-mok hadn't gained any special insights from this battle despite his opponent being quite strong.
Shaking off his disappointment, Il-mok looked up and surveyed his surroundings. Specifically, the carnage that Dam Bin's black threads had created. Follow current ɴᴏᴠᴇʟs on NoveI★Fire.net
"If you don't mind, can I ask you something?"
"Please ask freely."
"Which Demonic Art are you cultivating, and what's the side effect?"
Not only did he find the thread-wielding art fascinating, but he was also struck by an ominous premonition that a master of her caliber would surely have a side effect that was just as formidable.
"My Demonic Art is called the Dark Spider Blood Thread Art, and the side effect is similar to that of the White Hand Demonic Art."
"Dark Spider’s crimson thread. That is a name truly befitting a Demonic Art.”
“You’re too kind, Young Master.”
He'd meant it was creepy, but Dam Bin took it as a compliment.
"Hmm. Weird that you have the same side effect as Miss Jin. You two give off a totally different aura, so I never would’ve guessed.”
When he said that, Dam Bin smiled.
And it was a weird smile.
Sure, she smiled sometimes back when she was in her servant uniform, but those were always calm, gentle smiles.
This one in her black night clothes had an inexplicably bewitching quality.
Il-mok wondered if it was because of her outfit, but then—
"It's similar to the side effects when a man cultivates it, not when a woman does."
Her words hit him, and a memory from long ago came flooding back.
'The side effect for guys... Don't tell me it's THAT ONE!?'
Looking at her unusually seductive and predatory gaze, Il-mok gulped.
‘Oh shit.’
A few days earlier.
Deep within the Murim Alliance headquarters located near Dongting Lake, an important meeting was taking place.
It was a conference to determine a response to the Demonic Cult, which had been showing strange movements for the past three years or so.
Except… pretty much everyone at the meeting looked like they were about to lose their minds.
"Ha! Not only was he freely wielding Sword Qi at sixteen, but at seventeen he mastered sorcery and saved a village suffering from drought, and two months later he was using true Force Qi? Do you really think this makes any sense?"
The reason was Il-mok.
More specifically, it was the news that all the weird stuff the Demonic Cult had been up to was because of their youngest Young Master.
When the Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord received this news, he ordered an additional investigation into the Eighth Young Master. The results were now being presented at this meeting.
“I know Demonic Arts are fast, but this is just ridiculous.”
“Not even the current Heavenly Demon, Hyeokryeon Il-hwi, was ever this good and this fast. And that guy’s a monster within their cult’s history. ”
"Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord, how exactly are you handling this?"
The problem was that most of the information in the report was completely unbelievable.
‘Fuck that Eighth Young Master.’
He was getting chewed out just for reporting the crazy rumors he'd gathered, and he had to fight down the urge to go and personally murder the kid.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 194: Heavenly Orchid Society (6)
While arrows of criticism were flying toward the Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord, an elder from the Namgung Family spoke up.
"Now, now. There's no need to blame the Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord. He's just compiling information that has been circulating in Xinjiang. The way I see it, this is probably just another case of those fanatics idolizing their cult."
A few of those attending the meeting nodded as if they found this reasonable.
"Or maybe the rumors have just gotten blown way out of proportion. You know what they say, a rumor without legs can travel a thousand li, and it gets bigger with every person who passes it along."
This time, an elder from the Wudang Sect offered another opinion.
Either way, both opinions amounted to not believing the rumors.
"Tch. Those Demonic Cult bastards are idiots as usual."
The elder from Mount Hua Sect seemed to agree with both views, clicking his tongue dismissively as he disparaged the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult.
True to as an elder from Mount Hua—the sect that had been devastated and rebuilt after the Kongtong Sect annihilation—he showed absolute hostility toward the Demonic Cult.
But strangely enough, that malice was closer to 'contempt' or 'disdain.'
This was evident in that he was not insisting they should immediately hunt down those bastards and wipe them out.
Which made a certain kind of sense. It had been over six hundred years since the Kongtong Sect was annihilated by the Heavenly Demon of that era.
On top of that, it had been over two hundred years since the Demonic Cult was driven to Xinjiang, so revenge was pretty much already achieved.
Mount Hua's last direct clash with the Demonic Cult was during the previous Heavenly Demon’s reign about ninety years ago, so any desire for revenge naturally faded over time.
It was so long ago that hardly anyone who participated in those battles was still alive.
Of course, their ideological indoctrination continued even now.
If you asked any Mount Hua disciple, "Who is our main enemy?" they'd answer, "The Demonic Cult!" without hesitation.
But honestly, Mount Hua disciples had other people they really wanted to tear apart.
Namely, their competitors who fought them almost daily for dominance in Shaanxi Province, the Zhongnan Sect.
This was also true for the Qingcheng and Diancang Sects in similar situations.
Qingcheng was too busy dealing with their rivals in Sichuan, and Diancang was stuck between a rock and a hard place with the Sichuan powers above them and the Hainan Sect to the east.
“Tsk. We wasted all this time and effort worrying about the Demonic Cult’s garbage.”
Since the rumors about the Eighth Young Master of the Demonic Cult were so absurd, the meeting attendees eventually lost interest in the topic.
Instead, they started bringing up topics related to their own sects' interests one by one.
The meaningless meeting dragged on for quite a while.
Right after the colossal waste of time finally ended, the Chief Strategist Gongsun Hyeon called the Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord aside.
"You've had a hard time."
At Gongsun Hyeon's praise, the Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord suppressed his resentment and replied.
"I only did what needed to be done, Chief Strategist.”
The reason he had revealed the rumors about Il-mok exactly as they were in the meeting today was because of the Chief Strategist’s directive.
Thanks to those orders, the Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord had endured insulting remarks from various elders, but he didn't question the Chief Strategist about it or ask why it had to be done.
The Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord believed that when a superior gives an order, a subordinate should carry it out without question.
Of course, this also meant he expected his subordinates to act the same way when he gave them orders.
But Chief Strategist Gongsun Hyeon was a bit different.
"Aren't you curious why I specifically told you to relay such absurd rumors as they were?"
He believed that people needed to understand the purpose of their work to follow through properly.
Of course, he was only speaking up because he had accurately grasped the Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord's personality.
"I simply do my best to carry out whatever the Chief Strategist orders."
Gongsun Hyeon smiled faintly at the perfectly straight answer from his perfectly loyal man.
"I did it on purpose. I wanted the Nine Sects and One Gang, and the Seven Great Families to keep looking down on those cultists."
"!?"
Even the loyal Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord couldn't hide his expression at such a reason.
"Won’t that be dangerous?"
"It will be dangerous. But don't men have to take risks to achieve their goals?"
After uttering these cryptic words, the Chief Strategist’s expression had already turned grave.
"Think about how the martial world operates these days. The Murim Alliance's name is famous, but it holds no meaning. Am I wrong to say that everything is actually decided by the old fogeys from the Nine Sects and One Gang and the Seven Great Families?"
"..."
“What do you think? Are those people really righteous? Are they just?”
"..."
At Gongsun Hyeon's pointed questions, the Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord couldn't give any answer.
Sure, there were a few good apples in the barrel. A few sects and a few people who genuinely tried to be heroes and do the right thing.
But looking at the whole picture, they were just a small minority.
"Am I wrong to say that they just strut around trampling and making a mockery of martial world justice, simply because they happened to join good sects when they were young or were born into prestigious families?"
"..."
Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord remembered what had happened earlier.
Despite reaching the position of Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord of the Murim Alliance and wielding power that ranked in the top five within the alliance, he had to endure criticism from elders—not even sect leaders—of the Nine Sects and One Gang and Seven Great Families during today's meeting.
And the same was true for Gongsun Hyeon.
The only reason a man like him, a nobody from a minor sect, had managed to climb so high was because all the big powers were too busy fighting each other to let any one of their own take the top spot.
Despite holding the title of Chief Strategist, his power was only half of what it should be.
In reality, the Zhuge Family ran around acting like they were the real brains of the Alliance.
In reality, the Zhuge Family ran around acting like they were the real brains of the Alliance.
Gongsun Hyeon knew exactly how frustrated the Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord felt because he felt the exact same way. And that’s why he willingly revealed his inner thoughts to him.
But then again, Gongson Hyeon was smart enough to become the Chief Strategist without having a powerful family to back him up.
He also knew how foolish it was to 'trust' someone.
He simply knew how to make others move according to his will.
"Shall we cast out those hypocrites and properly establish justice in the martial world under the banner of the Murim Alliance?"
Just like now, wrapping the Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord's resentment in the name of justice to draw him in.
"So you're planning to let those Demonic Cult bastards invade the Central Plains? By making the Nine Sects and One Gang and Seven Great Families drop their guard?"
“Exactly. Think about it. Why was the Murim Alliance even created in the first place? To fight the Demonic Cult. When you’re facing a big enough threat that everyone has to team up to survive, power naturally flows to the top. Right to us, the Murim Alliance.”
He had already hatched the plan by making all those elders in the meeting drop their guard. But he was a sharp man, and he knew a plan this big would take a lot of effort and manpower to pull off.
“Which is why I have a secret mission for you. I want you to take your most trusted guys—the ones who know how to keep their mouths shut—and find out everything you can about the Eighth Young Master.”
"The Eighth Young Master?"
Why him? Why the kid from the crazy stories?
Gongsun Hyeon smiled coldly.
"They say there's no smoke without fire. The rumors themselves might be exaggerated, but there must be a reason for them to have spread. Above all, if he is a disciple cherished by that fearsome Heavenly Demon, there must be a reason, right?"
What Gongsun Hyeon wanted was simply to use the Demonic Cult's invasion as an opportunity to overturn the Central Plains' power structure.
He had absolutely no intention of handing the Central Plains over to the Demonic Cult.
“As you command! I’ll find out everything about the Eighth Young Master, right down to how many hairs are on his head!”
Moved by Gongsun Hyeon's words, the Flying Dragon Pavilion Lord saluted with his eyes blazing with newfound purpose. Check latest chapters at novel·fiɾe·net
Back in the present. The battlefield was dead silent, probably because everyone who wasn't on their side was dead.
GULP.
The sound of Il-mok swallowing after hearing about Dam Bin's side effects echoed unusually loud.
Looking somewhat tense, Il-mok asked, “So, uh, that side effect… you doing okay with it?”
Dam Bin still wore her bewitching smile as she answered:
"Since I've transcended the Extremity stage, it's been bearable enough for several years now."
"I, I see."
Right after Il-mok answered with a somewhat awkward voice, an uncomfortable silence hung between the two for just a moment.
"Big brother!"
Hyeokryeon Seon-ah's voice shattered that silence.
Moving swiftly toward Il-mok, she looked up at him with watery eyes. "Are you alright, big brother?"
Thanks to Seon-ah's appearance, Il-mok escaped the awkward atmosphere and answered with a worried expression.
"I'm fine. But what about you, Seon-ah? How did you end up covered in blood like this?"
He was pointing at the splatters all over her face and clothes.
"Thanks to big brother's concern, I'm perfectly safe!"
Seon-ah said this with a face that seemed to beg for praise.
Il-mok reached out to stroke Hyeokryeon Seon-ah's red hair, then hesitated.
—Are your eyes just for decoration?! There's blood all over her!
His hygiene obsession was too strong to touch someone covered in blood, even if that person was his adorable younger sister.
When Il-mok's approaching hand stopped, Hyeokryeon Seon-ah looked at his hand with the most regretful expression in the world.
If those who had died with their hearts and throats pierced by her fingernails had seen that expression, they would have died all over again from shock.
Finally giving up on patting Seol-ah's head, Il-mok said awkwardly, "You worked hard. Miss Jin and Young Master Baek worked hard too."
It turned out Seol-ah had just sprinted ahead of her team. Jin Hayeon and Baek Cheon had now caught up and entered the leader's chamber.
"I'm fine. You've also worked hard, Young Master, " Jin Hayeon replied dispassionately.
“Hahaha! That was nothing! A walk in the park, Eighth Young Master!" Followed the boisterous Baekcheon.
"Young Master!"
“No way!”
Ju Seo-yeon and Ouyang Mun looked at Il-mok with faces as if the sky were falling.
And in a way, it had. The fight was already over, so their genius plan to get hurt saving Il-mok so Jin Hayeon would have to cradle them in her loving arms was officially up in smoke.
‘Damnit. If only it hadn’t been for those men at the last moment!’
'If I'd known, I would've just taken a sword to the gut to end it faster!'
Both of them were thinking the exact same thing.
On their way to the Society Leader's chamber, the remaining two Peak Realm masters of the Heavenly Orchid Society had blocked their path.
But with Jeong Hyeon playing sniper support, there was no way two Peak masters could stop them. So they’d killed them and rushed over, but it was too late.
While the two weirdos were moping, Il-mok turned to the girl trying to make herself invisible in the corner.
"Miss Jeong also worked hard."
"I, I just did wh-what I had to do."
Il-mok had no intention of telling Ouyang Mun and Ju Seo-yeon that they worked hard.
'They were probably hoping I'd get in trouble. Fucking bastards.'
He could practically read what these two sasaeng fans were thinking just from one look at their eyes.
Once everyone was accounted for, Il-mok got down to business.
“Did you clean up all the Heavenly Orchid Society scums you ran into?"
"Yes, Young Master."
“Good. Gather the bodies. We’re burning them to get rid of the evidence.”
The evidence Il-mok was talking about was the wounds on the corpses.
The wounds were basically a signature of their Demonic Arts. If they left them be, someone might figure out who they were.
He doubted the Murim Alliance bastards would bother investigating the details of some backwater Gansu Province.
'Better safe than sorry.'
For Il-mok, who had to live with the paranoid voice of his own Demonic Art, destroying the evidence was just second nature.
