Chapter 195: Night of Lanzhou (1)
As soon as Il-mok gave his orders, the group quickly got moving.
Well, everyone except Il-mok.
"Ahem. I have severe hygiene obsessions, so I'm afraid I can't help with this particular task. Carrying corpses around or rummaging through grimy corners is out of the question for me. What if I accidentally trigger my obsessive-compulsive disorder and go berserk? That would be quite problematic, wouldn't it?"
Il-mok felt awkward being the only one sitting this one out, so he rattled off excuse after excuse.
“It is fine for you to entrust such miscellaneous chores to us.”
"As your subordinates, this is naturally our duty."
"Don't worry about it, big brother."
Dam Bin, Jin Hayeon, and Hyeokryeon Seon-ah all responded without missing a beat, and the others didn't seem to mind either as they filed out of the hall.
Watching them voluntarily take on the grunt work, Il-mok let out a sigh of relief.
Half of what he'd said was just an excuse, but the other half was genuine.
'Damn sweat.'
The perspiration from his fight with the Heavenly Orchid Society's leader was making his obsessive-compulsive tendencies gradually worse as time went on.
"Phew."
While Il-mok tried to calm himself and ease his compulsions by cooling down his sweat, his companions busied themselves with their work.
They scoured the massive estate of the Heavenly Orchid Society, gathering up the corpses they'd created and searching every nook and cranny for valuables and ledgers along the way.
Resting in the leader's hall, Il-mok had this thought.
'Man, I really made the right call coming to the Central Plains!'
This kind of situation would've been impossible back at headquarters.
He'd probably be stuck under his Master or his Eldest Brother's thumb, getting worked to death, acting as a Wikipedia every single day.
Il-mok was enjoying this brief moment of happiness during his break when—
"Young Master, what do you plan to do with these people?"
Jin Hayeon pointed indifferently toward one corner while piling corpses,
There lay three unconscious women.
They were the women who'd been in bed with the Heavenly Orchid Society leader when they first attacked this place.
They’d all passed out from shock when Il-mok started butchering the bodyguards.
"Hmm."
Il-mok thought about it for a second, then shrugged.
“Let’s just take them to the local branch for now.”
After they finished piling up the bodies, setting them on fire, and stuffing their bags with all the loot and ledgers they could find, Il-mok and his crew headed for the cult's Lanzhou branch office.
Since Lanzhou was also a provincial capital, it was, of course, home to a branch office of the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult.
The cult had about six or seven branches in every Central Plains province they operated in, with around a dozen people at each one.
However, areas near provincial capitals and major sect locations had slightly more branch members assigned to them, though not every city had a branch.
They had a presence in the provinces closer to their home base in Xinjiang—like Gansu, Qinghai, Sichuan, and Yunnan—and their network stretched all the way out to Hunan and Hubei near Dongting Lake where the Murim Alliance was located.
On the flip side, they had zero presence in the eastern provinces like Zhejiang or Hebei.
It was a nightmare to manage a branch from that far away, and by the time any intel got back to main headquarters, it would be outdated.
Anyway, thanks to the info they got from Gulang’s Branch Leader, Il-mok and his team found the place with no problem.
"We greet the Eighth Disciple of the Supreme One!"
Even though it was still only the early morning hours of the Hour of Rabbit (5-7 AM), the Lanzhou Branch Leader was already outside with a welcoming party.
About half of the Lanzhou branch members lived at this estate as servants or family members, while the other half lived elsewhere and visited periodically to maintain their cover.
The Lanzhou Branch Leader bowed his head and clasped his hands as he asked, “Young Master. By any chance, did you run into some trouble on the way?”
While Il-mok himself had less blood on his clothes, quite a few others were splattered with it, and some were even carrying unconscious women on their backs, hence his question.
But the answer he got was beyond the Branch Leader's expectations.
"We fought the Heavenly Orchid Society."
"!?"
“From this day forth, the scums in Lanzhou who call themselves its sky will no longer exist.”
"You... you completely destroyed the Heavenly Orchid Society?"
When Il-mok nodded, the Branch Leader prostrated himself with a shocked expression.
"The Supreme One’s grace has shone upon Lanzhou, bringing salvation to all living beings."
Because he operated in Gansu rather than Xinjiang, the news was slow to reach him; however, he too had heard the rumors about the Eighth Young Master.
But he never would’ve dreamed they could take out the entire Heavenly Orchid Society with just that small number of martial artists.
The branch members, realizing that the disciple they served was a genius far beyond common sense, also prostrated themselves before Il-mok following their leader.
In that reverent atmosphere, the genius far beyond common sense opened his mouth.
"First, could you prepare some bath water for me?"
It had been over two hours since his life-and-death battle with the Heavenly Orchid Society Leader.
His tolerance for hygiene had already reached its limit.
—Kill them all!
—Purge this world of its filthy dust and filth! Slice it all away!
Those prostrating before Il-mok had no idea.
They had absolutely no clue that the man they were worshipping was a lunatic who was about one step away from completely snapping.
After finishing his ritual bath and cleansing.
"Lanzhou Branch Leader Gye Yun reporting. May I enter, Young Master?"
"Come in."
The Lanzhou Branch Leader entered the hall with Il-mok's guards.
“We questioned the women and found that all three women were sold here from other counties due to debts."
"Are you certain?"
If it turned out to be false, like they might be the Society Leader’s concubines for instance, things could get complicated.
In response to Il-mok's question, the Branch Leader replied.
"We have records of the transactions involving these women. Of course, we'd need to verify with their home counties to be completely certain, but it is highly likely to be true for now."
“If we have a branch in their hometowns, tell them to confirm it. If not, send someone over to check.”
"I will obey your command."
"And guide me to where those women are being held. I need to have a little chat with them."
At Il-mok's words, the Branch Leader led him there.
He was glad to see the women showed no signs of torture from their interrogation.
However, because they could not comprehend the current situation, every one of them had eyes filled with anxiety.
“Do not be alarmed. If what you've told us is true and you have no direct connection to the Heavenly Orchid Society, we'll release you in a few days."
Although Il-mok spoke in a placating manner, their eyes remained anxious.
Watching them for a moment, Il-mok brought up something more hopeful to lighten the mood.
"If what you've said is true, I'll gladly send you back to your hometowns. The Heavenly Orchid Society is gone now, so you won't need to worry about those debts anymore."
But for some reason, the news that they could go home didn’t make them happy.
Their expressions remained gloomy.
He thought maybe they didn't trust his words or were just anxious, but thanks to a telepathic message from Dam Bin nearby, Il-mok realized the truth.
—Young Master, sending those women back to their hometowns might actually be a terrible thing for them.
—What do you mean by that?
—Because the people in their villages know they were sold as prostitutes.
Only then did Il-mok recall something he'd learned long ago.
While studying Korean history for civil service exams, he'd learned about the concept known as "tribute women." He recalled the passage which stated that on the rare occasions that women sent as tribute to the Yuan dynasty returned to their hometowns, they were not welcomed by the village, and that such women were called by the slur ‘ hwanyangnyeon .’
(TL Note: Just search 화냥년 on Google and you’ll know.)
After pondering for a moment how to handle this, a good idea occurred to Il-mok, and he opened his mouth to speak.
“So… any of you know how to act?”
The three women are beautiful enough to attract the Society Leader and keep them to himself. If they went into missionary work, they'd probably boast quite a success rate.
"A-acting?" For origınal chapters go to novel-fire.net
All three of them looked stunned. Il-mok quickly clarified.
“Oh, don’t worry about the basics. We’ll cover your food and housing.”
He had no intention of working them like slaves, at least.
The three women exchanged a long, complicated look. Finally, the one in the center took a deep breath and spoke.
“We’ve never acted a day in our lives, but we'll do our best."
They had nowhere to go anyway, and they'd realized their lives were in this man's hands.
Hearing her determined answer, Il-mok turned to Baek Cheon.
"Young Master Baek. You’re up. Teach these ladies how to act.”
The second he heard the word "act," Baek Cheon had started looking like a little kid unwrapping his gift during Christmas.
“Say no more, Young Master! Though this Baek's acting skills overflow abundantly, handling all the roles in a grand play by myself was proving quite difficult. This Baek will train these women into the finest actresses and spread the name of the Heavenl—I mean, Maitreya far and wide!"
Watching Baek Cheon's ecstatic reaction, Il-mok smiled awkwardly.
'I was just gonna use them as honey trap agents.'
He hadn't really planned to throw them into Baek Cheon's plays, but Baek Cheon looked so happy.
There’s an old saying that the only thing worse than not getting a gift is getting one and then having it snatched away. It was too late to take it back now.
'Well... it's better than going back to their hometowns.'
Il-mok felt a bit sorry for the three women who would now suffer under Baek Cheon, but decided to let it slide for now.
"Branch Leader."
"Yes, Young Master."
With the women's matter now concluded, Il-mok turned back to the Branch Leader.
“While you were going through their ledgers, did you happen to find a list of the brothels, inns, and taverns the society was running in the city?”
Thinking about the three women had made him think about the bigger picture.
'The intel said their whole operation was based on human trafficking across the entire province.'
There had to be more victims out there than just these three.
“We have identified a certain portion, but as we have not yet confirmed all of the ledgers, additional investigations will be needed."
Il-mok nodded at the Branch Leader's words.
"Let me know when you finish the investigations. With the Heavenly Orchid Society gone, Lanzhou's night scene will soon become a no-man's land, so it'll need organizing."
As Il-mok roughly sorted out the situation and was considering getting some sleep.
The Branch Leader cautiously spoke, "Young Master, there's one more thing I need to report."
When Il-mok looked at the Branch Leader with curiosity, he pulled out a small box from his robes and opened it.
Inside the box was some kind of plant.
A medicinal herb radiating mystical energy.
"This was among the Heavenly Orchid Society's assets that you acquired, Young Master. I was hesitant to present it to you recklessly without knowing its precise identity, but after searching their ledgers, we were able to confirm that it is a thousand-year-old tuber fleeceflower root that they purchased on the black market.”
Hearing that, the corners of Il-mok's mouth curved upward.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 196: Night of Lanzhou (2)
Il-mok was meditating in a room the Branch Leader had set up for him. He sat cross-legged, staring down at the thousand-year-old tuber fleece root in front of him.
'I was disappointed about not having any breakthrough even after that life-or-death fight, but who knew I'd score an elixir here?'
He figured the Heavenly Orchid Society Leader probably bought it for himself. The guy was so damn lazy that despite being a martial artist, he was packed with fat rolls.
But Il-mok had to admit that his internal energy reserve was insane.
'Guess when you don't feel like training but have money from bleeding Lanzhou dry, you just take the easy route with drugs.'
Or maybe it was the other way around. Maybe he started munching on all these elixers and just got lazier and lazier.
"Lucky bastard..."
He could picture the Heavenly Orchid Society Leader kicking back and doing nothing for a decade, and it made him shudder with jealousy.
But in the end, that very laziness and cruelty meant the elixir ended up in Il-mok's hands instead. Talk about a blessing in disguise.
'This is also thanks to the Heavenly Demon's grace... wait, what the hell am I thinking?'
Il-mok caught himself slipping into cult-worshipper and quickly shook his head.
'That was close.'
Leading a missionary work meant you could accidentally brainwash yourself if you weren't careful.
"Whew."
After taking deep breaths to calm himself, Il-mok closed his eyes and expanded his qi perception.
He could feel four people stationed at each cardinal direction around the pavilion, acting as guardians.
They were there to keep outsiders away, but also to stop Il-mok if he went berserk.
Once he finished checking his surroundings, Il-mok shoved the thousand-year-old tuber fleece root into his mouth and swallowed it whole after chewing it a few times.
Thanks to the energy infused in the root, he could actually feel it traveling down his esophagus toward his stomach.
"Inhale. Exhale."
Il-mok took a deep breath and circulated his qi from his dantian.
The demonic energy flowing from his dantian guided the pure qi from the thousand-year-old elixir through his meridians. As it circulated, the root's energy naturally transformed and took on the same demonic attribute as his Soul-Stealing Heartless Sword.
Even as the first wave of absorbed energy cycled through his meridians, new energy kept flowing from the root, and Il-mok's own energy went out to guide it in turn.
And once all the roots' energy had been dyed with demonic qi, Il-mok felt a slight tension building and focused even harder.
"Inhale. Exhale."
'Okay, here comes the hard part.'
Absorbing elixir wasn't always safe.
Just like how doping in the modern world could send you straight to the afterlife or leave you with serious side effects, elixirs were the same.
Il-mok began guiding the energy racing through his meridians back into his dantian.
But even though he hadn't absorbed all the energy still circulating through his meridians, his dantian had filled up completely at some point.
The energy absorbed from the root had increased beyond what his current dantian could hold.
"Inhale. Exhale."
So Il-mok carefully divided it strand by strand, cramming the excess energy into his dantian like stuffing luggage into a tiny gap.
As his dantian started to ache from the strain of being stretched to its absolute limit, it slowly began to get bigger.
You often hear people in the martial world talking about how much internal energy they have, throwing around terms like "half a cycle" or "a full sixty-year cycle" of energy.
But that was actually a misleading way to put it.
If a martial artist who'd trained for decades and accumulated half a cycle of internal energy used it all up in a life-or-death battle, would they really need to train for the same number of years to rebuild that half jiazi?
Of course not.
Normally, it only takes a couple of hours, maybe a day, to get your internal energy fully recovered after a fight.
In other words, when people talked about half a cycle or a full sixty-year cycle, they weren't referring to the amount of internal energy in the dantian—they were talking about the dantian's size and the maximum amount of internal energy a dantian could hold.
That was not to say that having a large dantian meant it took a long time to recover one’s internal energy.
Actually, the bigger it is, the faster it refills. A bigger dantian has a higher absorption rate when it’s empty, and the meridians trained during the expansion process could handle much larger amounts of internal energy.
Right now, Il-mok was using the medicine's energy to expand his dantian's size.
And sweating buckets while he did it.
'Fucking Demonic Art.'
This was one of the few downsides to these cheat-like Demonic Arts.
Unlike the pure and docile cultivation methods of Buddhist or Daoist schools, demonic energy was an absolute pain in the ass.
It was a pain in the ass in normal condition and it’s an even more pain in the ass when he is actively training his dantian. Moreover, if the demonic energy succeeds in its tantrum, it would throw him into a Qi Deviation right off the bat,
It’s not a big deal when you’re a beginner and you don’t have much demonic energy or a big dantian. But once you hit a certain level, trying to get stronger is like walking on eggshells.
This was also closely related to why Demonic Arts often stalled after reaching a certain level.
They're already dealing with all the crazy side effects, and trying this on top of it all is a surefire way to go completely nuts.
'I can't end up like I did at the Demonic Way Hall.'
If Hall Master Yeom Ga-hwi hadn't basically babysat him through every single training session, Il-mok would have either died or gone nuts years ago.
And thanks to that experience, Il-mok was now quite accustomed to the task of managing his demonic energy while expanding his dantian.
Il-mok guided the energy flowing like a river through his meridians toward his dantian.
His dantian was already full, so he had to expand it carefully bit by bit. Trying to forcefully cram in large amounts of internal energy would send him straight into Qi Deviation.
But the energy heading toward his dantian didn't actually enter it. Instead, it began wrapping around the outside.
Then he took a tiny little thread of demonic energy and forced it inside the packed core, making it spasm violently. The instant it did, he used the energy blanket outside the dantian to absorb the shock.
It was a trick he’d been forced to invent near the end of his time at the Hall of the Demonic Way when he got so unstable that he’d nearly go into Qi deviation just from trying to meditate.
He got the idea from his old life as Seo Ji-hoon, remembering how he used to pack fragile stuff in bubble wrap.
He didn’t know how long he maintained that focus.
"Exhale."
Il-mok, who'd been so absorbed in his cultivation that he'd lost track of time, finally opened his eyes with a deep breath.
Intense light briefly flashed from Il-mok's eyes, but once his energy settled, they returned to their usual indifferent gaze.
"About twenty years' worth of cultivation, I'd say."
That was the result of absorbing every last bit of the root's energy without wasting a drop.
For context, by the time he graduated from the Hall of the Demonic Way, he'd managed to build up a power level of just over a sixty-year cycle after cramming nothing but training for several months straight.
And today, after cramming in an additional twenty years' worth of cultivation, his dantian had grown to about one and a half cycles.
For a guy who’d only started training three years ago, that was just insane.
Part of it was because Demonic Arts naturally progressed faster, but without the Explosive Demon Pill and the thousand-year-old tuber fleece roots, this achievement would've been impossible.
Most of the Explosive Demon Pill's energy had been used for body refinement with minimal absorption, but his meridians had expanded and cleared during that process and could dramatically increase the amount of internal energy absorbed with each cultivation session. Over the past two years, he'd accumulated far more energy than what had been spent on body refinement.
But for a guy who’d just gotten a massive power-up, Il-mok's expression wasn't particularly bright.
"Tsk. Can't be helped, I guess."
Sadly, he hadn't broken through to a new realm or gained any enlightenment this time either.
Still, thanks to the increased internal energy, the burden of wielding Sword Force had lessened considerably.
As Il-mok confirmed his progress and left the pavilion, those who'd been standing guard welcomed him.
"Congratulations, Young Master."
"We congratulate you on your achievement."
Il-mok nodded and asked, "Thanks for standing guard. By the way, how many hours passed while I was meditating?"
"About eight hours, Young Master."
Il-mok almost laughed out loud when he heard that.
'If twenty years' worth of internal energy cultivation took this long, eating something like Azure Stone Milk or Ten-Thousand-Year Snow Ginseng would either keep me up all night or kill me with Qi Deviation.'
There was a reason for the saying "too much is as bad as too little." Especially for Demonic Arts practitioners.
"Also, we received word from the Branch Leader. They've compiled a complete list of all the brothels and taverns managed by the Heavenly Orchid Society."
"Since you've exhausted yourself absorbing the medicine, Young Master, we'll handle visiting those establishments."
At Jin Hayeon and Dam Bin's words, Il-mok's lips nearly curved upward.
'Ha. Coming to the Central Plains was definitely the right call.'
Subordinates who volunteered to handle work? How wonderful was that?
But, because he had at least a shred of decency, he made an offer he hoped they’d refuse.
"You must be tired from standing guard. Why don't you rest a bit before heading out?"
"We took turns resting while on guard duty, so there's no need to worry."
This time, Il-mok couldn’t stop himself. A huge grin spread across his face.
Meanwhile, the mood in Lanzhou's red-light district was tense.
Rumors about the bloodbath that occurred at the massive estate not far from the district had spread.
With the Heavenly Orchid Society fallen, the atmosphere grew chaotic.
But the specific mood varied subtly from brothel to brothel.
Some trembled in fear and watched nervously, while others saw the Heavenly Orchid Society's fall as an opportunity to strike out on their own.
In the depths of one establishment, the Crimson Silk Pavilion, its owner sat with a furrowed brow.
"Pavilion Master, now is our chance."
At the words of his confidant, the one in charge of the Crimson Silk Pavilion's security, the Pavilion Master shook his head.
"We don't know the identity of those who attacked the Heavenly Orchid Society, nor do we know their purpose. Moving recklessly now would be dangerous."
"The Great Clarity Pavilion has already started making moves. If we just sit here waiting, we might end up paying tribute to them instead."
"And what if those who attacked the Heavenly Orchid Society come looking for us?"
“It’s been half a day and nothing’s happened! I'm certain some righteous master passing through got angry at their evil deeds and killed them before moving on."
“I get why you’re antsy. But the world doesn’t usually give you such neat and tidy happy endings.”
"That caution of yours is quite admirable."
A woman’s voice cut into their conversation, making both the Pavilion Master and his confidant’s heads snap around.
From the corner of the room, a pool of darkness coalesced into the form of a woman wearing black clothes with a wrathful deity mask perched on her face.
Clang!
The confidant quickly drew his blade, but the Pavilion Master extended his arm to stop him.
After restraining his confidant, the Pavilion Master cupped his fists and bowed to the uninvited guest.
"This humble one greets the new sky of Lanzhou."
"!!!"
As the confidant's expression filled with shock, a smile formed on the lips visible through the woman's mask.
It was a weirdly magnetic smile. Even though only her eyes and mouth were visible, an inexplicable sensuality emanated from her.
"Not only cautious, but exceptionally perceptive as well."
The woman—Dam Bin—spoke approvingly, then issued her command.
"Gather all the women working at this Crimson Silk Pavilion."
The Pavilion Master could have asked why, but instead immediately sent a glance to his confidant without hesitation.
Shortly after, the confidant returned, leading the courtesans working there.
Once enough people had gathered, Dam Bin spoke.
"From today forward, this Crimson Silk Pavilion will operate under the protection of our Maitreya Luminous Cult, and you will pay five percent of your profit as a protection fee."
The confidant nearly shouted, 'That's an outrageous rate!' but stopped himself. Orıginal content can be found at NovєlFіre.net
'Wait. Five percent? Not fifty?'
Compared to what they'd been paying the Heavenly Orchid Society, this was practically nothing.
But Dam Bin wasn't finished yet.
"However, from now on, the courtesans must be paid fairly for their labor. Anyone who forcibly prevents a courtesan from switching to being an entertainer only, or from quitting entirely, will face divine punishment."
At her unexpected words, the eyes of the courtesans who'd been dragged here and trembling with fear widened.
One courtesan mustered her courage and asked Dam Bin, "W-what about our debts?"
Dam Bin smiled and answered.
"Don't worry. The Heavenly Orchid Society has been erased from this world, and your debts went with the Society Leader to the afterlife."
There was a strange pride in her tone.
Pride in the man who’d come up with this plan, the Eighth Young Master.
'The way he cherishes the common people... he truly embodies the cult's ideals.'
In truth, Il-mok had initially considered shutting down all the brothels and freeing all the courtesans. But after hearing the stories of the three women in the Heavenly Orchid Society, he'd changed his mind a bit.
He realized that in a world like this, sending these women home would just be sending them from one hell to another.
So the next best option was to eliminate their debts and give them choices.
And Il-mok's instructions didn't end with the courtesans.
"Furthermore, the Crimson Silk Pavilion Master's money that was forcibly used by the Heavenly Orchid Society to purchase courtesans will also be returned. So don't feel wronged."
When the masked woman brought up the very issue the Pavilion Master had been too afraid to mention, he internally breathed a sigh of relief.
"I can only express my gratitude for the new sky's mercy."
As the Pavilion Master expressed his thanks with another show of respect, Dam Bin nodded and said, "As I mentioned, this place will now operate under the Maitreya Luminous Cult's protection, so you must follow the cult's teachings from now on. There will be gatherings later; be sure to attend."
"I will obey your command."
"Also, Pavilion Master, in addition to this place, I'm entrusting you with management of the Great Clarity Pavilion as well."
"I'm terribly sorry to say this, but the master of that place won't listen to someone like me."
"You needn't worry about that. Divine punishment from Maitreya has already befallen him."
A smile bloomed on the lips visible through the masked woman's face. A smile reeking of blood.
Cold sweat trickled down the Pavilion Master's forehead at that thick scent of blood, and he quickly bowed his head.
When he raised his head again, the masked woman was nowhere to be seen.
But the lingering, fishy scent of blood still remained.
'Tonight, another storm of blood will sweep through this area.'
The Pavilion Master, who was usually told he was too cautious, realized that very caution had saved his life.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 197: Proselytization (1)
Early the next morning.
"Haaaaaah."
Il-mok stretched lazily as he woke up.
After fighting the Heavenly Orchid Society Leader and spending from early morning till afternoon absorbing the energy of the thousand-year-old elixir through meditation, he'd crashed in the early evening and was only now waking up.
"Are you awake, Young Master?"
Hearing Dam Bin's voice from outside the door, Il-mok yawned as he stepped out and asked.
"Haaaah. How'd things go last night?"
"I delivered all your instructions. Anyone who dared to resist your will or who acted out of greedy has been dealt with."
"Good work. You couldn't have slept much at all. Why don't you get some rest?"
"We're taking turns sleeping, so there's no need to worry."
Il-mok looked past Dam Bin and noticed Ju Seo-yeon pouting.
They were taking guard duty in pairs, and she clearly wasn't thrilled about constantly being paired with either Dam Bin or Ouyang Mun.
It was Il-mok's consideration for Jin Hayeon. If he'd paired her with Ju Seo-yeon or Ouyang Mun for guard duty, who knows what horrific things might've happened.
But her sullen face didn't last long. Ju Seo-yeon's eyes suddenly sparkled.
Jin Hayeon and Hyeokryeon Seon-ah were approaching with each carrying a tray and a basin.
"Big brother!"
“We brought your breakfast and some water to wash up.”
As Hyeokryeon Seon-ah greeted Il-mok with a bright smile and Jin Hayeon's calm voice chimed in, Ju Seo-yeon exclaimed with the face of a puppy meeting its owner after hours apart.
"You're beautiful as ever today, Senior Hayeon!"
“…Thank you.”
After replying brusquely to Ju Seo-yeon’s adoration, Jin Hayeon turned to Dam Bin.
“Section Leader. We shall take over the guard duty from now on. Please have some rest."
“Will do.”
Dam Bin nodded and grabbed the puppy-eyed Ju Seo-yeon by the scruff of her neck and dragged her away.
"......"
Il-mok just shook his head at the dizzying scene. He washed his face to shake off the compulsion and enjoyed his breakfast.
After finishing his meal, Il-mok asked. "Where are Young Master Baek Cheon and the women?" Updates are released by NoveIꜰire.net
"I'll summon them right away."
Jin Hayeon left the hall and returned shortly after with Baek Cheon and the three women.
"......"
Il-mok stared at them speechlessly for a moment, then sighed and asked Baek Cheon.
"What the hell did you do to them?"
The three women looked absolutely wrecked. They were completely out of it, looking even more traumatized than when they’d been interrogated last night.
"I merely taught them acting."
"...What kind of teaching leaves them looking like jiangshis?"
Baek Cheon looked wronged, and it was Jin Hayeon who explained instead.
"Apparently, he's been teaching them acting since you gave the order."
"Don't tell me... all night?"
Baek Cheon protested.
“I am being wronged! Do you really think I would make them stay up all night? Sleep deprivation is the enemy of beauty! How could someone like me, who needs to catch everyone's attention, stay up all night?"
"......"
Il-mok just stared at him like he’d lost his mind as he continued to yap.
"I just taught them acting until the end of the Hour of Pig (9-11 PM), then started practice again this morning."
In other words, after being ordered to teach them acting yesterday at dawn, he'd worked them for eight full hours, and that still wasn't enough for him, so he'd woken them up again this morning to continue.
Il-mok took a moment to blame himself.
'There's no 'moderation' in lunatics’ dictionary. I knew he was nuts. This is on me for not giving him a time limit beforehand.'
Il-mok let out a soft sigh. "Well, if you pushed them that hard, they must have at least gotten the basics down."
"They're good enough for the task at hand."
Il-mok nodded. “Then there’s no reason to wait. Get started.”
Only then did the three women realize. The mastermind behind their suffering at the hands of this insane attention-whore was this very man.
That's when the crazy attention-whore suddenly blurted out something unexpected.
"Young Master. Along with these three, could you also send Miss Jeong with them?"
"You mean Jeong Hyeon?"
"Yes."
Il-mok frowned. "Why?"
“She’ll be their role model.”
“You think she can handle that?”
Il-mok asked, recalling Jeong Hyeon's side effects.
"Young Master! That's disrespectful to her!"
Baek Cheon's eyes sparkled with trust in Jeong Hyeon.
"She studied acting under me for over six months. I believe she can definitely pull it off!"
Actually, no. He just believed in his own teaching.
Madman's ravings aside, Il-mok fell into thought for a moment.
There was actually something that had been bothering him. And if Jeong Hyeon joined the proselytizing, it might solve that problem.
After finishing his deliberation, Il-mok spoke.
"Bring Miss Jeong here. I'll let her decide for herself."
A minute later…
Jeong Hyeon, who had just woken up, arrived at Il-mok's hall with a half-asleep face.
Last night, Dam Bin and the other women from the Hidden Guard Pavilion, along with Ouyang Mun, had visited the brothels and taverns managed by the Heavenly Orchid Society.
On top of that, they'd taken turns standing guard for Il-mok, so she'd only fallen asleep at dawn before waking up.
"I-I greet Young Master Il-mok."
As Jeong Hyeon bowed in greeting, Il-mok smiled gently and explained the general situation.
She was already half-asleep, so hearing this crazy talk about a recruitment mission made her brain just short-circuit. She stared blankly at Baek Cheon.
'Wh-what did I ever do to deserve this from him?'
Baek Cheon, completely misreading Jeong Hyeon's resentful look, flashed his white teeth in a smile.
His eyes screamed, 'Just trust me! With the acting skills you learned from me, you'll be more than fine!'
Judging by their gazes alone, they weren't on the same wavelength at all.
Not that talking ever helped. Baek Cheon only heard what he wanted to hear after all.
That's when Il-mok's voice pulled Jeong Hyeon from her thoughts.
"I called you here to give you a choice, Miss Jeong. If you were someone who merely trembled in fear, I wouldn't have bothered, but didn't you say you wanted to overcome your social anxiety?"
"Ah..."
"I won't force you, so think it over carefully and decide."
After mulling it over for a moment, Jeong Hyeon spoke.
"I-I do want to overcome my social anxiety, but pr-proselytizing requires t-talking to people, doesn't it?"
She might be able to approach people if she really tried, but she had no confidence in holding a proper conversation.
She could already picture herself stuttering terribly or muttering in a voice like ants crawling before spiralling into a panic attack.
But for some reason, Il-mok just grinned.
"Don't worry. In your case, you won't need to speak at all."
Later, at a teahouse in the middle of the Lanzhou market.
Cute tea sets and sweet snacks were products that young women loved regardless of time or place.
This place was famous among Lanzhou's young women, making it a spot that countless women frequented.
Normally, the teahouse should have been filled with the chatter of young women, starting with praise for the tea's aroma and taste, and then exchanging various neighbourhood gossip.
But for some reason, there were strange silences between conversations today.
The reason was simple.
Most of the women had their attention captured by something, making it impossible for them to properly converse with their companions.
Some were just openly gawking, totally mesmerized. Others would try to look away, only to find their eyes drifting back for another peek.
And at the place their gazes were directed, there was Jeong Hyeon.
"Oh my, oh my. Look at that face."
"Hey. Be careful. What if he hears you?"
Dressed in men's clothing.
Thanks to her heightened senses from the Ghostly Spirit Divine Bow, Jeong Hyeon didn't miss the women's voices.
'H-how did it come to this?'
Naturally, it was Il-mok's doing.
After deciding to use the three women for proselytizing, Il-mok had one concern.
‘Although they cannot be compared to Miss Jin or Seon-ah, all three possess respectable looks, more than enough to conduct missionary work… but if we do this, the gender ratio will be completely unbalanced.’
Since he was using honey traps for proselytizing, the new converts would be nothing but men at this rate.
Of course, they'd be recruiting courtesans as converts while taking over brothels and taverns, but he couldn't help feeling something was missing.
This felt less like evangelizing and more like annexing territory.
He wondered for a second why he even cared about the gender balance, but then remembered his side effects. The imbalance in the gender ratio bothered him.
And that’s when Baek Cheon suggested having Jeong Hyeon participate in the mission. For Il-mok, it was a eureka moment.
He remembered what happened at the Hall of the Demonic Way. Specifically, his first meeting with Jeong Hyeon.
'That's right! She's got that androgynous look. With the right clothes and hairstyle, she could totally pass for a pretty boy!'
Il-mok himself had mistaken her for a man for quite a while, hadn't he?
Moreover, once his thinking shifted, other forgotten memories came flooding back.
The biggest share was from his time as Seo Ji-hoon.
Specifically, what he'd recalled when he discovered Ju Seo-yeon was Jin Hayeon's sasaeng fan. He remembered this girl in college who was a sasaeng fan of some pop idol, and a crazy rant she once went on.
—Obviously, the muscular 'beast idols' are way better than the skinny flower boys! Sure, little kids who are still scared of real men might prefer the feminine-looking pretty boys and hate guys with six-pack abs, but they just don't know what's good!
That was from way back, when weird K-pop terms like "beast idol" were all the rage.
And if you flipped that college student's words around:
'Young women who've never been close to men or still find them intimidating prefer androgynous pretty boys!' was the shocking conclusion one could reach.
The mission Il-mok assigned to Jeong Hyeon was precisely this: the pretty boy strategy.
In other words, it could be called the Jade-Faced Young Master Bait.
While Jeong Hyeon was having an internal crisis about being turned into a K-pop Idol by Il-mok, the voices of young women from respectable families reached her ears.
"Where did such a gorgeous man come from...?"
I’m not a man.
"Look how pale his face is. How can he be paler than me, a woman?"
It’s called ‘being scared stiff.’
"And that bearing. Look at those melancholic eyes."
I’m not melancholic. I’m about to burst into tears .

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 198: Proselytization (2)
Among the young women of Lanzhou, there was one tea house that enjoyed unrivaled popularity.
But wherever flowers bloom, bees are bound to gather.
As women's gazes flocked to Jeong Hyeon, there were naturally quite a few who weren't too pleased about it.
"Tsk."
One such man sat there, his face flushed red with anger.
He'd heard that a woman he'd been pining after frequented this place, so he'd shown up pretending it was just a coincidence and miraculously managed to sit at her table. But even though he was right there with her, she kept sneaking glances at that pale, pretty-boy-looking bastard over there who resembled some rich madam’s plaything.
Unable to contain his rage, the man stood up.
As he stormed toward the Jade-Faced Young Master, the woman who'd been sitting with him belatedly realized what was happening and jumped up to chase after him in alarm.
But before she could stop him, the man had already closed the distance to Jeong Hyeon.
"You look like a rich madam’s plaything. Came here to toy with women's hearts, did you?"
In response to the man's provocation, the Jade-Faced Young Master remained seated and only glancing up at him with eyes that seemed lost in melancholy before turning away.
For Jeong Hyeon, meeting someone's eyes directly at such close range was simply too difficult to bear.
But the man took that attitude as a sign of contempt.
“You son of a bitch!”
He was so furious that he just lost it and threw a punch.
To Jeong Hyeon, whose five senses had been heightened to an extreme degree thanks to the Ghostly Spirit Divine Bow, that punch seemed to crawl through the air like a caterpillar.
Now, it was true that her side effects usually made her freeze up solid when people got this close, but she was still someone who'd graduated from the Hall of the Demonic Way, the elite training facility that only accepted the most talented believers of the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult.
Thwack!
Her palm shot out faster than anyone watching could perceive and hit the attacking man square in the stomach.
"Kuh..."
The man who'd started the confrontation collapsed with a choked groan.
The eyes of the woman who'd rushed over to stop him went wide with shock.
'Oh my. So quiet and dignified, yet so capable...'
She wasn't actually quiet by nature. She simply kept her mouth shut because conversing with people was difficult for her.
But regardless of Jeong Hyeon's actual circumstances, that woman was already completely smitten.
And she wasn't the only one.
Every woman sitting in the tea house who'd been watching the scene unfold felt a storm of emotions surging through their heart.
The Jade-Faced Young Master with that androgynous charm and beautiful face actually possessed enough strength to subdue a troublemaker with a single strike.
Those combinations are absolutely lethal for these women.
The woman who'd chased after the man understood immediately. This place was crawling with hyenas all eyeing the same prey.
So she acted boldly.
The idiot she'd been sitting with had just given her the perfect opening, and she was going to take it.
"A-are you alright? That must have been so scary..."
As the blushing woman initiated conversation, Jeong Hyeon couldn't help but be amazed.
'It's... it's actually going exactly like Young Master said it would!'
Il-mok had told her that she wouldn't need to open her mouth for the mission.
She just needed to sit in the tea house, and women would approach her on their own.
Of course, even Il-mok hadn't predicted this exact scenario would unfold. He'd simply expected that if they threw out bait and waited, someone would bite.
Either way, things were proceeding according to Il-mok's predictions, so Jeong Hyeon acted as he'd instructed.
Even though she felt like she was suffocating with the girl standing so close, Jeong Hyeon pulled a folded note from her sleeve and handed it over.
Swoosh.
"Wh-what's this?"
Jeong Hyeon didn't answer the woman's question. She simply stood up silently and brushed past her to leave the tea house.
The woman stared after Jeong Hyeon's departing figure with a dazed expression before finally coming to her senses and unfolding the letter the Jade-Faced Young Master had left behind.
Written on it were a location and a time.
'A... a private meeting with me!'
She interpreted it as an invitation from the Jade-Faced Young Master.
It was an invitation, all right.
Just an invitation to a religious gathering.
Meanwhile...
A few shadowy figures had been watching the whole scene go down from a distance. They waited for Jeong Hyeon to leave, then followed her into a nearby alley.
"Hahaha! Did you see that magnificent performance? That's the acting I personally taught her!"
Baek Cheon looked at his three new disciples with an expression overflowing with pride.
But the three women's faces were less than impressed.
'No matter how I look at it, that didn't seem like acting...'
'Ugh. What's the point? He'll just hear what he wants to hear.'
In a single day, the women had come to realize that Baek Cheon was a lunatic.
Meanwhile, Baek Cheon's eyes were blazing with fervor.
'Young Master truly is a genius! To create such a powerful scene with no dialogue, just pure stage direction! Incredible!'
True to someone who'd devoted his life to acting, he couldn't help but be deeply impressed by Il-mok's staging of this situation.
And also true to someone obsessed with acting, he wasn't content to just stand there admiring it.
"Now then! You've witnessed your senior's splendid performance firsthand, so now it's your turn to step up!"
With those words, Baek Cheon took the lead and emerged from the alley, while the three women behind him all sighed in unison as they watched his back.
That evening.
The recruitment teams started trickling back to the cult’s local headquarters.
First to return were Baek Cheon and the three women who'd been working the streets. The next was the Jade-Faced Young Master Jeong Hyeon who'd a trail of broken hearts in her wake. The last one was the trio of Seon-ah, Jin Hayeon, and Ouyang Mun.
Seon-ah and Jin Hayeon had been on bodyguard duty, but once Dam Bin and Ju Seo-yeon woke up from their nap and took over, they headed out to help with the recruitment drive.
Ouyang Mun, who had also just woken up, tagged along.
Of course, Jin Hayeon and Hyeokryeon Seon-ah were assigned to male proselytization while Ouyang Mun handled female proselytization, so they had to work separately.
The first stop for most of the returning teams was the bathhouse.
The three women were exhausted after spending several hours wandering the marketplace talking to men, and Jeong Hyeon was in the same state.
Normally, she preferred bathing alone at different times from everyone else, but she had no choice today.
Despite having learned martial arts and mostly just sitting around all day, her body was drenched in sweat. Just sitting there and letting all those girls stare at her had taken a huge mental toll.
Jin Hayeon, who'd barely broken a sweat, went to attend to Il-mok. Ouyang Mun followed her, and Hyeokryeon Seon-ah headed to the bathhouse.
She needed to wash off the black dye she'd applied to hide her distinctive red hair.
So as the five women began undressing to enter the bathhouse together...
"......"
The three women who'd been learning acting from Baek Cheon stood there staring somewhere with dazed expressions.
'T-those... can be hidden with bandages?'
The women couldn't help but be impressed. More than anything else—
'He saw that and still decided to make her dress up as a man...'
—They were impressed by Il-mok's decisiveness.
They couldn't help but think she would have been an absolute knockout if she'd been working as a femme fatale instead of a pretty boy.
"Eep."
Jeong Hyeon, who'd had similar experiences back at the Hall of the Demonic Way, quickly crossed her arms over her chest with a startled expression.
'Th-This is exactly why I hate group baths.'
Just as she was resigning herself to the awkwardness, she felt another pair of eyes locked onto her.
It was Hyeokryeon Seon-ah.
Jeong Hyeon felt something strange about the girl's stare.
Having spent time together, Jeong Hyeon had noticed something peculiar about Hyeokryeon Seon-ah.
Her attitude was completely different depending on whether Il-mok was nearby or not.
It wasn’t like she was mean to people or anything.
It was just that when Il-mok was around, she was sweet and friendly to everyone. But the second he was gone, she couldn’t care less about any of them.
Hyeokryeon Seol-ah, the girl who only bothered being nice when Il-mok was watching, was having an epiphany.
She knew full well that Il-mok still saw her as a little kid or at best a younger sister.
Since Il-mok had openly stated that he preferred women who reached their prime, denying it would be foolish.
In other words, Il-mok liked mature women.
'If I had those, I'd have a chance too...'
Jeong Hyeon felt a chill run down her spine as she saw the way Hyeokryeon Seon-ah’s eyes blazed.
Meanwhile, completely unaware of the drama going down in the bathhouse…
"I've returned from the proselytization mission, Young Master." Thıs text ıs hosted at N0v3l.Fiɾe.net
Il-mok nodded at Jin Hayeon’s report.
"Good work. Ah, and did Young Master Baek Cheon return as well?"
"Yes, Young Master."
"Then please call Young Master Baek Cheon here."
The moment Il-mok's order fell, Jin Hayeon turned and headed out again with Ju Seo-yeon and Ouyang Mun trying to follow her.
"You two stay here."
The sight of them frozen still with desperate eyes made Il-mok shake his head.
A moment later, when Jin Hayeon returned with Baek Cheon and their expressions brightened.
'Seriously, they're like a couple of dogs.'
They were the spitting image of dogs panting and wagging their tails happily when their owner returned home after leaving for work.
'…But what do you call a puppy whose owner doesn't actually want to see? Not exactly a pet, but closer to a nuisance.’
While Il-mok was entertaining such a trivial thought, Baek Cheon spoke up.
"What can I do for you, Young Master?"
"Ah. Actually, I called you here because I have an important task to entrust to you, Young Master Baek Cheon."
"To me?"
Il-mok nodded gravely.
He hadn’t just been sitting on his butt all day while the others were out working.
He’d spent some time training to keep his own alter ego under control, and the rest of the day he'd just been thinking.
'Even if I have to stoop to dirty tricks, I will achieve Transcendence!'
Thanks to his damn obsessive compulsion, once one problem popped into his head, his thoughts wouldn't stop.
So after he'd solved the gender-balance issue with the Jade-Faced Young Master Bait, another issue had surfaced in Il-mok's mind.
Namely, concerns about the gathering that would be held in two days.
This gathering and proselytization in Lanzhou were different from what happened in Gulang County.
In Gulang County, they'd held the gathering and proselytization, then heightened the believers' faith by punishing the scums of the Red Serpent Gang afterward.
But this time, they needed to take advantage of the element of surprise, so they had to flip the script and deal with the Heavenly Orchid Society first before starting proselytization.
Right after that, they'd gone to the places the Heavenly Orchid Society controlled and brought them under the Maitreya Luminous Cult's umbrella, but...
‘That was less like proselytizing and more like a hostile takeover.’
He knew that even if the people from the brothels showed up to the meeting, they'd just be sitting there, scared stiff. Their motivation would be fear, not faith.
They couldn't hold a gathering with only people like that, which was partly why he’d conducted proselytization activities in the marketplace just like in Gulang County.
But that just created new problems.
Those coming from brothels and taverns would be terrified, while those lured in by honey traps or pretty-boy traps would arrive confused, not even knowing what the Maitreya Luminous Cult was.
It could be described as a situation where two groups with no commonalities would coexist.
He racked his brain for a way to unite these two clashing groups and break the horrible, awkward tension.
And Il-mok finally managed to find a solution.
"This is something only you can accomplish, Young Master Baek Cheon."
Namely, by utilizing the attention-seeker known as Baek Cheon.
“If it’s for the glory of the cult and to get me attention, I'll accomplish it no matter what it takes, Young Master!"
At Baek Cheon's firm answer, Il-mok smiled brightly.
"Then from now on, follow along with the song I'm about to sing and memorize the lyrics, melody, and rhythm."
The solution Il-mok had devised for unity.
“I’ve got peaace~ liiike~ a river. I’ve got peaace~ liiike~ a river.”
It was a church song.

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 199: Proselytization (3)
By the time Il-mok finished the song, Baek Cheon was looking at him with tears streaming down his face.
“I see now what a fool I’ve been, Young Master! To think I had the audacity to spread the greatness of the Divine Cult through theater and gain attention, yet never once thought of using songs. My vision was so small, so pathetic! I’m so ashamed I could cry!”
Which he was already doing. Then, he dramatically dropped to his knees.
“I knew you were a genius at martial arts and strategy, but I never dreamed you were a musical prodigy as well! I want to gouge out these eyes of mine for failing to recognize Young Master's talents."
"Ahem. Well, gouging out your eyes is a bit much." Il-mok cleared his throat awkwardly and turned his head away.
Getting praised for something he didn't even compose himself made him feel weird in various ways.
But, actually, that wasn't it at all.
'Why the hell are they looking at me like I'm even worse than this lunatic?'
The people watching from the sidelines were staring at Il-mok like he was the attention-seeker of the century.
Even Baek Cheon seemed to acknowledge him as being several levels above in their hierarchy, which made things even more uncomfortable.
'I'm not an attention-whore, damn it!'
The whole reason he was singing right now was to dump the singer role at the assembly onto Baek Cheon.
"Ahem. It just came to me by chance. Come on, you try it.”
"Yes, Young Master!"
Baek Cheon stood up with the face of someone who'd been entrusted with a historic mission, his eyes shining with a clear light as he stared intently at Il-mok.
'Ugh, this is uncomfortable.'
His eyes were already twinkling enough, but now they were getting misty too, which made Il-mok's skin crawl.
With a light sigh, Il-mok sang "Peace Like a River" one more time. Maybe because the song was simple, Baek Cheon managed to pick up the song without much difficulty.
Il-mok nodded, "Excellent. Then I'll teach you the next song as well."
Il-mok planned to teach him several hymns in addition to "Peace Like a River."
For Il-mok—or rather, for his past self, Seo Ji-hoon—church songs were surprisingly familiar.
It wasn't because he was a religious person. Seo Ji-hoon was a huge believer in work-life balance; the idea of giving up his Sundays for church was his personal definition of hell.
No, he knew hymns because he had survived a famously terrible time in a man's life. A special kind of hell that most South Korean men are forced to go through.
'Goddamn boot camp.'
And with that, Il-mok started to teach the song that had been mercilessly drilled into his head during that awful time.
“Through the dark of the night, through the pitch-black of night, we journey onward to the dawn!”
A song he’d picked up at Nonsan Training Center because he was starving for snacks at that time.
A song that boasted a club-like atmosphere.
Siloam.
"Oh Maitreya, we shall thank you. For giving us light."
After completing Nonsan Training Center, he continued going to church on weekends to get snacks and avoid harassment from his seniors. Thanks to that, several hymns were branded into his mind like scars.
Though it was a memory from nearly a decade ago, because it was his military days memory, it was stuck in one corner of his mind like PTSD and wouldn't go away.
He'd even heard hymns occasionally during his time working as a social welfare civil servant whenever he got involved with volunteer organizations.
One way or another, the organizations most closely related to volunteering were Christian and Catholic groups.
Maybe the tune was just that simple, or maybe Baek Cheon was just a natural, but he memorized Siloam just as fast as the first song.
‘Is this why they are so hard to erase from one’s memory?’
Hymns are designed to be sung by a big crowd of normal people, so they have to be catchy and easy to learn.
They were so catchy to the point where they got on the list of "songs you can't listen to during exam season" because they'd get stuck in your head forever.
He could already picture of future in his mind.
A scene where all the people of Lanzhou sang Siloam together.
After learning two hymns from Il-mok, Baek Cheon returned to his quarters and was singing those glorious songs again.
‘The Young Master could have easily sung these before the believers himself, yet he yielded the honor to me. This too is the Young Master’s grace!’
He saw it as nothing less than grace as vast as the heavens. And so Baek Cheon immersed himself in practice with the mindset of a prophet carrying a religious mission.
As he practiced his singing, a certain epiphany suddenly struck Baek Cheon's mind.
'Wait a minute?'
'Young Master told me to use songs to spread our Divine Cult’s graces far and wide. And at the Hall of the Demonic Way, he told me to spread the Divine Cult’s greatness through theater.'
As he recalled the two great missions Il-mok had bestowed upon him, he arrived at a shocking conclusion.
'Why am I doing them separately?'
And just like that, his imagination went into overdrive.
What if he depicted the great achievements of the past Heavenly Demons using the play, and at the most crucial moments of the play, sang magnificent songs with his majestic voice?
A scene emerged from his mind.
A scene where people were completely engrossed in his bewitching play, chanting his name and looking up at him with adoration.
Thud.
Before he knew it, he'd sat down on the floor in a meditative position, and inspiration overflowed in his mind like a bursting spring.
And in tune with that inspiration, the demonic energy of the Hundred Flower Demonic Art coiled in Baek Cheon's dantian escaped and began flowing through his limbs.
The side effect of the Hundred Flower Demonic Art was a pathological need to be the center of attention.
'Yes! And for the finale, I'll shower the stage with flower petals, scattering them like a storm of hidden weapons!'
'I've been trapped in narrow-minded thinking all this time! Just as I can mix theater and songs, there's no rule saying I must only execute the Three Forms with the Feather Arrow Needles!'
While pondering ways to draw more attention, Baek Cheon gained even greater enlightenment about martial arts.
The next morning.
"Young Master! Young Master!"
The familiar voice of a madman coming from outside the door made Il-mok sigh and get up.
"Come in."
As soon as Il-mok's voice fell, Baek Cheon, Dam Bin, and Hyeokryeon Seon-ah, who'd been standing guard, entered the room.
"Why are you raising hell—I mean, why the commotion so early in the morning?"
Il-mok had unintentionally blurted out his true feelings in his drowsiness, but it didn't register in the energetic Baek Cheon's ears. Not that it mattered, Baek Cheon had always been the type to only hear what he wanted to hear anyway.
"Last night, this Baek Cheon came to understand Young Master's great intention."
"???"
Il-mok wondered what nonsense this was now, but before he could ask, Baek Cheon suddenly bowed to him.
“First, you told me to spread the word through plays. Now, you’ve told me to spread the word through song. It all makes sense! Your real plan was for me to combine them!”
"......"
Il-mok frowned.
'A play that combines songs and acting... so he's invented the musical theater?'
This crazy bastard had somehow managed to create the world's first musical drama.
'Then again, opera and pansori are also forms of musical theater, but does this world have opera or pansori? If they do exist, this would be a perfect opportunity to send this crazy bastard abroad to learn them.'
But then he thought that getting rid of the madman was probably the more urgent priority. Right after finishing spreading the hymns in Lanzhou, that is.
Unaware of Il-mok’s plan, Baek Cheon continued rambling.
"While realizing Young Master's deep intention and swimming in an ocean of inspiration, this Baek came to understand. Since all the rivers return to the sea, all these realizations are also connected to the Hundred Flower Demonic Art that I've learned. Thanks to Young Master's teachings, this Baek one has broken through a barrier!"
Baek Cheon then repeatedly bowed as if ready to split his forehead on the floor.
At that devout posture, Dam Bin and Hyeokryeon Seon-ah, who were watching from the side, also showed surprised expressions.
“I’d heard the rumors that people get stronger just by being around you, Young Master, but I never imagined you taught him songs with such intention. Incredible."
"As expected of Big Brother! Teach me something, too! I’m ready! I’ll learn anything!”
Now that all three of them were looking at him like he was some kind of god, Il-mok just gave a weak cough. “Uh, that really wasn’t my intention.”
For some reason, it felt as though he himself was being lumped into the same category as Baek Cheon.
"Hohoho. You're even being humble about it."
“You truly are the greatest!”
They just would not believe him.
"Haah..."
Il-mok let out a deep sigh and gave up.
The next evening, at a riverbank just outside the city.
In a somewhat dark place a short distance away from the washing spot where housewives did laundry during the day, countless people had gathered there.
About two-thirds of them gave off an atmosphere of being tense and trembling with fear, while the remaining third harbored feelings of excitement or bewilderment.
The tense and fearful ones were people from brothels and taverns, while the excited or bewildered ones were people who'd been lured by the honey trap and missionary work and had come out of curiosity. ᴛʜɪs ᴄʜᴀᴘᴛᴇʀ ɪs ᴜᴘᴅᴀᴛᴇ ʙʏ novel(ꜰ)ire.net
The groups with completely different atmospheres couldn't mix at all, their only common point being that they kept looking around as if searching for someone.
And in that unsettled atmosphere, someone revealed themselves.
"Today, I wish to deliver benevolent messages to all the believers who have come to our Maitreya Luminous Cult's gathering."
The speaker was a middle-aged man wearing a mask of a wrathful deity. It was none other than the Branch Leader of the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult's Lanzhou Branch.
The people from brothels and taverns who knew of the Maitreya Luminous Cult's existence looked at him with tense faces, while those lured by the honey trap looked at him with faces full of questions.
'Maitreya Luminous Cult?'
'Benevolent messages?'
'What's he talking about?'
In the midst of this, the Branch Leader's sermon began.
“We are the Maitreya Luminous Cult! We are the ones who wait for the coming of the great savior, Maitreya, who will purge this wicked world and save us all! And I tell you now, the savior is close! For Incarnations of Maitreya has already come to Lanzhou and wiped the filth of the Heavenly Orchid Society from our city! This is the sign we have been waiting for!”
Hearing that the Heavenly Orchid Society had been taken out by some kind of divine being, the curious people in the crowd started whispering excitedly.
In that unsettled atmosphere, the Branch Leader cried out.
“And now, to begin, let us sing together a song to honor the Incarnations of Maitreya who descended for our sake and fought against the wicked."
As soon as his words ended, Baek Cheon stepped forward.
He wasn't even wearing a mask.
As a wave of whispers went through the crowd at the sight of his handsome face, Baek Cheon felt a jolt of pure ecstasy as if he'd immediately ascend to heaven.
"The song you will sing with me today is 'We Shall Fight Against the Wicked.’”
Like the true attention hog he is, Baek Cheon boldly declared and began singing.
Following "Peace Like a River" and "Siloam," there was another hymn he'd learned from Il-mok.
"Mine eyes have seen the glory of the coming of the Lord; He is trampling out the vintage where the grapes of wrath are stored."
A hymn that Il-mok thought might align most closely with the doctrine of the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult.
“He has sounded forth the trumpet that shall never call retreat; He is sifting out the hearts of men before His judgment-seat…”
A song so simple and famous that even people who didn't know hymns would know at least its chorus.
“GLOOORY! GLORY! MAITREYA CUULT! GLOOORY! GLORY! MAITREYA CUULT!”
The hymn known as "The Battle Hymn of the Republic."

novel_title: So, Did Someone Force You to Become the Heavenly Demon
content:
Chapter 200: Proselytization (4)
While Baek Cheon belted out the hymn with crystal-clear eyes radiating magnificence, everyone gathered at the rally was showing lukewarm reactions at best.
Which made perfect sense. The whole thing was out of the blue, and the song was totally new to them.
But Baek Cheon wasn't the type to get swept up in that kind of atmosphere.
What mattered to him was simply the fact that everyone was looking at him.
Without batting an eye, he started singing the first verse of ‘We Shall Fight the Wicked.’
He had no choice. Il-mok wasn't a genuine Christian believer, so even with famous hymns, he only knew the first verse.
And the moment his song reached the chorus again—
“Glo~ ry! Glory! O’ Divine Cult!!”
“Glo~ ry! Glory! O’ Divine Cult!!”
And just like that, a few voices from the crowd started echoing the ridiculously catchy chorus.
These were the people Il-mok had planted. More precisely, members of the Heavenly Demon Divine Cult's branch.
Just like the saying "three men make a tiger," humans were naturally prone to getting swept up in the surrounding atmosphere.
"It's a weird song, I'll give you that."
“But isn’t it quite catchy?”
"Oddly uplifting, I'd say."
The hymn was so insanely catchy that it made even those who knew nothing and just showed up to the gathering feel their lips itching to join in.
“Glo~ ry! Glory! O’ Divine Cult!!”
“Glo~ ry! Glory! O’ Divine Cult!!”
By the third round of the chorus, everyone had started singing along with excited faces.
Meanwhile...
Sitting leisurely on a tree branch some distance from the rally location, Il-mok let out a soft sigh as he watched the intensely religious scene unfold.
He'd wanted to leave the gathering in someone else's hands and rest at the branch, but in the end, he had no choice but to secretly come to the gathering site.
It was because of his obsessive tendencies. Delegating work to others was fine, but he needed to check things with his own eyes at least once to feel at ease.
'Good thing I came.'
And thanks to that compulsion, Il-mok gained a small harvest.
It wasn't that the hymn was a bigger hit than he’d thought.
It was that there were a bunch of filthy, grime-caked beggars mixed in with the crowd.
"Tch. So the Beggar Gang’s rats already caught wind of this."
And not just any beggars, but beggars who'd learned martial arts.
The Nine Sects and One Gang, and the Seven Great Families—these were the major powers of the Central Plains. Among the Nine Sects and One Gang, the "One Gang" referred to the Beggar Gang.
The Beggar Gang, counted as one of the Central Plains martial world's colossal forces, was exactly what its name suggested: a gathering of beggars.
Originally, the Beggar Gang wasn't created by beggars who learned martial arts. Rather, it was formed when someone who'd learned martial arts protected beggars.
In the past, during an era of war when the rulers of the Central Plains changed one after another, countless beggars appeared throughout the land. A certain chivalrous warrior decided to start protecting them, and the whole thing grew from there.
He was called the Founding Ancestor of the Beggar Gang. The martial arts he passed down to the beggars so they could protect themselves, along with his noble intentions, were transmitted through generations, naturally forming the organization known as the Beggar Gang.
But despite the Founding Ancestor's noble intentions and efforts, even after hundreds of years had passed, countless beggars still wandered throughout the world. Before anyone knew it, the Beggar Gang had transformed into one of the Central Plains' biggest intelligence organizations.
Since you can find beggars literally everywhere, they became the perfect spies. They'd collect all the gossip and intel they overheard while begging, package it up, sell it for cash, and use the profits to feed their own.
Of course, Lanzhou, the capital of Gansu, was crawling with beggars as well and had a branch of Beggar Gang to look after them.
“The hell you sayin’?”
The question came from Hong Gae, the Five-Knot Beggar who served as a Branch Leader in Lanzhou. A young, three-knot beggar sighed before answering him.
"Are your ears clogged too now? I'm saying the Heavenly Orchid Society is over!"
At the Three-Knot disciple's attitude that showed zero promise, Hong Gae smacked the back of the young beggar's head and said:
"Did you trade away all your manners for taffy now? That’s how you're talking to your boss?"
"They say if you starve for five days, even the Emperor won’t be different from a beggar. You think I care about being polite to a Branch Leader?” His eyes were practically glittering with murderous intent.
The Three-Knot Beggar’s response made Hong Gae's face turn beet red like his name.
(TL Note: Hong Gae literally means red beggar.)
"Get good and beg better, kid! Blame your own scary-ass face. Who the hell do you think you're talking back to?"
"Is this about my face right now? The whole damn neighborhood's a shitshow, and it’s all because of that goddamn Heavenly Orchid Society!”
The Branch Leader clicked his tongue.
The kid had a point.
There's an old saying: it's easy to be kind when your own pantry is full. Thanks to the Heavenly Orchid Society's evil bullshit, the people of Lanzhou were anything but kind.
Just like the saying "generosity comes from full granaries," thanks to the Heavenly Orchid Society's vicious deeds, the people's goodwill in Lanzhou had hit rock bottom.
Most people were too busy trying to survive themselves, so those willing to give alms to beggars could be counted on one hand.
But the real reason the Three-Knot Beggar was furious wasn't because he'd failed at begging.
He was mad because he felt useless, watching the whole city go to hell and being completely unable to stop it.
He'd been a beggar his whole life, but he'd joined the gang and learned to fight because he wanted to do good.
But he never got the chance to use his skills here.
That's because it was impossible for the local beggars to win against the Heavenly Orchid Society. Even Hong Gae, a Five-Knot Beggar and Branch Leader, fell far short of the Heavenly Orchid Society's leader in skill.
To cleanly eliminate the Heavenly Orchid Society without casualties, the Sect Leader or an Eight-Knot Elder would need to step in, but they were too busy with affairs elsewhere to spare attention for Gansu.
The Central Plains were simply too vast, and within the Central Plains, Gansu Province was a backwater.
In that sense, the Heavenly Orchid Society's leader was pretty damn clever. While selling women and doing all sorts of trashy shit, he didn't touch the beggars.
He wanted to avoid incurring the Beggar Gang's wrath by messing with beggars.
You could almost call it a twisted kind of partnership. After all, the Heavenly Orchid Society was in the business of ruining lives and creating new beggars.
Of course, with his youthful hot-headedness combined with overflowing righteousness, the Three-Knot Beggar was itching to go up against the Heavenly Orchid Society even if it meant his own death. But he couldn't dare challenge the Heavenly Orchid Society's leader.
It was because of the middle-aged beggar standing right before him, Branch Leader Hong Gae.
There was an order from the Sect Leader to keep an eye on things in Gansu and told them not to throw their lives away for a stupid reason.
The order came around a year ago and basically told them to keep their heads down and be even more miserable if possible.
Seeing the young beggar simmering with a year's worth of suppressed anger, the Branch Leader changed his tactic and spoke as if consoling him.
"Well, at least now you won't have to worry about food for a while."
"Why? Because the Heavenly Orchid Society is gone?”
"Yeah."
"But what if the bastards who took down the Heavenly Orchid Society are even worse? Wouldn’t we be totally screwed for good then?”
"Ugh, you ignorant fool."
“Hey, we’re both beggars. It’s not like either of us went to school.”
As the young disciple grumbled, Hong Gae shot back with a smirk.
“People can be smart even if they didn’t go to school, you little shit. The kind of people who can wipe out the Heavenly Orchid Society in a single day are either some secret masters who’ve been hiding out or a whole new group, correct? Don’t you think the headquarters would pay good money for info on people like that?”
"Ah!!"
When the young beggar finally understood what the Branch Leader meant, Hong Gae grinned. A smile with yellowed teeth and dirt streaming down. Newest update provıded by N()velFire.net
"Let's use this opportunity to get some money from headquarters and feed our guys some meat soup for once."
By morning on the day the Heavenly Orchid Society fell, collapsed, a special order had gone out to every beggar in Lanzhou.
A directive to obtain information on the individual or group that had destroyed the Heavenly Orchid Society, along with a very enticing bait of stewed meat soup if they got their info correct.
But beggars aren't idiots. In fact, living on the streets had made them experts at reading the lines in between.
They didn't make the stupid mistake of running around asking people about whoever took down the Heavenly Orchid Society. Instead, they just did their own thing. Begging on the streets, inducing pity from housewives washing near the downstream, and hanging around taverns or brothels.
They just begged all over Lanzhou, and kept their ears open.
And the countless bits of information the beggars picked up were passed to the Beggar Gang disciples, who organized that information and passed it back to the Branch Leader.
"So these Maitreya Luminous Cult bastards took out the Heavenly Orchid Society?"
“Yep. That’s the word on the street, at least in the red-light district. The rumor’s everywhere over there.”
"So where's their base?"
“No idea.”
"What?"
Hong Gai looked baffled, but the Three-Knot disciple answered shamelessly.
“They took credit for sacking the Heavenly Orchid Society and took over the red-light district, but they never said where they were staying. It’s all just talk right now. They just told everyone to show up for a gathering tonight and then disappeared.”
Then, the kid’s eyes lit up as if he’d just remembered something.
“Oh! And they killed all the brothel owners who talked back.”
"All of them?"
"Yes."
“...Sounds like they’re even bigger monsters than the Heavenly Orchid Society.”
"They seemed like good guys to me though?"
Hearing that, Hong Gai’s face twisted in disgust.
"Did all that begging finally rot your brain?"
“What? They killed the bad guys! We got a word from Gulang just now, and it said they wiped out the Black Path’s scums over there. Red Serpent Gang or something. Then they gave all their money away to the townspeople.”
“Gave the money away?”
"Yes. So like, what was it? They said that if you just believe in and follow their doctrine, then one day Maitreya will come down to earth, all the evil people will die, and the good people will see the light. Something like that was their doctrine anyway."
"So they're the type who help good people and kill all the bad ones?"
“Yeah. See? They’re the good guys!"
“You goddamn idiot.”
In the end, Hong Gae couldn't hold back and smacked the back of the Three-Knot disciple's head.
“Hey! I’m already light-headed from hunger. Why do you keep hitting my head, you f—... for what reason, sir!”
Hong Gai knew the kid had been about to say "fucker" or something similar before catching himself, but he decided to let it slide.
He just let out a light sigh.
'The doctrine itself sounds fine, but these guys are bad news.’
He was old and he’d been a beggar for decades. Throughout his few decades of life, Hong Gae learned a thing or two, and his gut was telling him something about this.
He knew that just because a group has a pretty face doesn’t mean it isn’t rotten to the core.
Especially since several of the Central Plains' major orthodox sects were like that.
“You said the gathering is tonight? Where?”
That night.
Hong Gae followed the info from other beggars and went to the location of the Maitreya Luminous Cult's assembly.
He’d ordered all the regular beggars to stay away and led only himself and the Beggar Gang martial artists.
It was just in case things went south. He didn't want a bunch of civilians getting slaughtered for nothing.
He scanned the area and opened his qi perception to the max as if he wouldn't miss even the slightest detail.
First up was some guy in a wrathful deity mask, who started spouting some weird sermon.
“We are the Maitreya Luminous Cult! We are the ones who wait for the coming of the great savior, Maitreya, who will purge this wicked world and save us all!
Following that, a young man who did not even bother to cover his face stepped forward and began to sing.
‘You’ve got to be kidding me.’
Hong Gae could barely keep a straight face as he watched the pretty boy singing.
‘That much power at his age?!’
The kid looked like he was barely twenty. He was so young you couldn't even really call him one of the rising stars yet, but his cultivation was easily on the same level as Hong Gae himself, a Five-Knot Beggar.
'...He's on par with the Seven Dragons and Two Phoenix.'
He couldn't help but think of the nine rising stars of the new generation who'd been making the biggest waves in the Central Plains recently.
While Hong Gae hid his surprise internally, realizing that the Maitreya Luminous Cult’s power was no joke, the gathering’s atmosphere had completely changed.
One by one, people started singing along.
'What is this? Brainwashing?'
The song was so damn catchy that it put him even more on edge. He glanced around to check his surroundings and immediately shut his eyes shut.
“Glo~ ry! Glory! O’ Divine Cult!!”
Because the young beggars are singing along more enthusiastically than anyone else.
